story:
YESSR Magazine is an independent publication, that features the photographic work of chilean photographer Felipe Bracelis. 5 issues have been brought to life to date, which have been featured in different museums, books stores and art book fairs, such as Tate modern's book shop and The Vancouver Art Book Fair. 

YESSR Magazine is one of South America's most noted male nude/landscape publication, and in it's short running it gathered a loyal and enthusiastic list of followers and readers.

Unfortunately last year we stopped publishing because we couldn't keep having a convenient price for our supporters and making a high quality product for them, so instead of bringing up prices, the desition of freezing the project was made.

In the present we are looking for enough funding to start publishing 100% truly independently, by acquiring a printer, a good stock of paper and inks, buying a second camera and hiring two more members to our staff for an starting period of 6 months, making this one man show into a dinamic and proactive threesome.

We are also looking to diversify, including the work of other talented chilean and latin american photographers in future issues, making it more conceptual and closer to an art book, with one publication every 3 or 4 months.

I believe in the power that art has to engage with other people, to inspire, and to make connections between individuals and ideas, and I want to rearticulate and reactivate YESSR Magazine to bring back it's unique voice expressed in pictures.

story:
Hello all you fire loving humans! This year we are bringing The Grasshopper back to the playa for another crazy fire filled week! We are a few folks that have a love for propane and burning it for the masses. The Grasshopper underwent a huge upgrade last year adding over 5000 LED lights, and a complete rebuild of the propane fill system. This year we have been working hard to yet again upgrade the propane system. This includes 3 New flame effects and buttons to push!!  With that, we are slated to burn much more propane this year than in years past. 

We're looking to raise 2,800 dollars to help with the cost of propane. 

700 gallons x appx. $4.00gal = $2800.00

We're not in a position to offer any gifts other than big fire all night every night for the fine citizens of Black Rock City.  Feel free to find us and push some buttons and warm yourself up.

To give everyone an idea of the amount of fuel we use-

1 pull on the big valve with a full tank is about 10 bucks. It adds up quick!

We're excited to have some buttons for everyone to push this year. Come find us out on the playa.

Last year we burned through a fair amount of fuel with just the 1 cannon. This year we will have a bit more fuel capacity and running 3 additional flame effects.  

We appreciate every dollar donated! It all goes towards the propane bill. Thank You!

If we don't reach our goal we will still use any funds that we raise towards our fuel bill that we (I) come home to. If we're lucky enough to surpass this years goal, all extra funds will go towards the Grasshopper upgrades.


Thank You! 

Please Share this page with all of your other fire loving friends.

story:
For almost 8 years the Athletic Playground has provided a happy home for playful movement practices of all kinds. Acrobats, aerialists, acroyogis, dancers, traceurs and traceuses, jugglers, and more have found not only a space to train and play, but also a vibrant and supportive community.

While our community is thriving, the quality and quantity of aerial equipment at Athletic Playground hasn’t kept pace with the aerialists themselves! For example, we’re ready to offer classes in straps and rope, but can’t do so until we get our hands on some straps and ropes. Our aluminum swivels are nearing the end of their lifespans, and we want to replace them with steel swivels, which last longer and rarely need to be replaced. We also want to provide our aerial silks students with some new fabrics, and finally, so that the quality of our trapezes can match the quality of our trapeze instructors and students, we need to do some re-roping and put new elbows on our trapezes.

With your support, we will provide our students and teachers with equipment as high-flying, diverse, and durable as they are. Our aerialists play hard and deserve gear to match their gumption. Thank you for your donation-hope to see you in the air!


Where the $ goes!

We’re aiming high to both upgrade our current equipment and buy new types of equipment (ropes, lyra, straps) to expand our program and offer new classes. We realize that this is a LOFTY objective and it might seem hard to SWING it, but with your help we can BEAT our goal! We’ve prioritized our aerial needs based on vitality, and we’ll acquire the gear sequentially as we reach the following dollar amounts:

1. 17 steel swivels - $1,205 (total $1,205 raised)

2. Re-roping trapezes - $530 (total $1,735 raised)

3. 4 straps - $2,640 (total $4,375 raised)

4. 4 ropes - $1,760 (total $6,135 raised)

5. 4 fabrics  - $524 (total $6,659 raised)

6. 2 lyras - $946 (total $7,605 raised)


Perks!


If you help us out, we'll give you awesome gifts! Depending on how much you donate, you could get anything from a refreshing coconut water to five years of unlimited membership!

story:
I'm an artist from New York. 

For the last decade I've been designing a way address the issue of lead in soil and the invasive carp in the Midwest. This year, I'm kicking off my project with a spectacular fishing performance. I'm making a subsonic speaker to scare these jumping fish out of the water and a suit that will catch them. 

And did I mention this is a fishing tournament? And I won't have a fishing pole. Just a motor boat, sound system, and suit
I'm filming this in PANORAMIC & 3D. 

Why am I catching fish? 
Great question.
Fish bones have been found to bond with lead molecules and make them not absorbable by our bodies. By using invasive fish, I'll be solving two problems at once.   

The only issue is that lead pollution is not really near the place I'm fishing. So I'll be shipping the fish bones from Illinois to polluted neighborhoods in New York  where the fish bones will help reduce the toxicity of lead in soil. It's science. Trust me.
(Or just google "fish bones lead pollution" after you're done reading my campaign)


THIS YEAR, I'm focusing just on the performance, competition and making friends with the community of Bath, IL. Good folks out there. I want to hit the water with a splash and give this project the momentum it deserves. 

With your support, I can amplify the event to reach more lives, catch more fish, and clean more soil!

Make Art | Catch Invasive Fish | Clean Urban Soil



What We Need & What You Get

Funding goes to this stage of materials, shipping, and rentals

  • Life Vest
  • Protective suit
  • Helmet
  • Car Rental to get to Bath from airport
  • Boat Rental
  • Shipping the fish bones to NYC
  • Shipping & Cost of testing soil at Brooklyn College
  • Transporting & Integrating fish bones into soil

Every additional $500 will fund me to fish 1 day and ship the bones to where they can be used. Meaning, once my goal is reached, if I go over before I leave, I'll change my flight date to fish after the tournament is over. 


The Impact

There's a lot of lead in our environment. Unfortunately, there isn't much responsibility taken by the EPA. At the same time invasive carp are threatening the biodiversity of rivers in the Midwest all the way up to the Great Lakes. This project aims to highlight a way to solve problems.

Your contribution will turn a fun weekend of fishing into a MASSIVE effort to make real change in the lives, neighborhoods, and world in which we live.

Using technologies I worked with in 2011 and 2013, I'm certain that this performance will not only be amazing to watch, but that lots of fish will be caught.

Working with experts in the fields of soil science, waste management, renewable resources, fisheries and art, this project aims high.



Risks & Challenges

The obstacles that are facing this project are cost of shipping and time to fish. Exposure is also a huge issue. PLEASE SHARE!

Pollution is a national issue and sometimes it seems so huge we don't know what to do as just an individual. With more adequate funding I can get more fish out of the water and ship their bones to sites that have been identified as hazardous.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please SHARE this project

  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Email

Join the mailing list!


Thank you for your time and interest.

DHPD

story:
Resident DJ Turkey is leading the hunt for affordable, quality speakers. After some research, we have estimated that we could find them used for approximately $600.

100% of the funds raised will be used for the purchase of speakers.

story:
Artist of a Thousand Ideas

My name is Amelia Fais Harnas, and as of late, my most easily notable artistic foray has been portraits made with wine stains. At my core, however, I am brimming with all sorts of wild ideas on how to go about life as creatively as possible. I find it difficult to stay in one place for very long or go through the motions or take something at face value.

My collaborator, Mark Frederick Hibbard, will assist in procuring materials and hiding the treasures. Mark, a jack of all trades, excels in all things music and sports top-notch man-buns.

We need to drive across the country in September for very straightforward and practical matters (to empty out & bring back storage from Vancouver, WA). 

We would rather drive across the country with the focus on a new artistic foray that spreads art, poetry, and music in a way that makes people happy.

The Secret Service Project

When you fund this project, you are basically signing up to receive artsy treasure via the Secret Service: 

  • We can hide treasure for you in the city where you live.
  • We can hide treasure in a city you are traveling to in the near future.
  • We can hide treasure for someone else on your behalf.

Funding goes towards:

  • Supplies and time spent on creating and hiding the treasure, and
  • Some (but not all) of the costs of the cross-country drive.

The Route

PLEASE NOTE: We can only hide treasures in cities located on our route, as follows:
Corning, NY; Cleveland, OH; Columbus, OH; Indianapolis, IN; St. Louis, MO; Kansas City, MO; Topeka, KS; Denver, CO; Monument Valley; Grand Canyon; Las Vegas, NV; Yosemite; Bay Area; Redwoods; Cape Lookout, OR; Portland, OR; Boise, ID; Yellowstone; Devil's Tower; Badlands; Spencer, IA; Chicago, IL.

Excitement, Mystery, Adventure, and Magic

The Secret Service is a way for folks to remember how much fun it is to play like kids again, going on adventures and finding hidden treasure. Heck, if you have kids and want them to get in on it, then it's for kids who want to keep being kids!

You will get GPS coordinates & a photo of the general area of the hiding spot. So, in this sense, yes, it's a lot like geocaching, but it's your treasure to keep (which you can't do with geocaching).

Risk & Intrigue

What if someone else finds your treasure first? 

  • I will include a personalized slip in the container stating that it is meant for a specific person (you) and asking the unintended finder to leave the treasure as they found it. So yes, we will both need faith in humanity.
What if you can't find it?
  • I will try my darnedest to make the container as airtight as possible, so that it can sit in its spot safely for a good long time. If you're going nuts because you really can't find it, simply contact me, and I'll give you more specific directions.
What if the treasure is really seriously gone?
  • We'll talk about it and figure out together what would be a manageable and fair consolation treasure.

Spread the Love

  • Do you know someone who lives in one of the cities listed above? Tell them about this project!

Thanks!

story:
Project Summary

Ambridge Junior High School is searching for awesome community members that believe in the arts, education, and the youth of the community to help us raise funds to create a ceramic mosaic mural with Pittsburgh Center for the Arts’ Teaching Artist Laura Jean McLaughlin partnering with Art Teacher Jamie Zbrzezny and her students for a 20-day Artist Residency Project.

What’s an Artist Residency Project, you ask? Well, the best way to find out is to check out the video above created by last year’s participating students. See how the students incorporated their own designs into the amazing mural that is now on display at the school!

Read on for more info…

Project Goals

The goal of this year’s project is for art students to design and create a collaborative mosaic that will illustrate the student’s ideas about the history of the Ambridge area and their thoughts and feelings about the community and school. 

Students will learn not only from the hands-on processes of designing and making the mural, but they will also:

  •  learn about the history of clay and mosaics from around the world and in the Pittsburgh area-Social Studies and Art History
  • be able to incorporate personal memorabilia into the mosaic…leaving a legacy behind at their school!
  • connect the art process with Math skills through measuring, cutting and preparing the mural to be installed
  • learn new vocabulary that relates to art, ceramics and history
  • learn real-life skills such as laying tile and grouting (…just think how that could help around the house!)

Project Rationale

Why are the arts important for students’ education?

The arts are proven to stimulate and enhance student performance in all curriculum areas and to encourage the development of improved self-image and empowerment.  The arts provide opportunities for:

  • Imagination and creativity to flow
  • Communication and problem-solving skills to grow
  • Self-directed intrinsic motivation to be engendered
  • Teamwork to be encouraged and appreciated
  • Diverse thinking to take place
  • Individuality to excel
  • Positive self-expression to evolve

An Artist Residency Project is designed to have lasting benefits for all participants:

·  students are fully immersed in an art form and see how it connects to life and learning

·  teachers are exposed to alternative ways of experiencing/sharing the creative process and what it brings to their classrooms

·  administrators realize the ways in which the arts fully engage students and impact their learning across the curriculum

·  teaching artists are artistically reinvigorated through the collaborative creative process 

Artist Residency Projects take place in partnership with schools and communities throughout Allegheny, Beaver, Greene and Washington counties in Pennsylvania by School & Community Programs at Pittsburgh Filmmakers/Pittsburgh Center for the Arts in partnership with the PA Council on the Arts.

 PCA and the Ambridge Junior High

PCA has been an amazing influence and support to Ms. Zbrzezny and her art students.  The continued relationship allows for student growth in relating to the arts. This means the kids can reap all the benefits that come along with an emergence of art and culture.  When students visit Pittsburgh Center for the Arts they have the chance to interact with professionals and engage in educated discussion about art, artists, and culture.  Watching the students go through the galleries at PCA is awesome you can see enlightenment wash over their faces.  The entire process and partnership is priceless.


Below you will find a breakdown of costs to better understand what your funding will help to pay for:

20 day Artist Residency Cost Summary:

TA Fee = $4,000

PCA Support Funding = ($2,000)

10% Admin  = $400

Materials = $1,500

Cost to AJHS = $3,900 


Thank you for supporting this great project at Ambridge Junior High School!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Chris Komer. I'm a freelance musician in New York City, and also the founder and director of the Artists' Refuge at Thunderhead in Montana. Thunderhead is located near Hughesville, Montana which is so small it is not on most maps.   Hughesville is an historic  mining town that is surrounded by the Lewis and Clark National Forest in the Little Belt Mountains. It's about an hour and a half southeast of Great Falls, Montana. I founded the project in 2007, in hopes of creating a place where artists of all types can gather to build a community, collaborate, and rejuvenate in the mountains. So far we've had over 100 artists come through, and among those were musicians, painters, builders, a yoga master, actors, dancers, etc. What is truly special about Thunderhead is that WE the artists and creatives that have gotten involved are building it ourselves using alternative building methods and the resources available on our 60-acres. For those that get involved with our project, a typical day may be spent building, clearing trails, hiking, fishing, drawing, recreating with a game of whiffle ball or horseshoes, playing music around a campfire and counting shooting stars. 

Currently on our land, we have a beautiful cordwood cabin with a living roof (a roof with 6 inches of dirt and grass and plants and flowers growing on top), a cordwood shower house, a camper trailer, a mobile home a small storage barn, and lots of wide open space. Our next project is to build a 2-storey round cordwood structure to be used as a commons, where people can gather, cook in the communal kitchen, make art, play music, and do all sorts of activities. 

AND THIS IS WHAT WE NEED YOUR HELP WITH

A commons will be instrumental in taking Thunderhead to the next level.  Although Thunderhead is only open in the summertime right now a commons will help us begin the journey to making Thunderhead a year-round operation.


We are planning on doing it in 3 stages, and this summer, we're hoping to raise enough money to put in the foundation for the structure and to buy a portable sawmill, so we can begin milling structural timbers from some of our 30-acres of lodgepole pine trees. All of this will cost us about $17,000 which includes some funds for operating expenses for this summer. This project really needs your support right now, so Thunderhead can continue to grow and allow more people to enjoy our budding community - a community that you're invited to become a part of as well. 

So this is how you can help:
Artist friends of Thunderhead have generously donated some wonderful paintings, drawings, sculptures, and mixed media art pieces; and some of our musician friends have donated tracks and albums of their music to help the project; including a compilation album of a number of musicians.  We also are offering some gorgeous log bed frames and some really neat all natural wood guitar and mandolin stands as well as a short stay in our adorable cordwood cabin.

If you donate in any amount, you immediately become part of our community, and we will keep you up to date on all the latest Thunderhead news (if you like) and you can also get some cool stuff made by some of our Thunderhead artists.

We'd really appreciate your support for this project, and we need your help to spread the word as well. Tell your friends and family about it, 'like' our Facebook page, or simply come out this summer and check it out for yourself!

If you want to know more about Thunderhead,  you can check out our website: www.thunderheadrefuge.com

Thank you so much and hope to see you in the mountains some day!


Here is a short video of a virtual tour of Thunderhead via an aerial drone:


This is a wall in our cordwood cabin.   


Here is a short video showing work on our new shower house that was done just a week ago using time lapse photography!



Here is a short video of an ATV ride at Thunderhead with camera mounted to the front:



Here is a short youtube video demonstrating cordwood construction.






What We Need

$10,245 for the foundation  (see below)

$4,094 portable saw mill  (see below)

$2,665 operating expenses for this summer (see below)


What You Get

THE MUSIC

$8


Download of Vivian Li's White Moose Crossing a trio for Horn, Violin and Piano
(A Tribute to Bill Monroe)

Thunderhead member Vivian Li is a marvelous composer (and mandolinist)
and this is her debut recording.   It is part Stravinsky, part Bluegrass, part Jazz
but all melded together for a unique sound that is all Li. 


$10

Compilation Download of Thunderhead Affiliated Musical Artists

featuring the music of:

Gordon Webster  

The Burning River Brass

Craig Wuepper

Les Rogers  

Vivian Li

Louise Dubin

Marta Topferova

Bob Sabin

Elizabeth Suh-Lane

Chris Komer  

and others....


$15

Travlin' Music   CD
(folk songs, ballads and improvisations)
Chris Komer   solo piano  

(this is the music playing in the background of the video)


$15

Cimbasso D'Amore  CD

Andrew Bove Cimbasso

No this is not a new fangled bazooka it is a Cimbasso, (what you get when a tuba and a bass trombone mate) and my friend Andy plays it like no one else!

Featuring the music of Cinema Paradiso, O sole mio, and other romantic songs and backed by a beautiful chamber orchestra Andy makes this instrument sing like the songs were written for the Cimbasso and not opera divas.  

sample it here:

http://www.amazon.com/Cimbasso-DAmore-Andrew-Bove/dp/B005Q6FB9I

Andy is donating 5 of his CD's for the cause. 


$15

Bach Aria Soloists   Hausmusik   CD

My very good friend Elizabeth Suh-Lane has generously donated 5 of her  Hausmusik CD's for the cause.   She is an awesome violinist (she played with the London Symphony for many years) and her group is fantastic!!

She has donated 5 CD's


$15

Storytelling CD

Jazz drummer extraordinaire and Thunderhead friend Craig Wuepper's latest CD featuring the late jazz piano legend Harry Whitaker.

Also features Dave Schnitter on saxophone and Pat O'Leary on Bass


$20

Classical Impressions

Burning River Brass

This amazing 12-piece brass and percussion ensemble has 6 beautiful CD's out and they are donating 10 of their latest to help out Thunderhead. 


THE ART


Gianfranco Caruso      Painter/musician      Cesano, Lombardia, Italy

Gianfranco, an old friend of mine, did this painting especially for our campaign! 

He calls it  "Journey by Chris"    ....beautiful!  Check out the hot-air balloon!

$410    40cm x 20cm    (unframed)  acrylic on canvas



Sonja Moser        Painter/musician      Cairo, Egypt

Vienna born Sonja Moser has lived and studied art all over the world and currently resides in Cairo.  We became friends when she lived in NYC.  She also plays a mean jazz piano.

Check out some of her other works at:   http://sonjamoserstudio.blogspot.com/


Suspenders

15cm x 15cm    $160 (unframed)


Garbage Man

15cm x 15cm  $160  (unframed)


Taxis

30cm x 13cm  $190  (unframed)


Couch Man

30cm x 30cm  $340 (unframed)


The Waiter

35cm x 26cm  $390 (unframed)


Jill Torberson          Weld Artist     Portland, Oregon

Jill and I actually played french horn together in high school (in Kansas)

And were able to reconnect after 20+ years.  She is now a full-time artist working  mainly with metals and welding techniques.  I think her stuff is so beautiful and interesting AND she is still playing french horn!  Check out her website at  www.jilltorberson.com

Here are the pieces she is donating

#1  Violin $340  (34"x 18")


#2 Hanging pair  (Each are 3' 5" tall, 1' wide, 1" deep) $395

#3   28" welded steel   Deco  $375

#4 Steel Tumbleweed  (1 foot Diameter) $270 


Set of 6 mixed media  on galvanized steel  $1395

Each are 20" tall 12" wide




Brianna Schumacher    Denver, Colorado

Currently a student at the Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design,
Brianna (my niece) has been to Thunderhead many times and assisted us greatly in building the cordwood masonry cabin and showerhouse. 
She has generously donated this gorgeous mixed media painting.

 $335      (unframed)  Approx.  40" x 15" 


Paul Mulik     Pysanky artist  (and musician)    Joplin, Missouri

Pysanky (singular: pysanka) is a centuries-old art form which originated in Eastern Europe. The designs are written on the shell with melted wax and the eggs are dipped in various colors of dye.   Also a great tubist and euphonium player, (and killer piano technician) Paul has generously donated one of his amazing eggs!
 
Pysanka decorated hen's egg



$50   (includes stand)



Brian McNulty    Photographer

these are all approximately 60cm x 40cm and have been donated by Dorina Markoff. 

BIKE     $115 framed

CARS    $115  framed

AIRCONDITIONED   $115  framed

LOLLIPOP   $115  framed


 CUSTOM MADE SIGN

$65 

By Gary Davis

  Gary has made these cool looking signs for everyone in the Hughesville area.

They look great pretty much anywhere.   He has offered to make up to 5 of these.  Maximum 40 characters.  Please contact me directly with what you want on your sign.   komerchristopher@gmail.com


THE CORDWOOD CABIN
We are also offering 1, 2 or 3 nite stays (or any combination) in our lovely 10'x16' cordwood masonry cabin that can sleep 3.  Packed with 144 recycled bottles for a brilliant stained glass effect, this is a very comfy cozy cabin in a very pristine setting!


It has bunk beds but the bottom bunk can be converted into a double bed.

Simply fold up the extension and add the extra foam pad.

It also has a small woodstove to keep you cozy at night.  And you can make tea or cook on the top.

It comes complete with a piano.

And a small writing/drawing desk....

...with an adjustable top

There is no electricity to the cabin but it comes with the use of a small shower house which is situated directly behind the cabin.  

It has a fully pressurized hot shower....

a composting toilet.....

and a sink.

Also there is a fire pit nearby to cook on or have an evening campfire. 


MOUNTAIN RETREAT IN MOMCHILOVZI, BULGARIA

4 bedroom, 2 bath,  can sleep 10

Ummmm.....yes that is correct.   My friend Dorina has just offered this ridiculous 4-bedroom mountain retreat house as a perk.    WOW!
This is how she describes it..."The house and the area are truly stunning, near the Greek border, the mountain that Orpheus and Spartacus are coming from. Loads of brilliant places to visit, one of which the 30 meter deep cave which the legend says Orpheus went down to the Underworld to fine Eurydice.  It is close to the ski resort Pamporovo and also to the biggest observatory on the Balkans,  lots of nice villages and nature walks to die for."  

It sounds simply Amazing!!

Here are some photos:




3-nights   $350
7-nights   $700
available   Aug. Oct. and Nov.  (2014 or 2015!)

(e-mail me for more details on this one.... komerchristopher@gmail.com)


QUEEN & KING SIZED LOG BED FRAMES

We are also offering as a perk some very nice handcrafted rustic log bed frames.  Thunderhead member and Montana native Mike Rukstad and his father Harry make some Verrry nice ones.

This is a log bed at Thunderhead that they helped me with.

The actual design of Mike and Harry's beds may vary but I guarantee you, you will love sleeping in them.


NATURAL LOG MANDOLIN & GUITAR STANDS

Part-time Hughesville resident Jim Cummings makes some really cool guitar and mandolin stands out of wood.  He is willing to make up to 6 of these babies.


NOTE about shipping perks

We will ship your perk (excluding the log bed frames) for no charge within the Continental U.S.   Outside of the U.S.  additional shipping costs must be added.   Please contact me  Chris Komer   at  komerchristopher@gmail.com  if you live outside of the continental U.S. 


WHAT WE PLAN TO BUILD

THE CORDWOOD COMMONS

Cordwood masonry is a little known but beautiful (and very inexpensive) building method that we will use to make the commons.  Packed with recycled bottles of all shapes and colors set in patterns for a quasi stained glass effect,  our structure will be modeled after Earthwood (the home of cordwood masonry guru Rob Roy) and the Pompanuck roundhouse at the Pompanuck Farm Institute.   Both of these are in upstate New York and I have spent time at both places and conversed with the builders including taking a 3-day course with Rob Roy at Earthwood.  It will be  heated by a central masonry wood stove it will have a living roof and use solar power for electricity.  It will bermed into the side of a hill for maximum energy efficiency.  Ours will actually be 16 sided instead of perfectly round (It will still look round from a distance).

Below is an artists sketch of what we will build

And here is what it will look like when we are done.  (This is a photo of Rob Roy's Earthwood with an added greenhouse on the bottom floor)

SIde view from the blueprints

Our floor plans will vary from this.

But you get the idea.


STAGE 1     (summer '14-15)

Put in the foundation and begin work on the concrete block work

and central masonry stove.   Begin milling and curing structural timbers from our 30 acres of Lodgepole Pine trees.

Cost Estimate $10,245     (plus $4,094 for portable sawmill)


STAGE 2     (summer '15-16)

Complete masonry stove, retaining wall, and frame (with roof) using structural timbers cut and cured at Thunderhead.  Install well with solar pump.

Cost Estimate  $38,000-43,000


STAGE 3   (summer '16-17)

Complete the cordwood walls (with recycled bottles and reclaimed windows), doors, floors, install modest solar powered electrical system, septic, plumbing and finish the interior (including 2 small bathrooms and kitchen with re-store fixtures and appliances.)

Cost Estimate  $32,000-37,000



The Foundation Cost Estimate

SITE PREP
10' Excavator   $225 per day for 2 days  $450
Bobcat   $200 per day for 2 days  $400
Whacker (compactor)  $90 for 2 days $180
-------------------------------------------------------
total:  $1030

CONCRETE

-4"deep slab- 25 yards
-8"x36" perimiter footings- 11 yards + 4 yards extra for retaining= 15 yards
-8"x36" interior footings- 6 yards
-8"x8' dia. masonry stove footings- 1.5 yards
total: 47.5 yards x $114/yd= $5,415

Delivery charges 6 loads @ 4.45 per loaded mile (60 miles)

$267 x 6   =   $1,602

------------------------------------------------

total:  $7,017

REBAR

approx 50 1/2" x 20 sticks = $357 ($7.15/ea at HD)
approx 3 - 5' x 150' rolls mesh for slab= $315 ($105/ea HD)
------------------------------------------------------
total:  $672

forms for outside diameter
20-2x12x8' = $253 ($12.65 per stick)

1" rigid foam insulation for 1800  sq. ft.  = $823

Misc. materials for draining and plumbing =  $450


-------------------------------------------------------
Total:  $10,245


WHAT WE NEED TO BUY

THE HUD-SON HOMESTEADER HFE-21CE PORTABLE SAWMILL

This baby will save us thousands of dollars on lumber costs.   Especially the larger structural timbers such as 8"x 8" posts and beams.   This is because out of the 60 acres that comprises Thunderhead we have over 30 acres of solid trees at Thunderhead and they are growing very fast and need to be thinned.   Most of the trees are lodgepole pine (perfect for cordwood masonry and structural timbers) but we also have some lovely spruce and douglas fir both of which are also great for building.

The price breakdown:

Hud-son Homesteader HFE-21CE Portable Sawmill        $3,125

Box of 15 Blades                                                                                $214

Track Extension                                                                                 $405

Shipping                                                                                               $350

                                                                                            ----------------------

Total Cost:                                                                                           $4,094

 


OPERATING EXPENSES FOR THE SUMMER OF 2014

Sunforce 130W Crystalline 12V Solar Panel                                $562
    (To charge the 12V  motorcycle battery that powers the shower pump)
Gasoline to and from Great Falls                                                     $600
    (for supplies and to pick up guests at the airport)
Groceries                                                                                                 $830
Propane                                                                                                    $120
Electricity                                                                                                 $135
    (part of Thunderhead is on the grid, parts will be forever 'off-the-grid') 
Misc.                                                                                                          $418
                                                                     --------------------------------------------------
                                                                                                                 $2,665


What happens if we don't meet our goal?

We will at least be shooting to obtain the mill so we can at least set the project in motion by beginning to mill our own structural timbers. 
The rest will be used for operating costs and anything left over will be saved up for the foundation.

Short SummaryHi!
 My name is Chris Komer. I'm a freelance musician in New York City, 
and also the founder and director of the Artists' Refuge at Thunderhead 
in Montana. Thunderhead is located near Hughesville, Montana which is so small it is not on most maps.   Hughesville is an historic  mining town that is surrounded by the 
Lewis and Clark National Forest in the Little Belt Mountains. It's about an hour and a half southeast of Great 
Falls, Montana. I founded the project in 2007, in hopes of creating a 
place where artists of all types can gather to build a community, 
collaborate, and rejuvenate in the mountains. So far we've had over 100 artists come through, and among those were musicians, painters, 
builders, a yoga master, actors, dancers, etc. What is truly special about
 Thunderhead is that WE the artists and creatives that have gotten involved are building it ourselves using 
alternative building methods and the resources available on our 
60-acres. For those that get involved with our project, a 
typical day may be spent building, clearing trails, hiking, fishing, drawing, recreating with a game of whiffle ball or horseshoes, playing 
music around a campfire and counting shooting stars. 
Currently on our land, we have a beautiful cordwood cabin with a living roof (a roof with 6 inches of dirt and grass and plants and flowers growing on top), a cordwood shower 
house, a camper trailer, a mobile home a small storage barn, and lots of wide open space. Our
 next project is to build a 2-storey round cordwood structure to be used
 as a commons, where people can gather, cook in the communal kitchen, 
make art, play music, and do all sorts of activities. AND THIS IS WHAT WE NEED YOUR HELP WITHA commons will be instrumental in taking Thunderhead to the next level.  Although Thunderhead is only open in the summertime right now a commons will help us begin the journey to making Thunderhead a year-round operation.

We are planning on doing it in 3 stages, and this summer, we're hoping 
to raise enough money to put in the foundation for the structure and to 
buy a portable sawmill, so we can begin milling structural timbers from 
some of our 30-acres of lodgepole pine trees. All of this will cost us about 
$17,000 which includes some funds for operating expenses for this summer. This project really needs your support right now, so 
Thunderhead can continue to grow and allow more people to enjoy our 
budding community - a community that you're invited to become a part of 
as well.  
So this is how you can help:
Artist friends of Thunderhead have generously donated some wonderful 
paintings, drawings, sculptures, and mixed media art pieces; and some of
 our musician friends have donated tracks and albums of their music to 
help the project; including a compilation album of a number of 
musicians.  We also are offering some gorgeous log bed frames and some really neat all natural wood guitar and mandolin stands as well as a short stay in our adorable cordwood cabin.
If you donate in any amount, you immediately become part of our 
community, and we will keep you up to date on all the latest Thunderhead news (if you like) and you can also get some cool stuff made by some of our 
Thunderhead artists.
We'd really appreciate your support for this project, and we need your 
help to spread the word as well. Tell your friends and family about it, 
'like' our Facebook page, or simply come out this summer and check it 
out for yourself!
If you want to know more about Thunderhead,  you can check out our website: www.thunderheadrefuge.com

Total:  $10,245WHAT WE NEED TO BUYTHE HUD-SON HOMESTEADER HFE-21CE PORTABLE SAWMILLThis baby will save us thousands of dollars on lumber costs.   Especially the larger structural timbers such as 8"x 8" posts and beams.   This is because out of the 60 acres that comprises Thunderhead we have over 30 acres of solid trees at Thunderhead and they are growing very fast and need to be thinned.   Most of the trees are lodgepole pine (perfect for cordwood masonry and structural timbers) but we also have some lovely spruce and douglas fir both of which are also great for building. The price breakdown:Hud-son Homesteader HFE-21CE Portable Sawmill        $3,125Box of 15 Blades                                                                                $214Track Extension                                                                                 $405Shipping                                                                                               $350                                                                                            ----------------------Total Cost:                                                                                           $4,094   OPERATING EXPENSES FOR THE SUMMER OF 2014Sunforce 130W Crystalline 12V Solar Panel                                $562    (To charge the 12V  motorcycle battery that powers the shower pump)Gasoline to and from Great Falls                                                     $600    (for supplies and to pick up guests at the airport)Groceries                                                                                                 $830Propane                                                                                                    $120Electricity                                                                                                 $135    (part of Thunderhead is on the grid, parts will be forever 'off-the-grid')  Misc.                                                                                                          $418                                                                     --------------------------------------------------                                                                                                                 $2,665What happens if we don't meet our goal?We will at least be shooting to obtain the mill so we can at least set the project in motion by beginning to mill our own structural timbers.  The rest will be used for operating costs and anything left over will be saved up for the foundation.

story:
SANCTUARY

For the third year, we are creating Sanctuary, an interactive art installation at Flagstaff Arizona's very own intentional music festival, Firefly. 

http://www.fireflygathering.com/  

Sanctuary is a gift to the community, to allow festival goers an opportunity to connect, commune and experience inspiration in a tranquil environment. In 2011 our project was inspired by peaceful eastern traditions,  in 2012 we commemorated the end of the Mayan calendar, and in 2013 we are focusing on Nature's Elements: Earth, Fire, Wind and Water. 

 2013 Elements - Earth, Fire, Wind & Water

This interactive art installation will include the following exhibits: a Sacred Spiral Zen Garden, a Flaming cauldron and nightly Fire performances,  a Wind Vortex, and a circular Fountain. There will be communal seating around each installation, and daily workshops on mindfulness & meditation.

Who we are and Why we care

Our home lies in the cool pines of Northern Arizona. We spend our free time  climbing and camping in the amazing outdoors that is our backyard. We work professional jobs, but more importantly we work to live.  We feel incredibly lucky to have a close connection with nature. We also have benefited from the generosity and giving of others, who, by example, have shown us how to be open and generous of our own selves.  We  recognize and value that just a smile and kind word can have a positive impact in another person's life. Providing Sanctuary is our way of accomplishing this same task but on a much grander scale.

The Impact

Participating in Sanctuary allows contributors a chance to "pay it forward".  Your shared dreams and generosity will flow into a larger movement of inspired and joyful giving. And this is how we all can make the world a better place!

What You Get

Join our Hopeful Movement! Sanctuary provides people an opportunity to place a wish, dream or intention on our Dreaming Trees.  Let's see how much positive energy we can all create together!

 PERKS:

Check out our PERKS!

  • CUSTOM SANCTUARY ART 
  • FREE FESTIVAL TICKETS
  • DAILY FESTIVAL PERKS at Sanctuary
  • A SUPER COOL OPPORTUNITY -      Join the Sanctuary creators in a one of a kind visit to one of these amazing highlights of the Southwest:
  • Local Indian Ruins,
  • The Majestic Red Rocks of Sedona,
  • A Rock Climbing Adventure! (see disclaimer)

Sanctuary Prayer Flag

What We Need

See below for our Sanctuary Budget.  Please feel free to contact us for more specific information.  

  Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone can contribute - however you can still lend us a hand! Please like our facebook page, follow our tweets and be kind to others!  THANK YOU!

story:
Hey Everyone, 

In honor of Lou's 40th birthday I wanted to do something unique and special and a little out side the box, just like Lou. 

I am having a graffiti artist create an original piece of work (7f X 11f) from all of our crazy adventure + travel memories. Paris, Sydney, New york, LA.

The Artist Raul Gonzalezis ( pic above ) is busy putting together the piece now and will finish it off on the night, live. 

As many of you are far + near i thought it would be a nice idea to contribute towards Lou's 40th birthday present. 

Look forward to seeing you on the night, and to those of you that cannot make it, we will miss you. 

LET THE PARTY GRAFFITI PROJECT START.........

story:
Students Need Supplies

108 girls need your help! 

Help to raise just $34 per girl. That's enough for all the supplies for each girl for a whole year.

Our program opens hearts and minds with multimedia and arts education while teaching kids great skills they can use every day. 

We are overwhelmed here with applications for new students and even offers of volunteer help, but we need your help to purchase the supplies we need. 

Your contributions will be used to purchase:
  • 6 shared computers and monitors
  • Student desks and chairs
  • Art supplies

The girls really need your help. They want to learn, and they need supplies to get started.

Matching Grant

An anonymous donor has given us just 10 days to raise our first $2500 for a matching grant. Please contribute now and help us enroll our new students!

Lasting Value

Student projects in the past have included articles about local heritage and culture, cookbooks with recipes for traditional foods, maps of the local area and so much more. Students spend time learning in class sessions, working together on the computer, and also out in the community sharing their projects and helping to make it a better place for everyone with their new skills.

From Us to You

When we reach our goal we want to share with you some of what the girls have been working on. These are items that the students have helped to create. You'll receive digital copies of them for your own enjoyment at home. You can print them!
  • Taste of Indonesia: CookBook of Traditional Recipes
  • Community Art Poster with Map of our Area

About the Program and the Place

The program serves disadvantaged girls ages 15 and up. 2/3 of Indonesian children don't finish 9th grade, and the majority of these dropouts are girls. Whereas children in developed countries are alloted upwards of $1,000 a year to cover the costs of schooling Indonesia only allots $100 per year. This isn't enough to cover the costs of schooling, and so additional fees are levied directly on students and their families. Inability to pay the fees is the number one reason that kids are dropping out. 87% of those who drop out enter the workforce.

This program is a mix of arts based education and community development. By creating a low (no) cost, enjoyable program students and families can stay involved and follow through. Graduates can find better employment due to  skills learned, and the cycle of poverty is interrupted. The community projects and works of art produced provide a lasting benefit to the local community long after the students have finished the program.

Families in Indonesia must often choose between a nutritious meal for their children or the price of a fueling up their motorcyle for a day of seeking employment. The minimum wage in our area is $160/month, but well over 60% of families in the area are barely surviving on less than $60 a month. Inflation is at 5.5% and rising. $2/day is not enough to feed a family of 4, and we haven't yet included the average $25/month/child fees levied by free public schools.

This project is developed and managed by the Local Routes Foundation of Bogor, Indonesia. We are a community Foundation, and your contributions help us to become a sustainable provider of solutions for poverty here in Indonesia. Your help today puts girls back in school. Please consider helping us to exceed our goal so that we can fully serve our community by expanding our activities to make the program fully self-sustaing.

For more information about the program, other ways to give, and to receive priority updates about the program please visit http://www.localroutes.org . US residents can make tax deductible donations through Fractured Atlas, our Fiscal Sponsor.

story:
- ENGLISH VERSION HERE -

- VERSIONE ITALIANA QUI -

 

Je suis Roberto D'Alessandro, cinéaste et artiste actif à Paris.

Le projet que je veux réaliser grâce à votre aide est une série de vidéos, resultat d'une recherche visuelle sur les paysages encore vierges de la Nouvelle Zélande. Je m’intéresse à la nature et à sa représentation au travers des moyens numériques. Mon travail prend souvent la forme de tableaux en mouvement.

Depuis le début de ma vocation artistique, le paysage a représenté un fort appel à ma sensibilité. J’ai grandi en Italie dans une petite ville aux pieds de l’Etna. Être si proche de ce volcan ne m'a jamais fait peur. Sa présence n'a jamais éveillé non plus la dévotion typique qu'ont tous les siciliens pour cette montagne. Pour moi l'Etna a toujours été une incroyable présence visuelle.

  

Méthode

Les expérimentations artistiques que j’ai menées dans les dernières années, m’ont démontré qu’il est possible de restaurer cette connexion originale intime avec le paysage. Le geste créateur lui-même a la fonction de rapprocher l’homme à la nature oubliée, au travers des observations répétées et l’attention à ses particularités. Grace à ces expérimentations, je connais mes outils et j’ai développé des méthodes d’observation et de production de vidéo-paysages. Dans chacun d’eux, la forme visuelle est directement influencée par le sujet. En d’autres termes, ce qui se passe devant l’objectif détermine la façon par laquelle le paysage est observé et traité dans l’œuvre. La forme d’un tableau mouvant rappelle la tradition du paysage tout au long de l’histoire de l’art.

Ma recherche plastique est commencée au milieu de la nature de ma terre natale. Ensuite la quotidienneté des parcs anglais et des paysages urbains Parisiens – les lieux de mes études et de mon activité professionnelle –  a trouvé sa forme d’expression dans l’approche structurelle, une méthode de recherche artistique qui ne vise pas à cacher les outils de création, mais au contraire s’en sert afin de retrouver une vérité qui serait autrement impossible à saisir si on se limitait à « imiter » la réalité.

  

Filmer des paysages n’est pas une nouveauté. Les frères Lumières ont été les premiers paysagistes à la caméra. Mais depuis, les composants chimiques des pellicules ont changé sans cesse, jusqu’à être remplacés par des bande électromagnétique et encore par un système de simplification mathématique des images capturées. L’informatisation des appareils d’enregistrement a finalisé le projet de déconnexion entre l’homme et la nature.

Découverte

La Nouvelle Zélande, avec sa richesse ancestrale, sa biodiversité et le caractère sauvage des deux tiers de son territoire, représente la destination privilégiée pour la suite de mon parcours et, en même temps, un défi, l’invitation à l’action sur le terrain et  la rupture de la routine. Laisser tout ce qui est connu, pour un monde inconnu qui demande à être vécu et exploré. Il s’agit d’un environnement fascinant où la beauté naturelle n’est pas limitée aux petits parcs. Au contraire, elle devient protagoniste grâce à sa puissante présence visuelle.

Durant la réalisation du projet, les populations locales indigènes, les Maoris, auront un rôle important: leur connaissance du territoire, des ses significations symboliques, les liens spirituels entre les communautés et leurs environnements, sont tous des éléments qui apporteront au projet une richesse culturelle indispensable. Une des destinations pourrait être, par exemple, le Parc National de Tongariro, situé au milieu de l’île septentrionale de la Nouvelle Zélande, qui détient une grande importance spirituelle pour les populations Maoris.

Organisation

Pour le déroulement et la réalisation du projet, je prévois une durée de six à douze mois, (à partir d’août 2013) qui incluent les déplacements, l’observation, l’exploration, la récolte de vidéos et de photos, ainsi que l’obtention d’une connaissance profonde des lieux avec lesquels sera entrepris un dialogue constructif, ce qui représente une étape indispensable afin de saisir la vérité intrinsèque de chaque paysage.

Ma collaboratrice sera la biologiste Elena Cienfuegos – activiste pour Sea Shepherd dans la campagne anti-baleinier de 2013 en Antarctique – que j’estime pour ses compétences dans les domaines naturels et scientifiques, son courage et sa capacité d’adaptation à toutes sortes de situations.

Le budget de 10000 euros indiqué réprésente un aide important pour la bonne réussite du projet et servira à couvrir partiellement les coûts de déplacement en territoire néozélandais (3000-4000 euros), l'achat de parties du matériel audiovisuel (notamment un objectif grand-angle, un téléobjectif et filtres adaptés à la captation de paysages, 3000-3500 euros), ainsi que l’organisation de la phase distribution/exposition de l'œuvre réalisée (affiches, location de locaux, installation d’écrans, etc., 3000-4000 euros).

Diffusion

A la fin de la période d’activité sur le terrain, l’œuvre réalisée (ou la série) sera présentée sous forme de projection et/ou d’installation d’écrans plats, en galléries d’art, mais aussi et surtout dans les espaces extérieurs de la ville (là où une collaboration avec les mairies sera possible), en Nouvelle Zélande, mais aussi en France et dans le reste de l’Europe. La diffusion de l’œuvre sera assurée sur le web à travers les plateformes de partage de vidéos, les réseaux sociaux, ainsi qu’un site web entièrement dédié au projet.

Les projections seront conçues comme des moments de contemplation. Le but est celui de retransmettre les expériences vécues face à la beauté de la nature, à un public le plus vaste, qui sera atteint à travers l’utilisation non conventionnelle des outils du cinéma numérique. Des nouvelles sensations émergeront à partir de l’observation des paysages numérisés : grâce au traitement très particulier des images, les gens seront plongés dans une expérience du paysage qui rappelle les origines de l’homme, une ère dans laquelle les évènements étaient admirés au travers d’un regard vierge.

En sensibilisant l’homme sur le thème du paysage et sa contemplation, la « traduction » binaire de la réalité, qui semble aujourd’hui être devenue aussi importante que la réalité elle-même, pourra alors atteindre un but supérieur

Remerciements

Pour remercier chacun parmi vous, des intéressantes contreparties sont proposée dans le coté droit de cette page!

L'avacement du projet sur imagma.net.

story:
Summary

I am a high school sophomore, and have been drawing since I can remember (that's my self-portrait at the top; I intend to post more drawings and paintings). The margins of my elementary and middle school notebooks are crammed with doodles and experiments, a testament to my perpetual desire to grow as an artist. When I attended Interlochen the summer after 8th grade (with the help of generous relatives and a little crowdsourcing), I saw my technical ability improve exponentially, along with my inspiration and dedication to art. Two years later, I want to go again. I received a small, merit-based scholarship for my portfolio, but it covers less than 13% of the money needed for tuition. We need extra support to make this possible.

What I Need & What You'll Get

The full tuition is $4,840. Subtracting the $650 merit scholarship still leaves $4,190. Ideally, I would need to raise at least $3,000 to make ends meet. Nevertheless, I cannot stress enough how much even the smallest donation helps. Even if I don't reach my goal, your gift still counts. Meanwhile, I'm offering a few perks in return:

  • For donations of $10, I'll send you a handwritten thank-you note.
  • For donations of $30, I'll send you a handwritten thank-you sonnet.
  • For donations of $50, I'll calligraph your name. You can choose the style. I'll send it to you on a 5x7 card.
  • It sounds weird, but for donations of $75, I'm offering to proofread any short document or essay. While I do art, I'm also an avid proofreader. Send me a document (up to six pages) and I'll send you a typed, bulleted report on it. If you want, I'll include suggestions on the content and organization as well.
  • For donations of $150, I'll proofread a large document (up to 20 pages).
  • For donations of $500, I'll send you a really big thank-you sonnet. By this I mean a framed, hand-calligraphed, 18x24 sonnet thanking you for your donation.
  • For a donation of $1,000, I'll paint your portrait from a photograph. Because I put a lot of effort into painting, I'll only offer this once. Send me three photos, and I'll paint from one of them.

Impact

Your contribution means more to me than you can imagine. I want the chance to discover and develop my abilities, as well as an equal opportunity to pursue my passion for art.

If you can't make a contribution, I totally understand. You can still help by getting the word out. You will make a huge contribution just by sharing this through any social network. Thank you for taking the time to read this.

story:
Studio Monitor Artist Residencies:

Hello Everyone! We have some very exciting news to share with you all. We (Barbara and Adriana) have been invited to participate in the Studio Monitor Artist Residency Program at Santa Reparata International School of Art in Florence, Italy. This residency will take place May through December of this year.  This amazing opportunity will allow us to focus on and investigate our visual concepts while immersing ourselves in all things Florence! Together! The program will give us full access to the studios which hosts state of the art printmaking, photography, book binding, fashion design, painting and drawing facilities. Near the end of our residency we will present an Artist in Residency Exhibition of completed work while at Santa Reparata. We will be financially responsible for all of our living, traveling and supply needs.  This is where this  campaign will help to get us to Italy.


What We Need & What You Get:

We have been organizing and planning this trip for many months and saving up every penny we earn from our daily jobs. 100% of all donations will go to these necessities.This campaign will help us pay for :
  • Our housing. We will be in Florence for over 7 months. Rent, utilities and taxes.
  • Plane tickets to and from Italy.
  • And most importantly studio supplies. They include:  printmaking paper, dark room photography paper, film both printmaking and photography, drawing supplies, dark room supplies, inks, brushes, screen printing screens, adhesives, and any other supplies needed as we get working in the studios.
We have created some unique perks for different amounts of donations made. All of the perks, except for the personalized post cards, will be hand made pieces by us during our residency. With most of the perks you will receive something from both of us! We think they are pretty neat and hope to send you some fun stuff!

Above images are examples of Adriana's current work.


Above image are examples of Barbara's work

The Impact

This opportunity is a big deal for us. We have spent the past few years working on our art here in Santa Fe, but not without real world daily distractions that we feel have kept us from really investigating our ideas. With this residency, we will, get to experience seven months of non-stop studio time and we just can't wait to get at it. 

Our goal as artists are never ending.  Our drive and dedication to the visual language continues to challenge us, and we hope as partners and as artists to be able to share this always with you all. 

THANK YOU!!! We want to thank everyone who shares this campaign  and especially all of you that are able to donate to help us make this opportunity a reality.  Any amount is more than we could ask for. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Much Love, Respect and Creativity.

Barbara and Adriana

story:
Short Summary

We are an Edinburgh based collective of six photographers that share the same photographic interest. In April 2016, we are hosting a group exhibition and are currently raising funds to make it happen. 

The exhibition is titled WOMANHOOD and our intention is to explore the interpreted perceptions of women and womanhood. The question “What is a woman?” can lead to different interpretations and can be examined in different ways, depending on whether we are looking at the subject in terms of sex, gender or a social construct.

The event is going to be held in Edinburgh, Scotland, from 8th to 14th of April 2016, at Whitespace Gallery, 25 Howe Street, EH3 6TF, Edinburgh.


What We Need & What You Get

The raised funds are going to be used to pay the expenses necessary to fulfil the project: venue leasing costs, production of the catalogue, printing and framing. They will also help run a range of events and activities.

We don't just want to host an exhibition, but intend to create an interactive hub for one week, hosting workshops and talks.

Our perks include prints of the images from the exhibition (we will contact you to offer choices and discuss shipment) as well as studio photoshoots done by one of us - depending on what style you want. Also, the very special perk will be an invitation to spend a weekend in Edinburgh and meet us at the opening (or closing) of the exhibition. 

Everyone is, of course, invited to visit the exhibition.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have a spare penny, you can still help. Spread the word about our project and share this campaign as well as our facebook page:  www.facebook.com/thexcollective.co.uk.

THANK YOU!

* Disclaimer: Photographs featured on the video are our previous work, for exhibition work in progress, please, see our facebook page.

story:
Hola! 

My name is KARI GALE and I am an illustrator and writer that loves telling stories with pictures and capturing the beauty of ordinary and extraordinary moments in my journal using pen and ink and watercolor. I recently published my first book of drawings called "The Art of Walking: An Illustrated Journey on the Camino de Santiago" in which I documented each day of my 500 mile journey in Spain resulting in over forty watercolor illustrations. 

This past September, I left the safety of the corporate world to pursue my lifelong dream of working as an illustrator and writer. I decided to take a year and delve into the two things I love the most: drawing and traveling! As I travel through Europe I have continued to document my experiences weekly in word and image on my blog at karigale.com. 

I am currently living in Santiago de Compostela (the end of the Camino) preparing for two art exhibitions in Spain. Through a very crazy and miraculous set of circumstances, I met some wonderful and gracious people who are helping me promote my book through these art exhibits.

The first exhibition will be in Finisterre during the month of May, and the second will be in Santiago during the month of July. Through these exhibits, which will display enlarged prints of my journal drawings, I will have the opportunity to share my art and my story with thousands of pilgrims who, right now, are walking their own Camino to Santiago. This is more than just an art show to me. It is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to receive international exposure as an illustrator and writer! This experience will enable me to make significant steps forward pursuing my passion. I would love for you to partner with me in this journey!

What I Need & What You Get

As a nomadic artist with a sporadic income, I need your help in funding the things required to produce these art exhibits. Your funds will contribute to the following:

  • Printing enlarged images of 40 of my journal paintings on rigid weatherproof plastic to hang in the exhibit space, along with all exhibit signage
  • Marketing materials for each exhibit; i.e. advertising postcards to hand out prior to and during the exhibits
  • Printing books as well as posters to sell at the exhibits

My campaign timing is a bit different than normal. I am preparing for these exhibitions as we speak and am placing all of these costs on a credit card in order to meet the deadline to open the first exhibit on May 6th. I only received the final costs from the printer this week and wanted to be very informed before asking my supporters for a specific amount to fund the project. I chose Indiegogo for their flexible funding option so that everything you donate will be used to produce the exhibitions, even if I don't make the entire goal. Of course, my hope is that I will make the entire goal, with your gracious support!

You will receive the following perks for your support: 

  • contribute $5 - the 'ST. JEAN PIED DE PORT' perk: You will receive a thank you postcard featuring an image from my book "The Art of Walking!"
  • contribute $25 - the 'PAMPLONA' perk: You will receive a set of 5 Postcards, each featuring a different painting from my book "The Art of Walking!"


  • contribute $50 - the 'BURGOS' perk: You will receive everything listed in the 'PAMPLONA' perk as well as an 11.5 x 11.5" limited edition poster of a special painting of the Camino. This image is not in the book and only offered through my Indiegogo campaign!

  • contribute $75 - the 'LEÓN' perk: You will receive everything in the 'BURGOS' perk, as well as a set of 5 large greeting cards! (2 images from my book "The Art of Walking" and 3 new images from the Camino Portugués)


  • contribute $100 - the 'SANTIAGO' perk: You will receive everything listed in the 'LEÓN' perk as well as a copy of my book "The Art of Walking!"

  • $500 - the 'CATHEDRAL' perk: You will receive everything listed in the 'SANTIAGO' perk, and after you send me your favourite travel photo, I will create an original and unique piece of artwork (12 x 16") for you to display proudly in your home! (illustrated in art style featured in my book: example below. Limited to landscape photos- i.e. no people) - LIMITED TO 5 SUPPORTERS

  • $1000 - the 'FINISTERRE' perk: You will receive everything listed in the 'SANTIAGO' perk, and when I return to PDX, I will treat you and 4 friends to a day long 'Journal Art Workshop!' I will provide everyone with the same journal and art supplies I use to capture my European travels. The morning will consist of teaching and techniques and during the afternoon we will draw 'plein air' so that you can become comfortable using your tools outside! After drawing, we will share our thoughts and discoveries over a happy hour drink! - LIMITED TO 3 SUPPORTERS in the Portland area unless transportation costs are provided in addition to the above donation.

(NOTE: unfortunately, the perks above are only available for supporters in the United States due to shipping logistics. Thank you for your understanding)

Risks & Challenges

I worked for 10+ years at Columbia Sportswear as a project manager producing their global product catalogs and also volunteered for a nonprofit, HALO Portland, for several years producing their large art show fundraisers. Through these experiences I have gained the perfect combination of skills to accomplish and complete my proposed projects, so let me assure you that I am fully capable of following through with everything that is outlined above. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, I understand! I would love your help in other ways! Please share the link to my campaign on Facebook and other social media channels! Getting the word out is imperative and will make all the difference in funding my campaign!

I am so grateful to each of you for supporting me in all the ways that you do! BUEN CAMINO!
