story:
WHO & WHAT?!

Greeting friends… it is with great joy and honor we introduce to you Wanderfoot!  This is an exciting new community of friends, artists and travelers that publish a digital magazine featuring unique, high-quality artisan goods and off the beaten path travel information from all around the world!!

Have you ever wanted to purchase a really unique gift for a special someone and just didn’t know where to find that ‘special something’?!  Have you ever been planning a trip and thought… geeeez I don’t want to stay in just another plain old hotel this time… I want to find a Treehouse with a rope swing where I can swoosh out over a raging river?!  NOW YOU CAN... just carouse the Wanderfoot website and digital magazine!!

ADVENTURES

We got our feet wet last year with a preliminary scouting mission up the west coast through Northern California, Oregon and Washington.  We met so many awesome people and found so many amazing treasure to share!! Joshua & Eric are geared up and ready to go for Adventure #2… and we invite you to join us on the journey!!  If you’d like, you can subscribe to our Travel Journal to receive updates from the road!! (link to subscribe)

HELP US GROW OUR COMMUNITY

We are stepping up our game this year with more professional content development and upgrading the functionality of our website to make it more interactive.  This is where your contribution can GREATLY SUPPORT US RIGHT NOW!!  With YOUR SUPPORT we can build the necessary website functionality for you to create your VERY OWN travel journal!!  With your support YOU can become part of our global Wanderfoot scouting team that contributes content and inspiration to our community!

Development of website infrastructure to support our network

  • enhanced functionality of featured artisan & location profiles

  • enhanced marketplace & ecommerce components

  • enhanced travel journal functionality (enabling YOU to create your own travel journal)

  • enhanced social media integration & community development

  • enhanced communication platform & networking functionality

  • backend management system & hosting

  • $4,200


Digital Magazine Production

  • design

  • layout

  • development

  • $1,100


Audio/Video Production & Content Generation

  • film & videography

  • sound engineering

  • post production & editing

  • $4,500


This is both rewarding & powerful

Sometimes when those of us who like to travel are out in the world exploring, we come across something really special that we would like to share with our friends and the rest of the world.  Yes we can take a photo and post it on Facebook, yet this doesn’t really provide people with a direct way to connect to this experience.  Let’s say we are traveling through Bali and come across one of the most amazing wood carvers we have ever seen, and would like to connect people to him to purchase his amazing goods.  We choose to do this for two reasons:

  1. His work is outstanding and we would like others to be able to enjoy the mastery of his creations.

  2. We value the hard and creative work of local artisans and know that if we connect people to him to purchase his goods it will help support him, his family and the local economy of his community.


NOW WE CAN DO THIS!!  Together we are building a team of world adventurers, scouts and explorers with dreams grounded in purpose and intention - and YOU can be part of the team!!  

We have several key values that help guide what is featured on Wanderfoot.

  • uniqueness

  • beauty

  • quality

  • purpose

  • sustainability


YES, we love beauty and creativity - yet we are also deeply driven by PURPOSE and INTENTION!!

Basically what we are doing is tapping into the collective knowledge and wisdom of our friends and Wanderfoot community; and bringing all of this together into ONE potent source of creativity and inspiration for ALL of us to enjoy!!

A bit about Wanderfoot Culture

In essence we inspire creative and conscious decisions in life!!

Core values that guide the intention and actions in all we do:

  • integrating passions and purpose

  • inspiring conscious decisions that support the collective good of all

  • seeking a healthy societal balance of local custom artisan skills and mechanized industry

  • integrating indigenous culture and wisdom with modern thought, science and technology

  • creating a healthy balance of utility and creative expression

  • inspiring sustainable and regenerative actions that support the health of our global ecosystem

  • creating a consumer culture that is well educated and knowledgeable of what they are supporting when purchasing goods and services

Some sweet rewards!! 

...to thank you for your generous support!!


$10 = 1 yr Subscription / Digital Magazine
$25 = 3 yr Subscription / Digital Magazine

Our digital magazine is a quarterly publication overflowing with heartfelt stories of adventure & inspiration!! Be prepared for a smorgasbord of palette wetting visual & mental stimulation that will have you drooling with joy & excitement!!  


$35 = Pangia Bracelet

These sweeeet bracelets are hand-made in Bali from recycled surfboards… helping support both the local artisan community and improving the environment at the same time.  Each bracelet has a unique code that allows you to track it on the Pangia website to see where it has traveled!  The idea is to pass on the bracelet to other adventurers in an act of kindness and generosity… spreading the love!  See more here: projectpangia.com


$35 = Wanderfoot Tote Bag

A groovy tote bag with the Wanderfoot logo and “...be wanderous my friends”!  Enjoy this bag while on your local wanderings to the farmers market or to store your treasures while on global wanderings to foreign lands!


$50 = Wanderfoot T-shirt

100% organic cotton beautifully made, high-quality custom t-shirt with the Wanderfoot logo and “...be wanderous my friends”!  This comfy, slim fit, vintage feel garment is a fabulous addition to your wardrobe.  We have a guarantee that while wearing this amazing ‘t’ you will feel uplifted, open-minded and inspired to travel the world and make it a better place by making conscious decisions!  We know this is a lot to claim from wearing a t-shirt… try it out and let us know!!  We feel pretty strongly it will bring a smile to your face :-)  A BIG thank you to Vuori Clothing for collaborating with us on this project!  (vuoriclothing.com)


$50 = Pangia Bracelet + 3yr Subscription
$50 = Tote Bag + 3yr Subscription
$75 = T-shirt + 3yr Subscription
$100 = T-shirt + Bracelet + 3yr Subscription
$100 = T-shirt + Tote + 3yr Subscription
$140 = T-shirt + Bracelet + Tote + 3yr Subscription


$500 = Lifelong Wanderfoot VIP + Conscious Citizen Kit

In return for your abundant generosity you now take ranks in the Wanderfoot community as an honorary conscious citizen on our Very Important Planet board.  You are rewarded with a lifelong subscription to the Wanderfoot digital magazine and will be among the 1st of the Wanderfoot community to receive a Conscious Citizen Kit.  This kit will be a combination of sustainably produced daily items such as bamboo/wooden cutlery, a reusable drinking vessel and reusable bag to carry these items.  We here at Wanderfoot care a lot about this beautiful planet and are doing everything we can to minimize the amount of waste that is created.  We are doing everything we can to inspire world citizens to make creative and conscious decisions in life!!


$1,500 = Private Wanderfoot Hootenanny + Lifelong Membership

Ohhhh wow are you in for a treat!!!  The Wanderfoot team is honored to include within it’s ranks the deep rooted musical melodies of Eric Long & The Soul and Bones Project!!  The Wanderfoot Caravan will come to your home or place of business and put on one heck of a hair-raising hootenanny!!  Eric’s soulful voice & rockin guitar will resonate throughout the hearts and minds of you and your closest friends - minds will be blown, hearts will be opened and inspiration will flow throughout the evening as creative spirits soar high above!!  This will be a gathering remembered by all for many moons!!  Along with the private hootenanny you will also receive the Lifelong VIP membership listed above.  (soulandbonesband.com)

***NOTE: The Hootenanny Reward is only available to backers in Southern California, as we are based in San Diego.

THANK YOU

We are honored to share this amazing project with you and so GRATEFUL for your support!!!  The beauty of this campaign is that if everyone of our friends and social media connections contributes even $10 - we will well surpass our campaign goal of $9,800!!  Please help us grow this creative community of conscious folks!!  


With Love & Gratitude,

the Wanderfoot Team


… be wanderous my friends!!  

(and please SHARE this with your friends!!)
story_txt:
WHO & WHAT?!Greeting friends… it is with great joy and honor we introduce to you Wanderfoot!  This is an exciting new community of friends, artists and travelers that publish a digital magazine featuring unique, high-quality artisan goods and off the beaten path travel information from all around the world!!Have you ever wanted to purchase a really unique gift for a special someone and just didn’t know where to find that ‘special something’?!  Have you ever been planning a trip and thought… geeeez I don’t want to stay in just another plain old hotel this time… I want to find a Treehouse with a rope swing where I can swoosh out over a raging river?!  NOW YOU CAN... just carouse the Wanderfoot website and digital magazine!!ADVENTURESWe got our feet wet last year with a preliminary scouting mission up the west coast through Northern California, Oregon and Washington.  We met so many awesome people and found so many amazing treasure to share!! Joshua & Eric are geared up and ready to go for Adventure #2… and we invite you to join us on the journey!!  If you’d like, you can subscribe to our Travel Journal to receive updates from the road!! (link to subscribe)HELP US GROW OUR COMMUNITY We are stepping up our game this year with more professional content development and upgrading the functionality of our website to make it more interactive.  This is where your contribution can GREATLY SUPPORT US RIGHT NOW!!  With YOUR SUPPORT we can build the necessary website functionality for you to create your VERY OWN travel journal!!  With your support YOU can become part of our global Wanderfoot scouting team that contributes content and inspiration to our community!Development of website infrastructure to support our network
enhanced functionality of featured artisan & location profiles
enhanced marketplace & ecommerce components
enhanced travel journal functionality (enabling YOU to create your own travel journal) 
enhanced social media integration & community development
enhanced communication platform & networking functionality
backend management system & hosting
$4,200
Digital Magazine Production
design
layout
development
$1,100
Audio/Video Production & Content Generation
film & videography 
sound engineering
post production & editing 
$4,500
This is both rewarding & powerfulSometimes when those of us who like to travel are out in the world exploring, we come across something really special that we would like to share with our friends and the rest of the world.  Yes we can take a photo and post it on Facebook, yet this doesn’t really provide people with a direct way to connect to this experience.  Let’s say we are traveling through Bali and come across one of the most amazing wood carvers we have ever seen, and would like to connect people to him to purchase his amazing goods.  We choose to do this for two reasons:
His work is outstanding and we would like others to be able to enjoy the mastery of his creations.
We value the hard and creative work of local artisans and know that if we connect people to him to purchase his goods it will help support him, his family and the local economy of his community.
NOW WE CAN DO THIS!!  Together we are building a team of world adventurers, scouts and explorers with dreams grounded in purpose and intention - and YOU can be part of the team!!  We have several key values that help guide what is featured on Wanderfoot.
uniqueness
beauty
quality
purpose
sustainability 
YES, we love beauty and creativity - yet we are also deeply driven by PURPOSE and INTENTION!!Basically what we are doing is tapping into the collective knowledge and wisdom of our friends and Wanderfoot community; and bringing all of this together into ONE potent source of creativity and inspiration for ALL of us to enjoy!!A bit about Wanderfoot CultureIn essence we inspire creative and conscious decisions in life!!Core values that guide the intention and actions in all we do:
integrating passions and purpose
inspiring conscious decisions that support the collective good of all
seeking a healthy societal balance of local custom artisan skills and mechanized industry 
integrating indigenous culture and wisdom with modern thought, science and technology
creating a healthy balance of utility and creative expression
inspiring sustainable and regenerative actions that support the health of our global ecosystem
creating a consumer culture that is well educated and knowledgeable of what they are supporting when purchasing goods and services
Some sweet rewards!! ...to thank you for your generous support!!$10 = 1 yr Subscription / Digital Magazine$25 = 3 yr Subscription / Digital MagazineOur digital magazine is a quarterly publication overflowing with heartfelt stories of adventure & inspiration!! Be prepared for a smorgasbord of palette wetting visual & mental stimulation that will have you drooling with joy & excitement!!  $35 = Pangia BraceletThese sweeeet bracelets are hand-made in Bali from recycled surfboards… helping support both the local artisan community and improving the environment at the same time.  Each bracelet has a unique code that allows you to track it on the Pangia website to see where it has traveled!  The idea is to pass on the bracelet to other adventurers in an act of kindness and generosity… spreading the love!  See more here: projectpangia.com$35 = Wanderfoot Tote BagA groovy tote bag with the Wanderfoot logo and “...be wanderous my friends”!  Enjoy this bag while on your local wanderings to the farmers market or to store your treasures while on global wanderings to foreign lands!$50 = Wanderfoot T-shirt100% organic cotton beautifully made, high-quality custom t-shirt with the Wanderfoot logo and “...be wanderous my friends”!  This comfy, slim fit, vintage feel garment is a fabulous addition to your wardrobe.  We have a guarantee that while wearing this amazing ‘t’ you will feel uplifted, open-minded and inspired to travel the world and make it a better place by making conscious decisions!  We know this is a lot to claim from wearing a t-shirt… try it out and let us know!!  We feel pretty strongly it will bring a smile to your face :-)  A BIG thank you to Vuori Clothing for collaborating with us on this project!  (vuoriclothing.com)$50 = Pangia Bracelet + 3yr Subscription$50 = Tote Bag + 3yr Subscription$75 = T-shirt + 3yr Subscription$100 = T-shirt + Bracelet + 3yr Subscription$100 = T-shirt + Tote + 3yr Subscription$140 = T-shirt + Bracelet + Tote + 3yr Subscription$500 = Lifelong Wanderfoot VIP + Conscious Citizen KitIn return for your abundant generosity you now take ranks in the Wanderfoot community as an honorary conscious citizen on our Very Important Planet board.  You are rewarded with a lifelong subscription to the Wanderfoot digital magazine and will be among the 1st of the Wanderfoot community to receive a Conscious Citizen Kit.  This kit will be a combination of sustainably produced daily items such as bamboo/wooden cutlery, a reusable drinking vessel and reusable bag to carry these items.  We here at Wanderfoot care a lot about this beautiful planet and are doing everything we can to minimize the amount of waste that is created.  We are doing everything we can to inspire world citizens to make creative and conscious decisions in life!!$1,500 = Private Wanderfoot Hootenanny + Lifelong MembershipOhhhh wow are you in for a treat!!!  The Wanderfoot team is honored to include within it’s ranks the deep rooted musical melodies of Eric Long & The Soul and Bones Project!!  The Wanderfoot Caravan will come to your home or place of business and put on one heck of a hair-raising hootenanny!!  Eric’s soulful voice & rockin guitar will resonate throughout the hearts and minds of you and your closest friends - minds will be blown, hearts will be opened and inspiration will flow throughout the evening as creative spirits soar high above!!  This will be a gathering remembered by all for many moons!!  Along with the private hootenanny you will also receive the Lifelong VIP membership listed above.  (soulandbonesband.com)***NOTE: The Hootenanny Reward is only available to backers in Southern California, as we are based in San Diego.THANK YOUWe are honored to share this amazing project with you and so GRATEFUL for your support!!!  The beauty of this campaign is that if everyone of our friends and social media connections contributes even $10 - we will well surpass our campaign goal of $9,800!!  Please help us grow this creative community of conscious folks!!  With Love & Gratitude,the Wanderfoot Team… be wanderous my friends!!  (and please SHARE this with your friends!!)

story:
We would like to thank each and every supporter who took the time to donate, spread the word and encouraged us forward. Thank you !!! You're brilliant !!

PS - If you missed the window and would still like to contribute or pre - order a copy of the book, please get in touch and we would be more than happy to work something out , just send an email to :

judith@unpatient.com

Why Brilliant is so brilliant :

Brilliant is a playful, modern, timeless and educational photography art book for children that INSPIRES kids to engage their observation skills and imaginations.

Brilliant is a unique blend of mixed genres combining documentary-street style photography with fantasy illustration blurring the boundaries between the real and imaginary worlds in a way that is totally natural for children. This makes learning a fun and positive experience.

The book maintains an organic, 'hand-made' feel throughout. Everything was created MANUALLY without any use of computer programs, the photographs were shot on film, enlarged, then printed before being painted onto by hand. This has created a refreshing contrast to all the 3D and computer animated media which can sometimes feel a bit distant to the viewer.



A visual adventure, handmade with love 

About the creators:

Photographer Judith Erwes and illustrator Paul Bower have been collaborating on  projects for several years. They've always had the idea to create a book to engage children and adults alike that combines the genres of photography and illustration in a unique, special and innovative way. They've worked on the concept and content of 'Brilliant' for the last two years and would love to see it finally in print :) .


More details about the final product :

Book size:  26x20cm , 36 full-colour pages

Edition of 500




CONCEPT :

This is an innovative, multifunctional, educational photography-picture book for young children (and everyone else who loves looking at nice things). The book is divided into two parts :

The first part teaches and introduces the primary colour scheme (red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple) by illustrating real and imaginary objects amongst a photographic scenery. The audience is encouraged to become absorbed into this playful world of learning and wonder. No further text is needed as as the rich, visual landscape speaks for itself and there are lots of things to explore and discover (particularly appealing to kids pre-school age). 


The second part functions as a colouring book that lets the children participate, using the knowledge they have gained from the first part of the book.


Printed on quality recycled paper, the book has a perfect surface for drawing and painting onto.



WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT :
We are setting this crowd-funding goal at £2500 to get the ball rolling.
This will help to get the project off the ground and much closer to our aim of a fully printed book.

After two years of work, all the artwork is completed, and all 36 pages are waiting to go to print. We just have to drop them off at our London based printers!
Good quality lithographic printing isn't cheap. The book will be fairly large, which will be more enjoyable to kids' eyes and easier for them to draw and paint in.

Our ultimate goal is to have 500 copies made, which will cost £5000 but with your help to reach £2500, (and possibly more), we will be well on our way to completion.
Obviously, the more support we get, the better our chances are to lift it off the ground sooner and eventually onto the shelves of all good book stores for a wider public.


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET :

Costs breakdown:

Printing 500 copies , 36 pages full-colour : £5000

Packaging : £200

Additional posters and stickers : £200

Crowd-funding fee  : approx. £200

Backers will receive the final product in the post as soon as the books come back from the printers.
We also offer some extra treats, like posters showing images from the book as well as stickers. Have a look at our different awards that are listed on this page.

    Why the project is so valuable :

    There isn't a book like Brilliant out there. We felt that traditional educational children's books explaining colours are not as vibrant and exciting as ours as Brilliant also contains photographs showing characters out of real life. 95% of books for children only contain illustration. To include photographs makes a connection to daily life scenery which especially the young viewer can relate to. We wanted to create something that broke the mould of the books already available and inject a new spark of life and chaotic fun to an area of learning that could be full of possibilities.
    The world we have created is inclusive of the audience and invites children and parents alike to dive in and join all the characters in a fun and original way.

    Our simple goal is to bring a positive and unlimited sense of fun and imagination into learning for young children, with the aim to communicate the idea that anything can happen in the pages of our book and also in the world outside of it. Our work is always vibrant and chaotic but in a positive and charming way.

    Both Judith and Paul have successful careers as artists individually. Judith as a photographer working for magazines, in publishing and on book projects.
    Paul's illustration work covers editorial, advertising, theatre, children's furnishings and book covers ( incl winning best book cover award at the V& A Museum ).
    Together they have worked successfully as a team on many projects and felt that the time was right to put all this creativity towards something they feel is an important and positive influence.



    Are there any risks :
    Everything is very straightforward. The content has already been created and is ready to go to print. Test prints have been done on our paper of choice. We will be using excellent and experienced London-based printers we have worked with before.


    HOW YOU CAN HELP :
    First of all, please SHARE this page :)

    https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/brilliant-a-...

    It is super easy, just click on the link above— like us, tweet us, share via your favorite social media platform. You can also share the link via email to tell your friends and family.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED BUT YOU CAN STILL SUPPORT OUR CAUSE THAT PROVIDES FREE THERAPEUTIC  PAINTING EVENTS TO THOSE EXPERIENCING TRAUMA  OR POST-TRAUMA DUE TO THE WAR IN ISRAEL!!

https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/send-money-online

nibrenner2@juno.com

     

TOGETHER WE CAN BRING THE HEALING POWER OF CREATIVITY TO THOSE WHO NEED IT MOST!!

THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED BUT YOU CAN STILL SUPPORT OUR CAUSE THAT PROVIDES FREE THERAPEUTIC  PAINTING EVENTS TO THOSE EXPERIENCING TRAUMA  OR POST-TRAUMA DUE TO THE WAR IN ISRAEL! 

https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/send-money-online

nibrenner2@juno.com

Israel Forever Foundation published a blog on our campaign!

http://israelforever.org/interact/blog/saferoom_art/


Thank you Sara Jacobovici from Raanana, for your AMAZING donation of TONS of art supplies for our campaign!!                             

While all Israelis are suffering, for families waiting for a loved one to come home from the front lines, the anxiety is indescribable. Our campaign provides free art therapy and therapeutic painting events to those who are experiencing trauma or post-trauma due to the war in Israel.  I have witnessed first-hand the healing power of creativity. We are appealing for donations to assist in purchasing canvases, paint, supplies, refreshments and everything needed to provide a therapeutic creative escape for mothers, wives and children of our IDF soldiers.
Go to www.artbyninaelizabeth.com for more info on our painting events.

         

Art speaks the language of human expression. Together with Shira Frimer, an exceptional expressive art therapist and founder of the Cope Creatively Clinic in Rehovot, we have decided to embark on a journey to bring art therapy to those who need it most – the families of the IDF.

It is our goal to offer free therapeutic painting events around Israel for the mothers, wives, siblings, and children of our soldiers.  During this difficult time, we believe that a creative, safe and fun environment will provide a brief respite from the trauma of war. It is our hope that participants will be able to leave these events with a smile, despite it all.

                                                     


          THE MOTHERS, WIVES AND CHILDREN OF OUR IDF SOLDIERS DESERVE A CREATIVE ESCAPE

My bomb shelter is my art studio.

Since the current conflict in Israel began, my family and I have found ourselves in the steel-enforced safe-room that used to just be my art studio, gazing at the paintings on the walls and waiting for the shaking boom that indicates the missile headed for us has been intercepted. When the siren wails I have 60 seconds to gather my children and run to our safe room. It used to just be my studio.

It is in this safe room that I began to understand the positive impact art could have on our panic-stricken population. We are seeking shelter from the incoming barrage of rockets – but we are equally in search of a safe space that provides an escape from the fear, confusion and anxiety of war. This therapeutic outlet has become integral to how our family is coping, and it is my belief that many other families could likewise benefit from the redemptive power of artistic expression.


        THE FAMILIES OF OUR IDF SOLDIERS DESERVE A CREATIVE ESCAPE

                                           

 I have been teaching therapeutic art courses and hosting special  painting events throughout Israel for over 5 years.  I have seen how art builds confidence and contributes to the emotional well-being of the participants. Painting events are filled with laughter, positivity and a feeling of connection, and participants leave feeling accomplished and proud of their completed masterpiece.

“"I've attended several of Nina's therapeutic painting events and found them to be very effective at reducing stress and connecting with others in a relaxing and fun way. Nina painting events seek to provide a few hours of relaxation and fun for those who need a creative escape”

- Y.M. (Rehovot) 

During this time of intense anxiety, we are all paying an emotional toll. However, stress will not end with the current crisis – the long-term pain and trauma of war will haunt Israel’s citizens long after the last siren has wailed. Many people are already experiencing deep psychological strain. These individuals feel isolated, angry and confused. If left untreated, these feeling may deteriorate into depression.

CREATIVITY CAN HELP WITH ANXIETY, STRESS, ANGER AND SO  MUCH MORE!

While all Israelis are suffering, for families waiting for a loved one to come home from the front lines, the anxiety is indescribable. When a soldier is deployed, the family members live from minute to minute, waiting for news. Even the simplest daily tasks can feel overwhelming. Sending a loved one to war is an unimaginable experience, and it is these families who are most in need of a therapeutic outlet.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

In order to make our vision possible, we are appealing for donations to assist in purchasing canvases, paint, supplies, refreshments and everything needed to have a relaxing, fun and healing evening of creative expression. We will also be looking for volunteers at our events to babysit so that even mothers of young children will be able to participate easily.

TOGETHER WE CAN BRING THE HEALING POWER OF CREATIVITY TO THOSE WHO NEED IT MOST!



To be a part of this therapeutic campaign please visit http://igg.me/at/healthroughART/x/8250728

For more information go to www.artbyninaelizabeth.com

story:
UPDATE: SOLD OUT !!

WOW!! Thank you so so much to the 50 people who contributed to this campaign-- I ended up selling all the books through Indiegogo pre-orders and the rest in person.

PLEASE NOTICE: If you order a book now, you will probably not receive it until January 2015!

You can totally still order it through Monday December 15 at midnight, but it will not go out with the initial orders because they are all sold and I have to get more printed! :)
Thank you!!
----Joey
••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

For You

This is a coloring book about you. You are all these weird creatures, feeling all the feels.

My name is Joey and I am an artist living in Philadelphia. I make art for you (and me) and other earthmates. Now these creatures are ready for you to participate in their creation by giving them life-color ! Come on in.


Here You Go

  • This campaign will fund the local printing of the book at a small business in Philadelphia, PA. Invest in local art that makes you feel things!
  • You get this awesome book with 30 pieces of tear-out art to make your own. It's $20, which includes shipping, and a postcard print of "I'm Feeling My Feelings" to send to a friend! That's about $0.66 per piece of art (AKA page). AKA it's kind of a steal.
  • P.S. I don't think the drawings would give a kid nightmares, but there's a fair helping of uncensored emotion. It's not not for kids. Well, take a look at the video and gallery and see for yourself.

This is So Good

Coloring Books are therapeutic. The Guardian said so.

This world is so beautiful and heart-breaking and confusing and real. These drawings are playful, sorrowful, discouraged, hopeful, disturbing, wonderful, dreamlike and genuine. When your feelings build up, PLEASE turn up that album you love, bust out this coloring book, and feel your feelings. That's what feelings are for.

These genderless, raceless (speciesless?) creatures are for you. They are reminders of the human-ness in every creature, and the creature-ness in every human. When you color them in, you'll see yourself, yourself as a child, yourself as your parent, yourself as your partner, friend, enemy, pet, and stranger.

Other Ways You Can Help

I hate money too, and I understand if this isn't the right time to spend $20. Also, there's probably somebody out there who will LOVE this coloring book and they just won't know about it until you share this link on their facebook wall, or text them excitedly about it, or just sing about it in the streets. So if you could do that, that would be great.

I hate money too, and I understand if this isn't the right time to spend $20. story:
SHAPING MY DREAM INTO REALITY

 Trading my original artwork for your help to start making a new collection

15 EUR PERKS

My name is Lada Primorac and I am the artist who found a way to connect my greatest passions together in one - my healing gift and art expression that I have loved since ever.

35 EUR PERK


75 EUR PERK 

Now for two years already I have been working on developing a kind of healing art jewelry which is inspired by and dedicated to spreading the message of love, peace and understanding.


100 EUR PERK 

By being very passionately involved in my artwork in the process of creating, whoever wears this little art pieces feels realy special and kind of protected. It also exhibits some very gentle healing properties.


150 EUR PERK 


200 EUR PERK 

 I am happily offering my unique handcrafted art to everyone who can contribute. 

250 EUR PERK 

Behind every piece there is a true story and a truly positive meditation.

300 EUR PERK 

Creating my art feels undescribably amazing :)


350 EUR PERK 

I am hopelessly passionate about my artwork. 


450 EUR PERK 

I'm in LOVE.


750 EUR PERK 

All the funds I gather will be spent to buy the most needed materials and tools to start my artwork project. I know exactly how to do it and I have made drawings of the final designs. Also I figured out how to expose my artwork in the media, after I finish making the collection (Public exhibition, post to my web page, social websites, art galleries and the press)


1 000 EUR PERK

 I present you my idea and ask for your colaboration with your kind, heartfelt contribution to help me start making this vission into reality.

***

Please please please spread the word around the globe:

 https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/shaping-my-dream-into-reality

Thank you with all my heart !!! 

Lada Primorac

story:
E M M A   F O R  H E I M A

                                                              >>----------->
_____________________________________________________________________________
_____________________________________________________________________________

In the Spring of 2014 while attending the Vytacil Artist Residency in upstate New York, Emma submitted an application to a residency in Seyðisfjörður, Iceland.        H E I M A is a collective of individuals coming together to support the practice of art and build a community of artists looking to work together as well as separately. Provided with a studio and living quarters, she has been given the opportunity to stay on campus, focus on her studio practice and build a new portfolio. 

Emma has been studying and making work since her youth as a homeschooled student and has perpetuated her career as an artist by receiving her BFA from the University of Minnesota, as well as studying realism in Florence, Italy.  She has recently returned from her degree in Italy and now is emerged in a full time studio practice at her Minneapolis studio.

Subsidizing her work in Minneapolis, with residency programs, Emma has attended and been invited to over a dozen residencies world wide. H E I M A has been one of her preferred programs  and will begin 2015. 
                                             __________________________

          

        

                                                __________________________

H E I M A meaning 'home' could be my home for upwards of a year.  Upon acceptance I have been allotted a position at the residency for a year and am encouraged to come and go, or stay for the full year.  A newly established program of young adults, H E I M A is a multidisciplinary collective for emerging and established artists and is a place where I can study as a post graduate.

                           


        

*LOWER PEICES ARE DENSITE PANELS- New works by Emma made on substrate similar to plaster. 
With help, Emma will be able to build a new body of work so as to further her career in art making and give her practice the time that it needs to grow. H E I M A is a place where all this can be done and at a fraction of the cost of living and working at home.  

H E I M A is an affiliate of the LungA school also in Seyðisfjörður, Iceland. The individuals participating in the development of H E I M A have also simultaneously opened a school for the arts.  Looking to assist all artists within their specific pre or post education practices. Emma will be able to work along side and participate in discussions and development of the LungA school,  a new school for undergraduate artists. 

              

                                                        LungA school, 2014.  

                                                 __________________________

                                   ALL IN ORDER


                        In anticipation for the program Emma is fundraising!

Travel, artist supplies and a low cost of living, as well as the purchase of a key for the completion of the membership.   Emma intends to leave early June, 2015 - November, 2015, and stay 6 months out of the 12 available.  The purchase of her flight and supplies at $500, as well as the payment of  12.000 DDK or $2000 to the H E I M A program.

                      This key will act act as rent cost for the 6 months of stay.
                                  Averging to a little over €250 a month. 

             

         

           

                                  H E I M A Residency. Seyðisfjörður, Iceland

                                                __________________________

   

     

              

                                              __________________________

                                  YOUR IMPACT

                                                                    =
            Giving an emerging artist  an opportunity for artist emersion                                                        and intensive study as a post graduate. 
                                      Supporting  H E I M A & LungA
                      SUPPORTING CONTEMPORARY PAINTING PRACTICE
        Receiving an original drawing or painting to add to your collection. 
                                  
                                        MORE
                                 _____________
Emma's web address:
www.emmaccook.com
For more information pertaining to the residency, 
please visit HEIMA'S website:
www.h-e-i-m-a.com
or their Blog at:
www. h-e-i-m-a-b-l-o-g.tumblr.com
The LUNGA school:
http://lunga.is/
           ______________________________________________________________
                                                       >>>------------>
                                                     T H A N K   Y O U 

                                                               ECC

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What's the Project?

Playascape is a large undulating amphitheatre encouraging exploration and social connection. Visitors can come sit; lounge; lie; climb; watch; perform - the opportunities are wide and wild. Everyone can become a performer of sorts, on their own terms - or take refuge in the shade, and find peace in its valleys. The contours weave together gentler and steeper journeys, encouraging investigation.

Playascape orients to both sunrise and sunset, and offers extensive shade at noon, with all sorts of nooks to huddle into. At night, we welcome the Playa’s magnificent sounds cars to come dock with us. As their beats ring out across the desert, our community rises to their feet and dances across the illuminated contours - forming a magical wall of dancers.

 

What's your motivation for doing it?

We want to provide a beautiful, useful social space: a platform for creativity and culture, as well as a space of refuge and respite. We’d like to unlock and unleash imaginations and performances. For people to come together, and connect. Our lead hasn’t been back to the Burn for 20 years - and feels he owes the community something to make up for that absence. A recent shift in family circumstances means he can finally spend the month in Nevada that this project needs to get built.

 

Who are you?

Alex Haw - the motor behind the project - is an artist and architect. By day he designs sensual, sculptural spaces that prompt human interaction; by night he arranges large, immersive, high-production costume events, similarly centred on enabling participants. Playascape converges these 2 passions - spaces & people.

More widely, we’re a heterogeneous team from all around the world, assembled in the belief that this project offers something beautiful and valuable. Team members embody a variety of expertise - from engineering to rigging, lighting to electronics, management to event planning, DJing to performing - all driven by the same call to gift the best experience possible.

 

How are you making it?

Playascape’s made using a technique we’ve explored intensively: CNC-routed plywood components that can be quickly assembled. We've designed an intricate 3D model, replete with intense articulation and perforation, which we split into parts and cut with a computerised machine at the wonderful maker space in Reno - the Generator. Each part is clearly labelled with an address, enabling a non-specialist build team to easily identify its location within the whole. We’ll spend 8 days preparing parts, test-assembling + adding electronics in Reno, then 5 putting it altogether on Playa.

 

What happens to it after Burning Man?

We are delighted that our good friends at non-profit We Are From Dust are almost certainly going to take it (gifted) as 1 of only 2 projects they will curate from the Playa this year. Their current plan is to relocate Playascape to Point San Pablo Harbor (PSPH), a marina and recreational boat harbor overlooking the Bay in Richmond, California; we thus journey from lake-bed to sea. So between Man & Temple Burns on Sunday we’ll disassemble it all and neatly load a truck to ferry it to its future. This plan does, however, depend on them raising the necessary funds to cover transport, insurance and any labour costs, so we are having to remain open to other options; if you're interested - please do get in touch!

 

What about funds?

We've battled to find all the money ourselves. We've organised 5 separate fundraiser events in London that have collectively raised $28,000. We also just hit our initial early target of  $19k (lowered for achievability) on this final crowdfund campaign - totalling $47,000. A massive Thank You to all those that made vital contributions, and helped share the campaign. 

We're still $15,000 short - on a minimised budget based only on material costs (absolutely no fees, flights, food or hotels). We need that extra to enable us build the project to the maximum size we can - as wide and tall as possible, with amazing lighting:

An extra $6000 (47>53k) allows us to build the final missing bays, though at a lower height.

A further $4000 (53>57k) allows us to then finally build it all to the maximum height we need.

A further $5,000 (57>62k) allows us to finally add beautiful addressable-pixel LED lighting.

 

What does the money go on?

300 sheets of 8x4' sustainably-sourced birch plywood + 200 timber battens

+ 1 Month CNC time + 1km LEDs + cabling + controls

+ 25,000 screws + waterproof glue; tools; generator; space-rental; transport

Why should I support you?

This is an utterly unique project and moment - extraordinary architecture hosting incredible performances (Robot Heart + Mayan Warrior + so much amazingness). 

We have everything in place to make this happen - a large, enthusiastic and talented team, with space, flights, hotels & equipment booked; we just now need a final investment. We believe this project will be socially transformative  - on playa and beyond. We believe it will bring joy, opportunity and connection. Maybe now with a sound legacy secured you too can now come enjoy it. Many people would be very grateful for anything you can give.

Whatever happens we're coming & gifting this; please help us make the gift supreme.

We've designed an intricate 3D model, replete with intense articulation and perforation, which we split into parts and cut with a computerised machine at the wonderful maker space in Reno - the Generator. Each part is clearly labelled with an address, enabling a non-specialist build team to easily identify its location within the whole. We’ll spend 8 days preparing parts, test-assembling + adding electronics in Reno, then 5 putting it altogether on Playa. What happens to it after Burning Man?We are delighted that our good friends at non-profit We Are From Dust are almost certainly going to take it (gifted) as 1 of only 2 projects they will curate from the Playa this year. Their current plan is to relocate Playascape to Point San Pablo Harbor (PSPH), a marina and recreational boat harbor overlooking the Bay in Richmond, California; we thus journey from lake-bed to sea. So between Man & Temple Burns on Sunday we’ll disassemble it all and neatly load a truck to ferry it to its future. This plan does, however, depend on them raising the necessary funds to cover transport, insurance and any labour costs, so we are having to remain open to other options; if you're interested - please do get in touch! What about funds?We've battled to find all the money ourselves. We've organised 5 separate fundraiser events in London that have collectively raised $28,000. We also just hit our initial early target of  $19k (lowered for achievability) on this final crowdfund campaign - totalling $47,000. A massive Thank You to all those that made vital contributions, and helped share the campaign. We're still $15,000 short - on a minimised budget based only on material costs (absolutely no fees, flights, food or hotels). We need that extra to enable us build the project to the maximum size we can - as wide and tall as possible, with amazing lighting:An extra $6000 (47>53k) allows us to build the final missing bays, though at a lower height.A further $4000 (53>57k) allows us to then finally build it all to the maximum height we need.A further $5,000 (57>62k) allows us to finally add beautiful addressable-pixel LED lighting. What does the money go on?300 sheets of 8x4' sustainably-sourced birch plywood + 200 timber battens+ 1 Month CNC time + 1km LEDs + cabling + controls+ 25,000 screws + waterproof glue; tools; generator; space-rental; transportWhy should I support you?This is an utterly unique project and moment - extraordinary architecture hosting incredible performances (Robot Heart + Mayan Warrior + so much amazingness). We have everything in place to make this happen - a large, enthusiastic and talented team, with space, flights, hotels & equipment booked; we just now need a final investment. We believe this project will be socially transformative  - on playa and beyond. We believe it will bring joy, opportunity and connection. Maybe now with a sound legacy secured you too can now come enjoy it. Many people would be very grateful for anything you can give.Whatever happens we're coming & gifting this; please help us make the gift supreme.

story:
OUR PROJECT:

When the Burning Man 2013 theme, Cargo Cult, was announced, it really sparked a creative fire.  The relation of the cults to superior technology, appearing as if magic, carries a certain appeal that mimics what we do in the desert.  The inclusion of our 21st century culture, our Burner culture, as a new and savvy cargo cult awaiting to be delivered from destruction via as-yet-unseen technology inspired a flood of project ideas for the playa.

When the opportunity arose to create a Minnesota C.O.R.E. project, one story of gifts from an advanced alien culture jumped forth: The Day The Earth Stood Still.

In the 1956 film, an alien culture attempts to warn mankind to not continue down the path toward atomic annihilation.  Through ignorance and xenophobia humankind almost destroys itself by imprisoning the messenger.  The allegory was brought forward to a contemporary B-Movie remake, with environmental catastrophe replacing nuclear weapons as the antagonist.  Is the ultimate gift protecting ourselves from our own technology?  Learning that lesson would benefit everyone.

The design of the effigy utilizes simple disc shapes, that become a canvas for celebrating that technology.  The form of the discs is forward looking, evoking a desire to contact an advanced civilization for guidance, while also evoking the past and the primitive, in reference to B-Movie SciFi and through the use of primitive construction materials, similar to the design of effigies in the Soloman Island cargo cults. 

 

WHAT DO WE NEED:

Your generous contributions will help our team cover such costs as:  

•  truck rental and fuel to transport the effigy 1,800 miles to the Playa

•  the LED array for lighting the effigy (LED controllers, DMX boxes, interactive sensors)

•  materials (lumber and fasteners) and tool purchase

•  rental for effigy build space

•  items for on and off-playa gifting 

•  250 gallon water tank for MN C.O.R.E. camp in Black Rock City

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

•  Donating, of course!

•  Share our campaign!  Use the buttons on this page to tell your friends.

•  Send us your love and energy as our team completes our journey to the desert!

 

Thank you so much for checking out our project!  We've had a blast, made new friends, and strengthened the Minnesota Burner community exponentially.  

We send all of you our dusty and overflowing love and gratitude.

 

OUR TEAM:

Tom Mays                    "Active Buckaroo"         Designer/Project Lead

Lauren Drow                 "Blue Niteowl"             Fundraising/Project Coordinator

Steven Grafing              "Reverend Zed"           Fundraising/Regional Contact

Chris Engstrom              "Hawthorn"                Construction Lead/Fire Perimeter Lead

Kellie Larson                 "Alice"                      Fundraising/F.A.S.T. Lead

Jon Richardson                                             Electrical Lead

Ian Smith                    "Teddy Moment"          LNT Lead

Teresa Espenas Jugovich  "Tasty"                     Docent/Greeter Lead

Andrew Korf                                                Graphics Design

David Schnack                                             Fundraising Lead/Documentarian

Devin Nee                                                   LED Programming Lead

 

AND THANK YOU TO THE DOZENS OF VOLUNTEERS WHO ALREADY HAVE OR WILL HELP ON THIS PROJECT!!

story:
The Project:

The Lights on Cumberland Street project is an initiative that will create an art installation made of light bulbs on the ceiling of Beacon's sanctuary.  

Beacon is a non-profit faith community hybrid in the Kensington neighborhood of Philadelphia. Beacon invites people of all ages to grow together through arts, learning, and faith. We offer opportunities for personal and community growth through secular art and literacy programs for children and adults, tending a vegetable garden that resources healthy snacks for its programs, and through gathering for weekly worship. 

Kensington is a neighborhood rich with diverse voices, and Beacon seeks to be a gathering of those voices, a conversation comprised of neighbors from all directions, and animated by the art of our children, the wisdom of our history, and the generosity of faith.  

This project is meant to visually represent not only our goal of being a beacon to this neighborhood, but our role as a space for creative expression and collaboration. We chose light bulbs both as a symbol of light and innovation, and for the way in which an industrial fixture reflects the aesthetic and philosophy of the neighborhood. Each light bulb will represent an individual donor, and like lighting a prayer candle on behalf of a loved one, it will represent that donor’s dream for this community.  These donors will be recognized, along with their dreams and prayers, in community art project that will be displayed along with the lights.

 

Be a Light:

  • We need $3,000 to meet our goal and we already have $500 raised. We need your help to raise the remaining $2,500.
  • These funds cover the materials, an installation to commemorate donors like you, and an electrician to safely install it. 
  • For every $20 donated, you will have 1 lightbulb designated as your light, a light honoring a loved one, or a light honoring one of the children of this neighborhood
  • If we do not reach our goal of $2,500, the funds you donate will still go towards purchasing and installing your lightbulb. The more lightbulbs we have (up to 150), the more visually stunning the art installation will be. If we are not able to fund the project via Indiegogo and local campaigns, funds will be returned to donors. 

The Impact:

We want this project to reflect the beauty of Beacon's neighbors and the beauty of donors far and near who care about building community through the arts. Your involvement makes this project a community collaboration, which is a huge part of our mission as an organization.

Other Ways to Be a Light:

Spread the word! Share this campaign with your friends, family, and social networks, and encourage people to contribute their light to this project.

story:
About our Campaign

During the stay at home orders due to Covid-19, we have been working hard to stay connected to our clients. Many small businesses are struggling, and many artists are itching to get back to work, and we are no different. We have had many people ask how they can be supportive while we are not working, and we did not want to ask for help without being able to offer anything in return to those contributing to our business. Any little bit helps, from small packages to large. This will be one of the few times aside from the holidays that we sell discounted gift certificates, so act now - especially if you have an upcoming appointment when we return!

What We Need & What You Get

We have a loose goal of $2,000. We have applied for small business relief loans, but at this time we have not heard anything back. We are doing okay, and artists are still able to get paid during the time off due to savings we had built, but all the help from our supporters will help that stretch a little further. When we reopen, we hope to be in a good place to where we are not stretched too thin. With your contribution, you can select any of the following perks:

  • T-Shirts
  • Prints
  • Jewelry discounts
  • Free Piercings
  • Discounted Gift Certificates

What will your contribution support?

Every amount we raise will continue going to financial support to pay artists while on leave, stay current on rent and bills, and help us re-stock when we prepare to reopen. Part of the contributions will raise funds to pay for the perk items we will be providing, which will be available for in person pick up only at the studio once we reopen and orders have been fulfilled.

Challenges for our campaign

This has been a difficult time for many of us. We know that the uncertainty of the next year or two may provide a lot of unexpected hurdles. We are doing our best to prepare for those now. We hope that through all of this, we can stick together and continue offering services even from a distance. 

*Due to the shut down of many businesses, and the uncertainty of shipping costs and production times, we are currently unable to offer shipping options. Additionally, when we reopen there will be a period of time where we will be working around the clock to contact all appointments and put things back together, and sending packages will not be feasible. We will make announcements for when the products will be available, and we will have them ready for pickup after that time. For anyone purchasing gift certificates or discount perks, those will be available immediately following the end of this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends, or ban together to buy a bulk package with a few buddies. Thank you again for all of your help and support during this time!

story:
Revive, Restore, and Re-Upholstering Lives

For the past 6 years Teena's Legacy has not only been a safe space where people can come to learn how to reupholster furniture, they also come and experience a process that guides them to seek out and  explore their authentic selves. As they're stripping down and removing the old fabric, they are simultaneously pulling back and dissecting the layers of their own lives, leaving them with a "Statement Piece" that tells their story.  

 

My Story

 

 

The Strength of a Black Man

B.E.S.T Academy (all boys high school in Atlanta)

This year we would love to expand our vision from just a summer apprentice program to a full 12 week training program for women age ranging from 25-40 whose dealing with the following challenges:

  1. A single mother whose unemployed looking for financial stability for her household. 
  2. Formerly incarcerated and looking for a second chance. 
  3. If she is homeless and looking to re-build from the ground up. 
  4. Any woman who's looking to re-define herself, or looking to start her own business.
  5. And finally any woman who's ready to answer the following 3 questions:

Who Am I

Where Am I

Where Am I Going

A Woman's Worth

 

The ASK!

We would love to raise $50,000 to cover our 2019-2020 Re-upholster with a Purpose (R.W.P) program or $100,000 for 2 years of programming.

  1. R.W.P will begin in Sept. 2019- Dec. 2019 and Feb. 2020-May 2020
  2. The funds will also include our Summer Apprentice Program for our youth starting in June 2020. 
  3. A portion of the funds will purchase a embroidery machine to customize our pieces. 

FLASH!!!

The Hope Center 

The DIRECT IMPACT You Will have...

  1. Your donation will help me fulfill the calling God placed in my Spirit, which is to create safe spaces for women to explore their authentic selves using upholstery as a conduit for economic transformation and healing. 
  2. Your donation will help jump start the vehicle that will change the trajectory of many women lives on a Global level. 
  3. Not only will your donation help the women entering our program, but you will indirectly help their children and community. 

Studies show that when women are supported and empowered, communities become more resilient and all of society benefits.

  • Finally your donation will help the women entering our program learn a valuable trade that has the potential to boost their self-esteem, sharpen their imagination, and enhance their creative mind. 

My Daughter's Kindergarten Class  

Testimonials 

 

 

Our Mission

Is to create a safe space for women to explore their authentic self using upholstery as a conduit for self-reflection, self-expression and economic transformation. 

Encouraging and educating women to empower themselves and take ownership of their lives is our goal. Because of our commitment to enlighten women to live into their souls this holistic approach has the potential to strengthening their families and transforming the communities which they live.

Talk About Teena's Legacy

 

Voyage ATL article:  http://voyageatl.com/interview/meet-jamika-smith-teenas-legacy-cartersville-ga-serve-atlanta-metro-area/

Voyage Chicago article: http://voyagechicago.com/interview/meet-teenas-legacy-southwest-side/

Mending Lives by Mending Furniture ( summer program):  https://vimeo.com/128504850 

Chicago Sun-Times https://chicago.suntimes.com/2016/6/24/18446784/laura-washington-reupholstering-a-chair-becomes-soul-changing

www.teenaslegacy.com

story:
Creature What?

A social network for robots? Yes, you are reading that correctly.

A little about myself: My name is Merlijn. I make interactive projects and installations using tools like Processing and Arduino.

So what is an apparat? An apparat can be a simple robot, a complex one, a website, or an interactive installation: any device or program that uses a form of artificial intelligence.

Creature Apparat is a social network for these apparats. It aims to increase the complexity of your apparat's artificial intelligence through building connections with other people's apparats. It will:

  • shape the interactions of your creation with other apparats.
  • help your apparat make friends and communicate with them.

Many projects are using artificial intelligence in isolation. If there is any exterior input at all, it is a datastream form the web. Creature Apparat has a different approach. We focus on the social interactions between apparats in order to create a more complex and organic artificial intelligence.

The first version of this project was only accessible to me. Now I want to open up this project to everyone. In order to do this, I need funding for the following things:

  • The project website, which will be user friendly, fast, secure and accessible.
  • An API for developers, with documented code and examples for the most current platforms.

With your help we can start up this social network for robots, websites and digital creatures of all kinds. The future possibilities of this project are endless, but not without your support!

This is what you get

The system will eventually be open for anyone, but for starters it will be limited to those who support Creature Apparat, whether financially or by helping with the actual coding and system development. What's in it for you?

  • You'll get a number of API Keys so you can start to connect your apparat.
  • One lucky person can get a working version of my own prototype of Creature Alpha to connect to the system.

Funding will go to good and fast hosting, including a private IP and an SSL certificate. We need these to guarantee speed (hosting) and security (private ip, ssl). The remainder of the funding will go to the expansion of the project, the site, and the API.

How can I get involved?

With your help we'll be able get this project started! Can't help financially? Don't worry, there's a lot of other help we could use:

  • Spread the word, on human networks such as Twitter, Facebook or Pinterest
  • If you are a web developer you can help me code.
  • If you are an apparat developer you can share your thoughts and ideas. Let me know what Creature Apparat would be for you!

If you have any questions or ideas, feel free to let me know in the comments or via twitter @capparat.

You'll get a number of API Keys so you can start to connect your apparat.
One lucky person can get a working version of my own prototype of Creature Alpha to connect to the system.
Funding will go to good and fast hosting, including a private IP and an SSL certificate. We need these to guarantee speed (hosting) and security (private ip, ssl). The remainder of the funding will go to the expansion of the project, the site, and the API.
How can I get involved?
With your help we'll be able get this project started! Can't help financially? Don't worry, there's a lot of other help we could use:

Spread the word, on human networks such as Twitter, Facebook or Pinterest
If you are a web developer you can help me code.
If you are an apparat developer you can share your thoughts and ideas. Let me know what Creature Apparat would be for you!
If you have any questions or ideas, feel free to let me know in the comments or via twitter @capparat.

story:
Our Story

I'm a professional artist, writer and comic creator with over a decade of experience. As is well known in the creative arts world, from time-to-time things get tight financially. I have an exhibition of my artwork opening on March 31st and running until May 4th. And I'm short a few frames. As you may know, frames are expensive. Also some art needs to be reproduced and printed digitally for display. Times are tight and help is appreciated. 


The Impact

This is my first ever real art exhibition of my work. A collection of pop, surreal, realistic, and comic art that spans a decade and crosses multiple boundaries of style and genre. As I said, this is my first legitimate exhibition and it is an important step to help me pursue my passion as a career that I can make a living on. My work has been steadily gaining more and more national media attention for the last year and this exhibit will be a key step in continuing that trend.


On the opening night of April 1st at 7pm there will also be a meet and great with the me, (the artist) and I'll be signing copies of my various comic books. 50% of profits from issue sales will be donated to the Hamilton Salvation Army.

What We Need & What You Get

We need frames and limited digital prints, and your help meeting the expenses associated with that will be rewarded with my undying love and admiration as well as a donor thank you listing online and displayed at the exhibition, as well as the many perks listed to the right based on the level of financial help you can offer.


This would be a great event for any business, publisher, tv station, newspaper or radio station to sponsor! We would also give you signage at the exhibit!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help out financially you can help in a few simple ways:


Share: Share this campaign on your social media sites with the share buttons on this page.


Loan me some frames: If you're in the Hamilton area and have some frames we can borrow for the duration of the show let me know. Contact me on Facebook or Twitter or message me to ask about my e-mail for a list of sizes needed. I just need them for the month long show. If you can loan some frames your name will also be added to the donor list displayed online and at the show. I'll also hook you up with a signed 5 X 7 pencil sketch and a black and white print.


Come to the show!: The Art of Mike Gagnon Exhibit is being hosted at the Freeway Coffeehouse and Gallery located at 333 King St. East, Hamilton, Ontario, Canada from March 31st to May 4th. Come to the opening night event at 7pm on April 1st to meet me. Signed copies of comics will be for sale and there will be a live band from 9-11 with a pay what you can cover charge. All the artwork displayed during the month long exhibition will also be for sale. There will also be free signed black and white prints.


Shop Online: You can also help by shopping on line at www.mikegagnon.ca.

story:
Hi Everyone,

Short Summary

My name is Brett Budzinski. I'm a drawer, printmaker, and painter based out of Philadelphia, Pa. I received my BFA and BA from Drake University in Des Moines, IA. This campaign is for the production of a coloring book of original drawings by me! This campaign is important to me because I want to be able to share my drawings with more people at a more attainable scale. My artwork focuses on relationships we all have with each other and having people from all over coloring and interacting with my drawings is what this book is all about. With backing this campaign you'll be helping me to cover productions costs so that I can get the books mailed out to you with your backing!


Here's where you come in!

With your backing, I'll be using the funds to pay for the production of the coloring books. All the books will be Spiral Bound, so that you can color them in, flat on a table, all printed on high-quality paper so that you can use a variety of mediums; colored pencil, pen, marker, paint, whatever you want! They will also be one sided so that if your marker bleeds it doesn't affect the drawing on the back! 
Some of the perks that come along with backing this campaign include a signed and numbered book with any donation over $15. If you donate over $25 you'll get a signed small drawing. Any donation over $50 gets a signed large drawing.
My goal for this project is $500 and that will go towards the printing of the books along with the supplies needed to create the original drawings. The additional funds will be used to help offset the cost of Graduate School admissions costs as well as entries to exhibitions and shows so that I can continue to display my artwork.

Risks & Challenges

Alright, let's talk about some tough stuff. For me to get this project off the ground at a base level I need to raise $350 that means I need 24 $15 backers. I understand that not everybody is in a position to donate 15, and I don't want you to stretch yourself thin. If you can only donate $10, $5 or even $1 I appreciate it more than you can imagine!! Your generosity won't go unmissed. I'll be sure to thank you from the bottom of my heart!! I would also appreciate it if you would share my campaign on social media so that you can help me spread the word!! 

Remember that Christmas is just around the corner and this book will be perfect for the budding artist in the family, or for the stressed to have something to relax to! 

Thank you everyone for your wonderful support!!


Brett Budzinski

story:
Résumé

Une physicienne devenue comédienne se trouve dans un train, entre le point A et le point B. Alors que sa vitesse dans le train se rapproche de l’infini, elle peut voyager librement entre deux époques de sa vie.

Le point A: la fin d’une journée de travail en laboratoire, la physicienne regarde le fond d’un bécher. Elle y voit des micro-organismes qu’elle bombarde d’un laser. À travers ces formes de vie, elle voit tous les instants de sa propre existence défiler et lui retourner le regard.

Le point B: elle sort d’une répétition de théâtre qui la bouscule jusqu’à ses plus profondes convictions sur l’art.
Pourquoi participer à cette pièce vide de sens, où elle se fait durement diriger et où elle remet en question la raison même de pratiquer ce métier?

Dans ce train bondé de gens, les passagers se transforment autour d’elle et deviennent le fil conducteur entre ces deux époques de sa vie.

Cette pièce est une ode à la vingtaine effrayante, à l’angoisse cosmique, au temps qui passe et au chemin que nous faisons toutes et tous, peu à peu. Qu’est-ce qui relie la personne que nous étions à celle que nous devenons?

 

Qui sommes-nous ?

Le Théâtre Astronaute / Astronaut Theater est une compagnie de création de théâtre bilingue issue de Québec. Notre mission est d'axer sur la création qui remet en question notre rapport individuel face à l’immense, sous toutes ses formes. Avec nos équipes de création, nous adoptons la posture de l'explorateur qui part à la découverte de l’inconnu et qui se laisse surprendre et façonner par le nouveau. Laurie Carrier et Emile Beauchemin, les deux fondateurs de la compagnie, y concentrent leurs pratiques. Ensemble, ils visent à créer des spectacles théâtraux avec une pluralité de médiums dans un processus de recherche et d’exploration organique qui donne naissance à des expériences insoupçonnées.

 

Pourquoi avons-nous besoin de 2 000,00 $

Tout ce que nous pourrons trouver sous forme de commandites, de dons et d'aide de toutes sortes, nous la recevrons les bras grands ouverts. Cependant, certaines dépenses sont inévitables et nous aurons besoin de votre aide pour y arriver.

Votre aide financière nous aidera donc à couvrir les frais reliés à plusieurs aspects de la production : 

  1. - La cachet des artistes sur le projet
  2. - Le décor
  3. - La location d'espace de travail

 

L'équipe

Mise en scène et conception – Emile Beauchemin
Texte et jeu – Stéphanie Jolicoeur
Conception – Laurie Carrier
Interprètes en danse – Alexandra St-Pierre, Elizabeth Baril Lessard, Elizabeth Crispo, Etienne Lambert, Françis Paradis, Raphaelle Fougeres

story:
ABOUT ME | ART FOR ME IS LIVING AND BEING!

I am a Dutch-born (self-taught) contemporary paper artist. My “Peace of Paper” studio in the Tel Aviv area was established in 2012. My art began with a study of nature-cycles and evolved into social and humanitarian related themes.

My artworks are best known for their original artistic style that is constructed by weaving, merging and layering hundreds (sometimes thousands) of hand-torn pieces of paper. Why paper? For me, paper is a material that can be freely worked, with an unlimited amount of possibilities and challenges.

For further information about me and my art, you are welcome to explore my website: www.biancaseverijns.com

 

MY ART PROJECT | ART INSTALLATION HUMANITARIAN PROTECTIVE BLANKET

The wall waiting for my art project in Venice will consist of humanitarian protective blankets. We are welcomed into the world in a blanket and we leave it in a blanket. In the lifetime in between, physical, metaphorical and metaphysical protective blankets for our personal existence and well being are essential but not always easy to secure. 

The art installation will consist of three protective blankets as a metaphor to convey fundamental needs and human rights, such as equality, integrity and humanity.

 

THE IMPACT | AUDIENCE PARTICIPATION

I invite the audience to actively participate in shaping the protective blanket art project by inspiring viewers to reflect upon the title "Who will protect us? Who will behold us?" and the emotions it evokes by encouraging them to share their comments.

I will leave strips of paper and writing utensils for doing so. These comment strips will be used to either expand one of the blankets or to create a new one. 

Beyond the technique, design and aesthetics my objective is to raise awareness of human rights, social justice and peace.

 

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

You can't imagine how tremendously pleased I was that the GAA Foundation invited me to participate in the Venice Biennial 2019.

To be selected is a fantastic honour and a great international opportunity. My art will be shown as part of “Personal Structures” for a six month period from  May to November with an anticipated audience of more than half a million people. This invitation is an artist’s dream come true!

The invitation comes with a participation fee price tag of 15,000 Euro and I need your help, in order to realize this art project which is very dear to my heart! 

Chief curator: Valeria  Romagnini, exhibition curators: Shira Davidi & Dorit Lautman.

Click here for a video of the 2017 edition of 'Personal Structures'

 

THE PERKS

I created unique perks that include original paper artworks, an art-zine, a limited printed series, arty small items and a special perk for art-food fans: a fun brunch at my studio!

Every support - big or small- receives a reward! Or you can simply help me by spreading the word.

So see some of the original works from up close click here!

 

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR HELPING ME REPRESENT ART AND VALUES IN VENICE!

“Our sense of humanity and integrity, our desire for warmth and safety, to be well treated and respected are worldwide the same “(Ai WeiWei).

 

Would you like to follow the GIVE SUPPORT GET ART - campaign on my social networks?

Instagram 

Facebook

story:
UPDATE:  If you are interested in purchasing tapes, CDs, LPs, totes, shirts, posters, buttons, patches, and zines, you can purchase them directly on Bandcamp -- https://rockshead.bandcamp.com

You can purchase prints, original art, and some more amazing things here! 

Thank you for all your support!

 

I've been wanting to do this for some time!! But i've been so busy with making albums i haven't found the time (or courage!)

But here we are. We're raising 15k to fulfill the first year business plan of putting out several records...

I went to city hall and got a BIZ license.

We have secured DISTRIBUTION, so the records will be in the stores. They will be online.

We got some sub licensing DEALS in Japan and Australia. This will help...

We got an office, but i don't have a walnut DESK yet, to receive clients. We've got some help from friends, it's going to work.

Every record will come with a zine, like the old SST label days with Raymond Pettibon.

We're putting together a festival to go with the label, this summer, Rocks In Your Head Fest...

story:
Hello! If you are visiting our “campaign” you are probably coming to our wedding or have already come. We hope you had/have a wonderful time :) We are so grateful for all the people who have supported us on our journey towards partnership. We both have experienced the need for community and your love and support for us has helped us have the gift of each other which we will enjoy for the rest of our lives. We love you. And we thank you with all our hearts.

We are beginning a new phase of our lives and this new phase has materialized in a new home. We are moving into a raw loft space which we are converting into beautiful studios, a workshop, and a theater. Our new space will be a platform from which we and all the people we love can nurture and grow. Both Daniel and I will have studios and we will also be renting studios to friends, so that we may all enjoy a fantastic artistic community.

We have not registered anywhere, but we feel as our new home is a perfect symbol of our union that wedding gifts to support the build-out of the space would be lovely.
With so much gratitude, Melanie & Daniel.
