story:
Hi my name is Kitty Gallanis of MissFitPhoto.com and here is my story.

As any young artist we all grow up having a dream of our work being in a museum...well i have a chance to make mine come true.  I currently work the Bookshop at the Getty Villa in Malibu and have a chance to have some work hang at the Getty Center during the Getty Underground event in the summer.  Now this is a private event that gives people like me, that work for the Getty, a chance to show our work to people in the art community, a chance i would never normally have.

I have been creating art since i was a little girl and studding it for just as long. I have put all of my blood and sweat and tears and frustrations and every dime i have in to my work...like all artists do. I have painted and sculpted and drawn myself into a tizzy most of my life, but have found my love for this world through my camera lens. Though i have strived to make my photography and art work the only job i have it hasn't happened yet. I still struggle to pay bills and scrape pennies together to try and get projects off the ground. they don't call us starving artists for nothing lol I have been a photographer for almost 10 years now and because it is my passion i do shoots for free or discount the hell out of the price because i know people are struggling as much as i am. but my photography is my art and my art is my life...and it ain't cheap.

In 2012 i was laid off from a job, as most people were in this hard economy. I struggled to broaden my photography and try and make it work as a full time job, but to no avail, in these times it wasn't possible. Luckily in 2013 i got a part time job at the Getty Villa Book Store  (Hooray!!!) a job at a place i had wanted to work at since i was a little girl. Who gets to say that? not many people, but i do :)  one of the perks for working at the Getty Villa is you, as an artist, get a chance to participate in the Getty Underground . this is a private event for getty staff and volunteers to show that they are just as talented as the artist that hang in the Museum and for influential people in the art community to see our work. Now i have been given a space to show at this event...one Piece...one grand piece that will show my creativity and what i can do. The only problem is i cant afford to do it.

When i started my mixed media project it didnt seem like it would be to much...Couple hundred for Canvas prints, couple hundred for paints and textures and lets not forget the sealants and the gold leafing and so on and so forth. Well months went by and from bills to food and rent and oh dear god the cell phone bill and cant forget internet and blah blah blah...you have these bills too so you get it :) anyways, every time i put a dime away, i had something pop up that was a quarter and needless to say i dont have anything saved. to much month at the end of my money.

So here i am, asking you for your help, any help will do. now if by chance i dont reach my goal, it's not the end of the world, the project  just won't be as grand and not with as many good supplies...but i will do it, with your help. please remember all the times i have done free gigs or knocked down prices so you could afford that shoot that you always wanted but were on a tight budget and donate a buck. that's it $1. And if your a fan of my work and have enjoyed all of the images i have done through the years, donate $1....or more...lol just something to help.

so in closing, Please help me achieve my dream of hanging at the Getty Center, you have no idea how much it would mean to me. By the way, i will be posting the finished photo of my project for all to see once it goes up in the summer of 2014 at the Getty Underground.

thank you,

Kitty Gallanis

to have some work hang at the Getty Center during the Getty Underground event
in the summer.  Now this is a private
event that gives people like me, that work for the Getty, a chance to show our
work to people in the art community, a chance i would never normally have. 
I have been creating art
since i was a little girl and studding it for just as long. I have put all of
my blood and sweat and tears and frustrations and every dime i have in to my
work...like all artists do. I have painted and sculpted and drawn myself into a
tizzy most of my life, but have found my love for this world through my camera
lens. Though i have strived to make my photography and art work the only job i
have it hasn't happened yet. I still
struggle to pay bills and scrape pennies together to try and get projects off
the ground. they don't call us starving artists for nothing lol I have been a
photographer for almost 10 years now and because it is my passion i do shoots
for free or discount the hell out of the price because i know people are
struggling as much as i am. but my photography is my art and my art is my
life...and it ain't cheap. 
In 2012 i was laid off from a job, as most people were in
this hard economy. I struggled to broaden my photography and try and make it
work as a full time job, but to no avail, in these times it wasn't possible. Luckily in 2013 i got a part time job at the
Getty Villa Book Store  (Hooray!!!) a job
at a place i had wanted to work at since i was a little girl. Who gets to say
that? not many people, but i do :)  one
of the perks for working at the Getty Villa is you, as an artist, get a chance
to participate in the Getty Underground . this is a private event for getty
staff and volunteers to show that they
are just as talented as the artist that hang in the Museum and for influential people in the art community to see our work. Now i have been given a space to show at this
event...one Piece...one grand piece that will show my creativity and what i can
do. The only problem is i cant afford to do it.
When i started my mixed media project it didnt seem like it would be to
much...Couple hundred for Canvas prints,
couple hundred for paints and textures and lets not forget the sealants and the
gold leafing and so on and so forth. Well months went by and from bills to food
and rent and oh dear god the cell phone bill and cant forget internet and blah
blah blah...you have these bills too so you get it :) anyways, every time i put a dime
away, i had something pop up that was a quarter and needless to say i dont have
anything saved. to much month at the end of my money. 
So here i am, asking you for your help, any help will do. now
if by chance i dont reach my goal, it's not the end of the world, the
project  just won't be as grand and not
with as many good supplies...but i will do it, with your help. please remember all the times i have done free gigs or knocked
down prices so you could afford that shoot that you always wanted but were on a
tight budget and donate a buck. that's it
$1. And if your a fan of my work and have enjoyed all of the images i have done
through the years, donate $1....or more...lol just something to help. 
so in closing, Please help me achieve my dream of hanging at
the Getty Center, you have no idea how much it would mean to me. By the way, i will be posting the finished photo of my project for all to see once it goes up in the summer of 2014 at the Getty Underground.thank you,Kitty Gallanis

story:
The Mighty Fingers Facing Change is a global collaborative art project that is building stronger communities, locally and globally. Mighty Fingers Facing Change will travel to a minimum of 14 locations in six continents to create a giant community mural and a series of self portraits created by adolescent girls around the world. Together, we will use our fingers to paint this progressive mural, abstract portraits, and stronger communities! At each location we will work with a different group of girls and they will use their mighty fingers to add their indelible mark to the mural, sign their name to it, create their own self portrait art piece, and collaborate with their sisters around the world. We will do this with the assistance of numorous non-profit organizations that work to support women and girls day in and day out.

Our scheduled launch in NJ was interrupted by Hurricane Sandy, but the team headed to Guatemala as scheduled on November 11th. We began our journey working with the Association IDEI and their Child and Youth Parliament in Quetzaltenango. See images on our FB page <http://www.facebook.com/MightyFingersFacingChange> and a video here under the "gallery" tab. Jackson, WY is scheduled in January, followed by Edmonton, Canada, and Austin, TX... and many more. As we progress so will the FingerSmear mural. Supporters and participants will be able to watch the project and canvas as it unfolds. Follow our progress and hear the stories of girls around the world that participate. Video uploads and blog posts <http://kellysullivanfineart.com/blog>  will keep you involved all the way until it's completion at our final location in September, 2013. In addition to the communities we will travel to, girls from all over the world will be able to participate by uploading their own self-portraits along with statements about what they will do for humanity with their "Mighty Fingers". By bringing girls together to paint and freely express themselves we will inspire collaboration and encourage them to achieve more with their mighty fingers. They will bring new vision and strength to their communities. We will share it all with you. Together, we will all create a better world - beautifully.

Please contribute in any way you can to help us reach our goal and bring this project to girls around the world! On the right you will see the GREAT Rewards for your participation. If you can support the project with Airline Miles or inkind contributions, please don't hestitatle to reach out.

  

With Our Mighty Fingers...

My name is Kelly Sullivan. My art is communication, my focus is collaboration, and my drive is community - and it always has been. Mighty Fingers Facing Change is a career opus of sorts. It's something I have envisioned for nearly 20 years. I decided to try to build it, and I am humbled and greateful for the many individuals that encourged me when it was just a concept, and have supported it with time and talent as it grew. I am greatful for our growing list of partners around the world mentioned below, and it is my true honer to help support the work they do through the work that I do. Thier commitment to supply lodging and logistical support for our team in each location is invaluable.

The final stage of our preparation takes place right on this page with all of you! We need to raise funds to pay for airfare, ground transport, art supplies, video equipment, general production expenses, and small stipend for the team to keep the lights on here at home. We want to meet our goal, so that we can help girls around the world meet theirs. You will get to know them, and you will be happy that you did.

Be moved by the power of WILL and the strength that is at your fingertips. You use your fingers to pledge, they will use their fingers to paint a better tomorrow.

 

What We'll Create Together

At each location on our trip we will execute a two-part program. During the first part we encourage and celebrate individuality as we help the girls create their own self-portraits using visualization exercises and acrylic paint. For the second part, we work together with the girls to design and paint a portion of the 10’ x 5’ Mighty Fingers global community FingerSmear mural.

 

The FingerSmear Mural

Our FingerSmear mural is a large collaborative piece of artwork created by thousands of people throughout the world. It is the unifying piece of our project, and it will tell a global story of community, collaboration and the world working together as one to create something beautiful. At each Mighty Fingers location we visit we will add to the mural. When our journey is complete, our mural will be the first-ever globally-created canvas made by the hands of girls all over the world. It will illustrate the passion and power of tomorrow's biggest change-makers. It will be Mighty.

We Will Create

  • The first ever Global FingerSmear Painting Project
  • A collection of self-portraits of adolescent girls around the world -we will have a digital version - they get to keep their original piece of art.
  • Video uploads and clips of our Mighty Fingers journey, our artwork and our impact
  • Authentic artwork from our tour to give to all of YOU, our amazing Indiegogo supporters, as PERKS.

Please take part in our Mighty Fingers project in any way you can. Enthusiasm and support from many Mighty Fingers like yours will help us reach our $145,000 goal!

 

Where We Will Go and Who We Will Work With

We are planning to bring this project to locations around the world, and in each one we have partnered with a different organization. Hosting organizations that have commited to the project so far are Rutgers Unversity's Future Scholars Program,  IDEI and The Children and Youth Parliament of Guatemala, Girls Actively Participating (GAP!) , YWCA in Edmonton, Canada, GENaustin, Boys & Girls Clubs of San Francisco, The Bright Lights Communty Learning Initiative, The Society for Transformation of Women and Children in  Nigeria, the NZE - FEE Foundation in Uganda, Caring About Women and Children in China, and The State University of Surabaya in Indonesia.  We are working to develop partnerships with organizations in Russia, Poland, Italy, the UK, Israel, South Africa, Afghanistan, Chile, and Brazil. New developments happen everyday.

 

 

Helping Girls, Helping Communities

Adolescent girls are the largest underserved and at-risk population in the world, yet they are a huge part of our world’s progress and future. They need to be reminded of the power they posses to change their world and secure a better future. We are there to help them access that power, understand the source of it, and use it. They will be encouraged to make changes that will have a positive impact - not just for themselves, but for the communities they live in and the generations they effect throughout their lifetime.

Mighty Fingers Facing Change is here to inspire the power we know exists. We are here to bring it to the surface and create a new way of seeing what lays the foundation for change. KNOWING and FEELING that you can make a difference is the very first step. Mighty Fingers Facing Change will enable girls to think creativley and critically, and express themselves freely through the honesty of art. That vision will help them grow, succeed and create stronger communities and a better future.

 

 

What is a FingerSmear?

"FingerSmears" are large collaborative paintings created under my direction using the "fingersmears" of hundreds, sometimes thousands, of people on one canvas. Kelly has had over 80,000 people stick their fingers in paint at her request, all for the purpose of adding to the larger picture, literally and figuratively.  FingerSmears have raised over $150,000 for charities across the country. They have been commissioned to commemorate All Star Baseball and Basketball Games, The US Open, The 50th Anniversary of the United Nations, and The National Walk for Epilepsy on the Mall in Washington, DC. Being able to orchastrate and create these large paintings for the past 20 years has inspired a way of life for Kelly. This Mighty Fingers Facing Change project is the best way that she, as an artist, can elevate the state of the the world through its girls - and she is excited and humbled to do this work and support one of the most exciting shifts of her lifetime - the rise of adolecsent girls and women around the world.

 

Along the Way

As we travel, teach and create, we will utilize numerous media avenues to extend our project to everyone around the world who wants to be a part of it. We will maintain a strong digital and social media presence that will enable anyone (not just the organizations and girls we visit and paint with) to participate in our purpose and show us what they can do with their mighty fingers. Girls will upload videos of themselves using their mighty fingers to create. They will become part of the process. They will communicate and unify right along with us.

We will also create video clips and uploads that follow our entire journey. The clips will capture the process of creating our global, larger-than-life Fingersmear mural and will capture how our project empowers young women and strengthens communities. The clips will also highlight the locations, organizations and girls that we work with.  And, even beyond that, it will spread and immortalize the message that young women can change the future.

 

JOIN IN

Mighty Fingers Facing Change is an amazing collaborative journey and there are many ways for you and those you know to participate! We enthusiastically invite you to be a part of our project in any way that you can. If you make a pledge you will receive awesome REWARDS from us that signify your invaluable involvement in Mighty Fingers. Our rewards are listed to the right. You can also contribute in a big way by liking us on Facebook and sharing our page with your Facebook friends! Please also follow us on Twitter and you will receive a very gracious tweet from us thanking you for your support!

 

Our Team

I'm Kelly Sullivan, and I developed FingerSmears almost 20 years ago. I call these large interactive paintings FingerSmears. I have been producing these collaborative works ever since. Over 80,000 people have stuck their fingers in paint under my direction, from rock starts to movie stars, from Fortune 500 CEOs to kindergarten kids, all of them working in the spirit of collaboration to add their mark and make a statement about the bigger picture.  I have always dreamed of creating a global FingerSmear and I am finally going to do it with Mighty Fingers Facing Change! I am so excited to support what I believe to be the most exciting shift of the 21st century: the empowerment of adolescent girls and the strengthening of our communities around the world.

Check out Kelly's blog! http://kellysullivanfineart.com/blog 

 

Toni Tru has a passion to tell stories through films that educate, inspire and illuminate.  She held her first video camera at age 11 and fell in love with creating films. Toni also has a passion for changing the world. She believes in the importance of the arts as inspiration and the importance of supporting organizations that help girls thrive. She wants to tell Mighty Fingers Facing Change’s story as well as the stories of the organizations and girls she will meet on this incredible journey. It is her wish that through the sharing of these stories, girls all around the world will be inspired to tell their own stories using the arts as a vehicle.

Aidan Sullivan is my amazing 15 year-old daughter and an award-winning columnist. She has seen all sides of life from riches to poverty, from sickness to health. Her honest connection with life and willingess to speak about it created a series of articles called "Life in the Middle" that won a first place award for a student columnist at the Idaho State Press Awards. She took a hiatus from the column to undergo a  spinal fusion for scoliosis. Over six months post-op, she is excited to continue her column as she travels with Mighty Fingers Facing Change. She will document the Mighty Fingers project through the eyes of a teenage girl as she learns firsthand the differences that set us apart and the similarities that bring us together.

 

Our Sponsors

John Richeson & Co., Inc.

story:
Short Summary

Hello all,

I am looking to start up a web based store to sell handmade chainmail armor/jewelry/etc...

I am a medieval enthusiast who has always dreamt of making my own set of armor. When a friend showed me how it was done, I was in my glory. It truly is an awesome hobby and I would like to take it to the next level.

Whether you simply share this page with your friends, donate a dollar, or donate enough to recieve a perk I thank you for your help and support!

Funds

Any and all funds received will go towards the purchase and shipping of the materials needed to start up my store. Your average suit of armor can weigh up to 30 pounds and is made of approximately 30,000 metal rings that must be hand-crafted together. I’ve done my research and the cheapest and yet high quality metal rings sell for $200 for the supply needed for just one set of armor. Using these funds I can create enough pieces so that the profit I will make will be enough to keep the supplies coming in.

The Impact

Not only will your contributions allow me to start up my own business, but you will provide me with the resources to continue in a hobby that truly is rewarding. Not only will you make me happy but my future customers will be as well. The reason chain mail armor is so expensive is not because of the material cost but the time involved in making it. I plan to offer quality pieces at prices that allow me to continue the business and that won’t break the bank.

Contributors will enjoy various perks as well. See the gallery for pictures of the perk prizes! Also anyone interested in bigger projects can stay in touch and when I get things rolling, I would not mind giving out some awesome discounts to people who truly deserve it!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you or anyone else you know is into medieval armor, renaissance festivals, LARP, or simply admire the craft please contribute and spread the word. Thank you.

story:
Founder's Note:

Singapore is boring. But it has really interesting spaces. And we believe artists are important.

That's why we came up with OH! Open House. It's the annual art walkabout that introduces you to different aspects of Singapore. Artists transform private spaces you'd never visit or know about. We've gone from swanky shophouses to HDB flats and then to the quaint walk-ups of Tiong Bahru.

This year we're shifting gears and entering the corporate universe of Marina Bay!

 

OH! NOW Deal lets you skip the queues!

Yes, now you can go on tour when you want to. You'll choose a date, and come to the VIP counter on the event days to pick up your special package with:
 
1. NOW PASS worth S$30
2. JOURNAL "On Marina Bay" worth S$35
3. OH! Marina Bay Tote Bag worth S$10
 
That's a value of S$75, but at a super price of SGD$48! 
*(Which is US$40, given the exchange rate of US$1 = SG$1.22)
 
Please bring your photo identification card for security clearance to access the banks.
 

FAQs!

If you have any questions, email hello@ohopenhouse.com or call us at +6563386745.

story:
This campaign is to give Arabella, Faylinn and Eddie a summer to remember and connect with their paternal  family they have never met.  My children have questions that only meeting their family in person will answer for them. Their father is by choice estranged from his family, the children have via facebook connected with relatives and would love to meet them.

     The children will be  going to NYC to meet family and while there, the children would like to see the Museum of Natural History and Statue of Liberty while spending time with relatives for the day.

     The next destination is Long Island and the Long Island Aquarium to spend time with relatives for the day.

     The final destination is Glouster Virginia to meet family and go to a Boat tour to see whales and bottle nose dolphins.

     We are hoping that going to a public outing will help with the nervousness and make a fantastic memory for all involved.


The following is what we are hoping to raise so we will be able to achieve our goal.  We are seeking to raise $792.50.

I have enough saved for fuel for a round trip of 1560 miles and tolls and food.  We do not have funds to cover what the children want to experience.

Statue of Liberty                 3 tickets at $12.00 each

Museum of Natural History   3 tickets at $33.00 each

Long Island Aquarium         3 tickets at $37.50 each

Glouster Whale Tour            3 tickets at $15.00 each

Motel for 4 nights                estimated $500.00

 

 

     We have many levels of art perks for your very appreciated donation to our campaign.  The children have always been involved with artwork. Our local resource that the children enjoy are beach pebbles.  We go to shore of Lake Ontario where we live and skip stones, stack stones and bring them home to paint on.

     Each pebble is hand painted and is sealed, signed and dated.

Eddie makes observing stones, snails as well as abstract pebbles.

     Faylinn and Arabella make very detailed painted pebbles and rocks for your garden display needs.  Faylinn and Bella love requests for specific art orders.  For instance if you wanted pink lady bugs or purple gnomes or any animal.

     We have special creations that all 3 children have collaborated on that make wonderful artistic conversation pieces.

     Whatever the end effect of this campaign, we will make our best efforts to introduce Bella, Fay and Eddie to their biological paternal family if our goal is not met. If we do meet our goal or even surpass it, the children will be able to choose souvinirs from their summer to remember and purchase and extra set of tickets at each site for the Aunt and Uncle we are visiting!

     Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign!

The Impact

     With this trip to acquaint the children to their biological family they will be able to make a family tree and know their roots.  Remember they are Rocking to Roll to their Roots by creating art. Please support this campaign to unite the children to their family.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign to get our message out to people.  Family is everything important in the world.  Thank you so much for taking the time to read our campaign.

story:
My name is Amanda Branham and I am the creator of Baby Burrito Collective, an online art collective. I was a music journalist for a couple of years and then I found myself always chasing art stories and wanting to help spread the word about local artists who were kind of in the "art shadows" in Sacramento, my hometown.

I no longer live in Sacramento and now my main focus is my baby, but I still have art on the brain. I started this Collective so I could use my journalism skills to help artists get the word out about their work. Members will send their work to me, and I'll post it on the site, offer an online store, do all the marketing and send out press releases, organize an artist kit and write about them in the blog. We will also offer in-person and online classes and give money back into the community.

This collective is important to me because I have looked for an art collective to join for a long time, but never found one onlne that would do all that stuff for artists. A lot of my friends can do the art, but feel uncomfortable marketing online. That's where I want to come in, to help spread the word.

There are probably a lot of people who feel this way, so I wanted to open it up to everyone. So whatever kind of art you're into, we can do it.

If we got the $5000 we're hoping for, we would be able to get all of our web and graphic design work done. We would be able to purchase the apps that would allow us to offer online classes and an online shop. We would be able to rent out the space to offer in-person classes and we would be able to get all of our marketing tools.

Once we raise enough funds, we can put the money back into the community through art. We will be able to teach classes to children for either free or low-cost and we hope to offer art programs for children in the future.

Your donation would help so many artists get a headstart on their careers and any sponsors would be able to get a free space for advertising on the site.

story:
HEART (High Edge ART) is art and performance platform where artists  from all edges of the world can come and show off their TALENT.

HEART seeks GBP6000 in Kickstarter contributions to fund the construction of the set, equipment and production elements that are very important part  of our endeavor which we plan to take to other countries in the future  in order to promote art and give artists a place to showcase their capabilities. We want to raise enough funds to be able to pay for flights, accommodation and expenses of artists, venue hire, promotional materials, sound, visial equipment etc.

There is not enough places at the moment where artists from different counries and backgrounds can amaze you with what they do.

HEART will provide the opportunity for 10-15 artists of different type, to  come on stage and awe you. Every artist will be in a different category  of art - therefore you will see paintings around the room, have a chance to see live fire breathing, freakshow artists, singers, designers,  filmmakers and experience variety of art in one place.

Some of our performers include:

  • Nati Amos (fire performer - NYC) http://www.coneyisland.com/per.nati.shtml

  • Leirum (painter - NYC) http://www.facebook.com/LeirumArt

  • Ricardo dos Reis (leather designer - Portugal) http://www.facebook.com/owlrr

  • DJ Moom (DJ - Turkey) http://www.myspace.com/dj-moom/music

  • Jonathan Frasier (Graphic Designer - Portugal) http://www.jonfdesign.com/

  • Marysia (Cabaret Artist) http://loveyourcreativity.com  

  • Joe Pochcior (VJ - UK) http://vimeo.com/joepochciol

  • Nelson Brett (Contrast Artist - Portugal) http://www.facebook.com/pages/Nelson-Brett-Contrast-Artist/151390104995517

  • Justina Hernik (writer/actress/filmmaker)

The first event will be hosted in July 2013 and hopefully we will have enough money by then to make it a regular happening.

story:
I'm going to draw a doodle-packed page-a-day for the month of April. 30 pages in 30 days! If you've seen my sketchbook JUST DO ANYTHING or my doodle zine CHOWDERHAWK you know all about my dense, stream of consciousness doodle pages, chock full of weridness and punnery.

You can commission a page, dictate the theme if you like and I'll mail you the original art. Good ol' fashioned ink on paper.

When I've completed all 30 pages you'll also receive a high-res PDF of ALL the pieces!

story:
Background Information

The Black Mountain College Museum + Arts Center (BMCM+AC) and the Media Arts Project (MAP) announce the 4th annual {Re}HAPPENING, on Saturday, April 6th from 6pm to Midnight in the original dining hall of the former Black Mountain College, now Camp Rockmont. Inspired by our imaginings about what a “typical” Saturday night at Black Mountain College might have been like, the {Re}HAPPENING pays tribute to the groundbreaking artistic innovation of Black Mountain College as well as its community tradition of Saturday night parties and performances. The goal of the event is to bring BMC’s dynamic energy into the present day.More info: http://rehappening.com/?page_id=2

Short Summary

Described as a “winsome water nymph” by native resident, Mary Ford Miller, the Swannanoa River has graced the BMC campus with its focal point, Lake Eden, since before the inception of the college.  Without the constant influx of renewing waters the lake would not be worthy of its name.  The walking labyrinths has been used as a human gesture of affection toward the earth for centuries across many cultures.  As a ceremonial event, on the occasion of the 2013 {Re}Happening, we propose the construction of a ca. 30 foot diameter labyrinth, the location and orientation to be dowsed and the path-marking materials to be collected locally on the day of the event.  A ceremony and procession will take place at a designated time during the program.

What We Need & What You Get

WHAT WE NEED (Total $5000)

  • Dowser’s fee – to locate and orient the labyrinth most beneficially - $1250
  • Lodging and food – for two overnight’s day before and night of event - $500
  • Construction of kiosk - $1000
  • Information: posters, flyers, etc. - $500
  • Torches and/or other illuminating materials - $750
  • Other materials for labyrinth - $1000

WHAT YOU CAN GET

  • $100 donation - Be a labyrinth go-fer.  Help gather and assemble the river deposits into the labyrinth.  Must be available on-site all day Saturday, April 6, 2013.
  • $50 donation – Receive a 1-year membership in the Keepers of the Integrity of the Swannanoa System (KISS) with all its associated benefits.
  • $25 donation – snail mail a written blessing to be burned in the labyrinth ceremony.
  • $25 donation – receive 11x17” color poster of finished labyrinth and/or/during ceremony.

The Impact

In addition to expanding the experience of the 2013 {Re}Happening your donations will have the following positive effects:

  • Raising human awareness of the importance of watershed integrity
  • Raising human awareness of the natures/variations/applications of labyrinths
  • Having a real beneficial benefit on the watershed, the planet, and humanity

story:
What is the Art Monastery? 

The Art Monastery is an American non-profit arts organization that applies monastic principles to creativity and art making. 

The three pillars of the Art Monastery are art, community, and contemplation. Through the ever deepening investigation of the intersection of those three pillars, we aim:

  • to make really powerful, really authentic art
  • to open people's hearts
  • to connect with what is true in ourselves and in each other

To see the work we've made in the past, please check out our portfolio: http://artmonastery.org/portfolio/ourwork.

What are you trying to do here? 

We are re-creating the world from a place of love, from a place of passion, from a place of beauty. This is possible!

We know because we've been doing it, with your help. It starts in your heart, in my heart, in the hearts of Americans, in the hearts of Italians, in the hearts of artists, in the hearts of artlovers, in the hearts of people everywhere.

We are fundraising 

to support the spring residency 

of the Art Monastery in Italy,

including the Art Monastery's first book!

Liz Maxwell, Charles Darius, and Betsy McCall are collaborating for three months in southern Italy to take the Art Monastic Process to a new level. Last year we seriously affected some artists lives in the process of making great art. That is *very* motivating to us, so we're going for it in a new way this season. We're developing two major projects: 

  • collaborating with local artists to create an immersive environment that explores the concepts of liminality, the in-between state, through live looping music and kaleidoscopic video projection
  • a book about hosting transformation - Betsy is editing, designing, and illustrating a 100-page book, an invitation to the world to host its own transformation.

 

What do you need? 

We're aiming to raise $15,000 in this campaign -- more than we've asked for before -- but what this money makes possible is lasting and profound. 

Here's where your donation goes:

  • to produce, distribute & print the book, using cradle-to-cradle technique (this is the most ecological process EVER)
  • to purchase art supplies (paper & paint for paintings, a discounted non-profit version of InDesign, repairs for Charles's guitar)
  • to feed & house the artists

 

What do I get? 

Our perks rise directly from the work we're creating this spring.

So you will get to experience the actual fruits of your support! Take a look at the column to the right to check out our awesome perks for donating. 

 

What is the impact? 

The thing that is particularly powerful about this campaign (and the reason it's a higher dollar amount than we've gone for before) is that one of the things we will create is a physical object, a stunningly colorful book, that will exist in the world.

Just like the Art Monastery, both the content and the process through which the object is made, embody our lofty ideals.

The book is already organized to be distributed in eight european countries plus the US & Canada.

This book stands to position the Art Monastery as a leader in a world movement, the movement of movements, the Great Turning, the movement that asks you to look into your own heart and dare to connect with the firey spark of what you really, really care about, what your deepest desires are. 

The Art Monastery has an extremely strong track record. Last year's campaign exceeded its goal, which made it possible for to create powerful artwork and to deeply touch artists lives. Now in our fifth year, we're gaining momentum!

  

Other Ways You Can Help 

We know what it's like when you want to donate but it just isn't possible at the moment.

If that's true for you (you're still reading this! You're clearly dedicated!), that doesn’t mean they can’t help: 

Help get the word out! Please post the link to this campaign on facebook and twitter. Add authentic comments about what you really feel about the Art Monastery. Just click on the Indiegogo share buttons at the top right of this page!

Have a real conversation with another human being about why you care about the Art Monastery and its ideals. Are you glad that we're out there doing this work? Tell someone!

 

Thank you so much. 

Together, we can create the world we want to live in. Let's do this, people!!!

 

Love, 

The Artmonks

story:
KARAWAN FESTIVAL
Immigration, comedy, humor, celebration and participation

Karawan is meant to be the first film festival dedicated to the themes of immigration, integration and intermingling of cultures, narrated in a non-dramatic way.
By addressing the complex universe of immigration with an ironic, amusing and joyful
view, we aim to raise the sense of communion among the citizens of Torpignattara.
A joyful caravan travelling around our neighborhood, Karawan will encourage people to share times and places in the name of cultural exchange fostering a sense of cooperation.
By narrating stories from all over the world through the powerful mean of cinema, we want to turn the spotlight on a territory rich with History and stories, Culture and cultures, Art and artistries.

Karawan is a permanent and touring festival: it never ends, it never stops.
Karawan is a film festival but also an amorphous showcase open to other forms of arts which will pitch camp in squares, parks, auditoria, museums, libraries, studios, bakeries, bistrots and art galleries.
Karawan is like Torpignattara, contradictory by nature, ever-changing by necessity.

The festival will take place from November to June, with several film screenings and events to culminate in the final event called “Migrations”, a 10-days-celebration which will involve communities, associations and all local cultural entities which make our neighborhood, with its contradictory and unexpected beauty, so unique in Rome.

What We Need & What You Get

The project will start in late November introducing a cycle of film screenings dedicated to the cinematographers of the largest foreign communities in the area: Bangladeshi, Chinese, Romanian, Arab.
These screenings will help us to get in contact with the communities and to make them directly involved in the project, by choosing together some of the films that will be screened in June in the final event. It will be also an occasion for them to see on the big screen colors, sounds and traditions of their countries.

To make both the language and the cultures portrayed by the films comprehensible to Italian citizens too, we will need to subtitle them.

We ask that you help us raise 10.000 Euros. We have 30 days to reach our goal,and it will only be possible with your support.

Torpignattara: The melting pot of Cultures in Rome

The area of Torpignattara, not so far from the very center of the city, is one of the most crowded in Rome. In the last 15 years the mix of foreign communities – people from Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, China, Philippines, Egypt, Tunisia, Romania and much more – increased, making our neighborhood a kind of laboratory of the Italian multi-cultural society to come.
But unfortunately until now, Torpignattara is known best by the rest of the city for its urban and environmental decay. The only press Torpignattara gets is focused on news of crime. Cultural activities are almost non-existent or at least they are inadequate. The only movie theatre in the neighborhood has been closed since 1987.
We do believe that we deserve much more than this. 4500 signatures of Italian, Bangladeshi, Chinese and Arab citizens of Torpignattara have been collected so far to re-open the old-fashioned Impero movie theatre.
Through this experience, we understood that we can, and we must, contribute to build a better future.

What this project can do for our neighborhood

To imagine a different future, we pushed away the sadness and pessimism, andwelcomed the good.  The joy, the colors of a festival have always been the means to redesign a territory, to trace new paths, to give space to all the communities.

This is Karawan! A big, colorful, joyful caravan touring through the squares and the streets of the area, making people come together, sharing the same places and having fun.

A party, a festival, a journey that aims to show how the identity of this land has always been based on the beauty of difference, the contradiction, complexity; on the meeting between cultures.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can not help financially you can always help Karawan!

Spread the word. Please circulate the link, tell your friends, share your project on facebook and twitter

Learn about Torpignattara and visit us! Our contacts are in the project will be happy to guide you in our beautiful area
story_txt:
KARAWAN FESTIVALImmigration, comedy, humor, celebration and participation
Karawan is meant to be the first film festival dedicated to the themes of immigration, integration and intermingling of cultures, narrated in a non-dramatic way.By addressing the complex universe of immigration with an ironic, amusing and joyfulview, we aim to raise the sense of communion among the citizens of Torpignattara.A joyful caravan travelling around our neighborhood, Karawan will encourage people to share times and places in the name of cultural exchange fostering a sense of cooperation.By narrating stories from all over the world through the powerful mean of cinema, we want to turn the spotlight on a territory rich with History and stories, Culture and cultures, Art and artistries.
Karawan is a permanent and touring festival: it never ends, it never stops.Karawan is a film festival but also an amorphous showcase open to other forms of arts which will pitch camp in squares, parks, auditoria, museums, libraries, studios, bakeries, bistrots and art galleries.Karawan is like Torpignattara, contradictory by nature, ever-changing by necessity.
The festival will take place from November to June, with several film screenings and events to culminate in the final event called “Migrations”, a 10-days-celebration which will involve communities, associations and all local cultural entities which make our neighborhood, with its contradictory and unexpected beauty, so unique in Rome.


What We Need & What You Get
The project will start in late November introducing a cycle of film screenings dedicated to the cinematographers of the largest foreign communities in the area: Bangladeshi, Chinese, Romanian, Arab.These screenings will help us to get in contact with the communities and to make them directly involved in the project, by choosing together some of the films that will be screened in June in the final event. It will be also an occasion for them to see on the big screen colors, sounds and traditions of their countries.
To make both the language and the cultures portrayed by the films comprehensible to Italian citizens too, we will need to subtitle them.
We ask that you help us raise 10.000 Euros. We have 30 days to reach our goal,and it will only be possible with your support.


Torpignattara: The melting pot of Cultures in Rome
The area of Torpignattara, not so far from the very center of the city, is one of the most crowded in Rome. In the last 15 years the mix of foreign communities – people from Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, China, Philippines, Egypt, Tunisia, Romania and much more – increased, making our neighborhood a kind of laboratory of the Italian multi-cultural society to come.But unfortunately until now, Torpignattara is known best by the rest of the city for its urban and environmental decay. The only press Torpignattara gets is focused on news of crime. Cultural activities are almost non-existent or at least they are inadequate. The only movie theatre in the neighborhood has been closed since 1987.We do believe that we deserve much more than this. 4500 signatures of Italian, Bangladeshi, Chinese and Arab citizens of Torpignattara have been collected so far to re-open the old-fashioned Impero movie theatre.Through this experience, we understood that we can, and we must, contribute to build a better future.
What this project can do for our neighborhood
To imagine a different future, we pushed away the sadness and pessimism, andwelcomed the good.  The joy, the colors of a festival have always been the means to redesign a territory, to trace new paths, to give space to all the communities.
This is Karawan! A big, colorful, joyful caravan touring through the squares and the streets of the area, making people come together, sharing the same places and having fun.
A party, a festival, a journey that aims to show how the identity of this land has always been based on the beauty of difference, the contradiction, complexity; on the meeting between cultures.
Other Ways You Can Help


Even if you can not help financially you can always help Karawan!
Spread the word. Please circulate the link, tell your friends, share your project on facebook and twitter
Learn about Torpignattara and visit us! Our contacts are in the project will be happy to guide you in our beautiful area

story:
The Project

Talking Heads is a multi-media installation with live-action film, animation film, a simulated newspaper and a human-like sculpture dealing with how society forms opinions and how society regards its own problems.

The audience sees two films simultaneously. The first is an animated film of a news report embedded into a newspaper.  Flat screen monitors built into the newspaper display show the animated films with their headlines. 

Simultaneously displayed is a live action film; a face in close-up is projected onto a ‘head’ screen of a mannequin who appears to be reading the newspaper. 

The films are synchronized so that the live-action “face” film appears to be commenting and reacting to the animated “news” film in real time.  Using this method, the audience is simultaneously exposed to a story and to another person’s reaction to that story.  The viewer is supplied with a context for his or her opinions and a larger societal view. Talking Heads is an encounter with film to encourage meta-cognition about one’s own views. 

Please check out the Gallery tab above as well as www.michaelhosaluk.com for images and videos relating to the project.

Artists' Statement

Michael and my work is concerned with social issues and uses irony and comedic values to illuminate how the social rules and conventions are applied.

While we are interested in illuminating societal issues, our work is not documentary, nor is it political activism art; we are not after collective responses.  Our interest is in telling stories that prompt viewers to examine their own beliefs and values.

In this piece, we want people to scrutinize how we, and they, perceive problems in our society. It is easy to make a story where a societal problem, such as discrimination, is the villain. We all identify as the good guys and everyone goes home patting themselves on the back. Everyone is against discrimination; no one is for it, and yet, it clearly still exists. We feel that examination of the discrimination of certain social groups in a supportive way creates a more personal understanding.

We often use a non-threatening, fictional race, chairs.   Across all cultures, genders, and ages, everyone understands chairs. The viewer is invited to think of these universal objects in new contexts and new dimensions. By portraying chairs as a distinct race or segment of society, we examine the relevant social issues without evoking culturally specific or defensive responses.  The viewer is invited to examine his or her responses to these social issues while also processing the comments, opinions and facial expressions shown in the reaction film.  The viewer is forced to question internally “Do I agree? Do I think differently? What is really is the issue here?”

Where Will Your Donation Go?

Your donation will go towards:

1) Building the installation displays

2) Adding three new scenes and augmenting certain scenes of the film

3) Creating the paired live action films

Who Will See This Project?

The installation will tour with Michael Hosaluk’s tour, ‘Acts of Chairs’, planned for multiple sites across Canada and the US.  The show is currently committed to Portland, Oregon and Regina, SK. More bookings are expected.

How Can I Help?

Your donation makes all the difference for helping to spread our artistic message against discrimination. Please also share this project with your friends and family, or even encourage your local gallery to purchase the show!

Cover art by Chrystene Ells

story:
MasterPlan The_PBM : Step 1 The_PBM CarlswerkEdition Cologne 19.08.-03.10.2014

(…für deutschen Text nach unten scrollen!)


We love PhotoBooks

In fact, we are real PhotoBook maniacs. "PhotoBooks are addictive, but they do not kill you!" says Erik Kessels from the museum's board. That´s right! We believe the PhotoBook is the central medium of expression within photography. For years, Markus Schaden and his team were working intensively with the medium. Now we realize the final master plan : The_PBM ( The PhotoBookMuseum ). We want to create a central, public place for the promotion of PhotoBook culture. We need your support to build the museum project just before the finishing line. Become a museum founder! Share the Passion!


Financial support

We calculate 25,000 euros to lift the liquid cost of the project. The money is needed for logistics, material ( exhibition buildings and containers), advertising materials and fees.The rent of the Carlswerk Factory, the publications, prints and lot of important parts of the project are sponsored by companies.( Please check our proposal below The_PBM, last page for more details). What remains is earmarked for the implementation of the masterplan step 2 to step 4. 



Reliable and viral support

Not everyone can donate, even if he would like to. Never mind. Maybe you can help us in other ways, to make spread the word. Please send the campaign link to your friends and acquaintances in the social networks. In any case, you should visit us in Cologne in the summer. We are pleased about every photo book friend who shares our passion!

For You

If you love photo books as well as we do, we invite you becoming a builder of The Photobook Museum. As a supporter you are invited to exhibitions and events and regularly informed about all the news. In addition, your name will be immortalized on the Founder Wall. With an exclusive member card you gain depending on the status discounts on tickets and catalogs. All for free. A life long.

Markus Schaden

The_PBM is an initiative by Markus Schaden, one of the world's leading photo book experts. Born in Cologne, he is firmly convinced that photo books are the visual Esperanto of our time. That is why he makes up for a museum strong where the medium can be adequately researched, exhibited and presented for discussion. Markus Schaden became known by the Schaden-Publishing and the PhotoBookStore Schaden.com within the last two decades. Meanwhile he is working as lecturer, curator and editor. In addition, Markus joined the jury of the Dummy Award of the Photobook Festival Kassel, the Blurb Photo Book Award and the Arles Photography Book Prize.

The Team

His team includes photographers, art historians, curators, designers, mothers, fathers, journalists, lawyers and business management specialist.

Museum Advisory Board

  • Gerry Badger , London
  • Tamara Berghmans , Antwerp
  • Julien Frydman , Paris
  • Darius Himes, San Francisco
  • Hans -Joachim Irrek , Dusseldorf
  • Erik Kessels , Amsterdam
  • Thyago Nogueira, Sao Paulo
  • Prof. Dr. Christoph Schaden , Cologne
  • Mariko Takeuchi , Tokyo/Kyoto
  • James B. Wellford , New York

LONG LIVE THE PHOTO BOOK !

Please stay tuned for updates on the video channel.


Wir lieben Fotobücher

Genau genommen sind wir echte Fotobuch-Maniacs. „Fotobücher machen süchtig, aber sie bringen Dich nicht um“, sagt Erik Kessels vom Museums-Board. Stimmt. Denn ein Fotobuch ist für uns das zentrale Medium der Fotografie. Seit Jahren beschäftigen sich Markus Schaden und sein Team intensiv mit dem Medium. Jetzt realisieren wir den finalen Masterplan: The_PBM (The PhotoBookMuseum). Mit diesem schaffen wir einen zentralen, öffentlichen Ort zur Förderung von Fotobuchkultur. Auf dem letzten Stück, kurz vor dem Ziel, brauchen wir eure Unterstützung das Museumsprojekt mit aufzubauen. Werdet Museumsgründer! Teilt mit uns die Passion!

Finanzielle Unterstützung

Wir kalkulieren 25.000 Euro, um die Detailkosten für das Projekt zu stemmen. Das gespendete Geld wird für Logistik, Material (Ausstellungsbauten und Container), Werbemittel und Honorare benötigt. Die Hallenmiete für das Carlswerk, alle Publikationen, Prints und einige wichtige Kosten sind bereits gesponsert.( Auf der vorletzten Seite des Proposals: The_PBM sind die Sponsoren aufgezählt!) Was übrig bleibt, wird zweckgebunden für die Umsetzung der Masterplan- Stufen 2 bis 4 verwendet.

Reale und virale Unterstützung

Nicht jeder kann spenden, auch wenn er es eigentlich möchte. Das macht nichts. Vielleicht könnt Ihr uns auf andere Weise helfen, das Projekt bekannt zu machen. Bitte sendet den Kampagnen-Link an Eure Freunde und Bekannten in den sozialen Netzwerken. Auf jeden Fall solltet Ihr uns im Sommer in Köln besuchen. Wir freuen uns über jeden Fotobuchfreund, der unsere Leidenschaft teilt!


Für euch

Wenn Ihr also Fotobücher ebenso liebt wie wir, laden wir Euch ein, förderndes Mitglied von The PhotoBookMuseum zu werden. Werdet Unterstützer, wenn Ihr die Idee eines Museums gut findet und überzeugt seid, dass das Fotobuch endlich ein angemessenes Zuhause verdient.
Als Unterstützer werdet Ihr zu Ausstellungen und Veranstaltungen eingeladen und regelmäßig über alle Neuigkeiten informiert. Außerdem wird Euer Name auf der Founder-Wall verewigt. Mit einer exklusiven Mitglieds-Karte erhaltet Ihr je nach Status Ermäßigungen auf Eintritte und Kataloge. Oder sogar alles kostenlos. Ein Leben lang.

Markus Schaden

The_PBM ist eine Initiative von Markus Schaden, einem der weltweit führenden Fotobuch- Experten. Der gebürtige Kölner ist fest davon überzeugt, dass Fotobücher das visuelle Esperanto unserer Zeit sind. Darum macht er sich für ein Museum stark, wo das Medium angemessen erforscht, ausgestellt und zur Diskussion gestellt werden kann. Bekannt wurde Markus Schaden vor allem durch den Schaden-Verlag und die Fotobuchhandlung Schaden.com. Inzwischen ist er als Dozent, Kurator und Editor tätig. Außerdem ist Markus Jurymitglied vom DummyAward des Fotobuch-Festivals Kassel, des Blurb PhotoBook Award und des Arles Photography Book Prize.

Das Team

In seinem Team unterstützen ihn Fotografen, Kunsthistoriker, Kuratoren, Designer, Mütter, Väter, Journalisten, Juristen und Betriebswirtschafter.

Museum Advisory Board

  • Gerry Badger, London
  • Tamara Berghmans, Antwerpen
  • Julien Frydman, Paris
  • Darius Himes, San Francisco
  • Hans-Joachim Irrek, Düsseldorf
  • Erik Kessels, Amsterdam
  • Thyago Nogueira, São Paulo
  • Prof. Dr. Christoph Schaden, Köln
  • Mariko Takeuchi, Tokyo/Kyoto
  • James B. Wellford, New York


LONG LIVE THE PHOTOBOOK!

story:
Ciao! Thank you for checking out my campaign!


I am a Senior at CSULB’s School of Art, studying drawing and painting and as this school year is coming to an end, I have looked back at missed opportunities due to fear of rejection and lack of financial stability.  This year I have promised myself to expose myself and my art, and begin my journey as an artist in the real world, with this in mind, I applied to the CSU Summer arts program that encourages students from across the CSU system to apply to courses in the art fields such as: drawing and painting, drama, music, film, photography, and writing.


When I applied, I simply did it for the experience and the learning process of applying for something relating to art, but guess what… I actually GOT ACCEPTED! This, along with me finally graduating this year, felt to me like a huge accomplishment. I was so proud of myself for doing it, and actually being accepted amongst the rest of the 20-30 students across California that were given the once in a life time opportunity to study drawing and painting in Florence, Italy, where some of the greatest masters of painting lived and made history.


What is this all about?


I am asking for your assistance in making a contribution to my education and this life changing experience!! Any amount that you can possibly find it in your heart and soul to give will be eternally appreciated and so very helpful to me.  I will use your generous donation to pay for the tuition, the lodging, and the expensive airfare needed to make this wonderful experience possible for me.


The CSU Summer Arts Program in more detail:


If you would like to verify the details below is the official website to this program,


http://blogs.calstate.edu/summerarts/index.php/courses/drawing-and-painting-in-florence/


The course will be taught by three professors who are professional artist in italy, and in California. We will be taken to all major museums, churches, and architectural monuments, where we will study the master artist, paint and sketch, and discuss art history. The course will allow us to experience plein air painting on site and be influenced by the environment and culture of italy.  We will get to further our skills of the human form under American and Italian teachers, and learn different techniques and skills that we will later in the course use to build work that we will show in a student exhibit that will take place at the end of the 3-week course.  Now how many students can put on their resume’s that they were part of an exhibit in Italy? That in and of itself is an honor that I will carry for the rest of my life, but I do need help in getting to that part of my future, and I am asking for any small or big contribution of your generosity.  I never ask for help, but today I am asking for help because I truly do need it. You will help me develop the structure that takes to be an artist in this world, and allow me to continue my education to become an Art Therapist.  This program will be successful in informing new work that will be used to put together a serious and professional portfolio for graduate school to study Art Therapy, hoping to get licensed to work in the State of California.


CSU Summer Arts Program fees:


The Tuition for California Residents is $1,611


The lodging fees are $1,050 to stay in a lovely convent called Madonna Del Rosario during the 3 week course, this arrangement is provided through the program coordinators.


Other fees are Insurance of $40 dollars, Material fees of $150.00


and finally they estimate the airfare to cost around 1,700 dollars.


any help is greatly appreciated and very useful, if you cannot donate, but would like to help please pass on my campaigns link to friends and family that would be interested in helping me.


Thanks to all,


Jenny

                                                      Some of my work
PlEASE DO NOT RE-POST MY IMAGES WITHOUT MY CONSENT. THANK YOU

The CSU Summer Arts Program in more detail:If you would like to verify the details below is the official website to this program,http://blogs.calstate.edu/summerarts/index.php/courses/drawing-and-painting-in-florence/The course will be taught by three professors who are professional artist in italy, and in California. We will be taken to all major museums, churches, and architectural monuments, where we will study the master artist, paint and sketch, and discuss art history. The course will allow us to experience plein air painting on site and be influenced by the environment and culture of italy.  We will get to further our skills of the human form under American and Italian teachers, and learn different techniques and skills that we will later in the course use to build work that we will show in a student exhibit that will take place at the end of the 3-week course.  Now how many students can put on their resume’s that they were part of an exhibit in Italy? That in and of itself is an honor that I will carry for the rest of my life, but I do need help in getting to that part of my future, and I am asking for any small or big contribution of your generosity.  I never ask for help, but today I am asking for help because I truly do need it. You will help me develop the structure that takes to be an artist in this world, and allow me to continue my education to become an Art Therapist.  This program will be successful in informing new work that will be used to put together a serious and professional portfolio for graduate school to study Art Therapy, hoping to get licensed to work in the State of California. CSU Summer Arts Program fees:The Tuition for California Residents is $1,611The lodging fees are $1,050 to stay in a lovely convent called Madonna Del Rosario during the 3 week course, this arrangement is provided through the program coordinators. Other fees are Insurance of $40 dollars, Material fees of $150.00and finally they estimate the airfare to cost around 1,700 dollars. any help is greatly appreciated and very useful, if you cannot donate, but would like to help please pass on my campaigns link to friends and family that would be interested in helping me. Thanks to all, Jenny                                                       Some of my workPlEASE DO NOT RE-POST MY IMAGES WITHOUT MY CONSENT. THANK YOU

story:
La campagna di crowdfunding è terminata! Abbiamo raggiunto 1.765E, cifra che ci permetterà di tornare a MIlano e continuare il progetto nel quartiere Giambellino.
Grazie a tutti i nostri sostenitori, a coloro che hanno finanziato Il tuo Volto Domani e a coloro che ci hanno aiutato a comunicarlo e diffonderlo!

Grazie a tutti voi che avete creduto in questo progetto...ogni donazione ha fatto la differenza, ed grazie a voi che saremo di nuovo a Milano per la seconda fase del progetto:

- lavoreremo in quartiere per conoscere e incontrare le persone che vorranno donarci nuovi oggetti e raccontarci le loro storie
- costruiremo altre capsule del tempo da interrare in tutto il quartiere
- verrà realizzata una mappa e un audio con tutte le voci e i racconti dei donatori di oggetti
- la mappa e l'audio faranno parte di un'installazione che sarà donata al quartiere.

...senza il vostro supporto non sarebbe stato possibile!

EN below

Sono Valentina Medda, artista visiva che vive tra Bologna e NY.

Sto lavorando al progetto di arte pubblica Il tuo Volto Domani, un archivio territoriale delle memorie degli abitanti del Giambellino di Milano, quartiere il cui assetto urbano è da tempo in discussione.

Attraverso questo progetto voglio sottolineare l’impatto delle politiche urbane e degli interessi economici a scapito delle comunità che abitano i quartieri, coinvolgendo gli abitanti in un atto di appropriazione del luogo  che risvegli in loro un sentimento di appartenenza e un desiderio personale di raccontarsi. 

Per costruire questo archivio sto raccogliendo e interrando alcuni  oggetti appartenenti agli abitanti del quartiere, il cui valore è legato alla casa, alla città o a una esperienza migratoria. Gli oggetti, custoditi all’interno di capsule del tempo, saranno seppelliti nelle zone del quartiere maggiormente interessate dalla futura gentrificazione e la loro posizione sarà indicata su una mappa. Ad ogni capsula corrisponde un codice, ad ogni codice una voce, un racconto breve cui l’oggetto, se sarà disseppellito a causa della trasformazione urbana, andrà a ricongiungersi. Le voci e la mappa andranno a comporre un’installazione finale e saranno poi donati al quartiere. Gli abitanti, chiamati a raccontare la comunità e a salvaguardarne la memoria, diventano prima custodi delle loro storie e, poi, testimoni della trasformazione avvenuta.


Ho iniziato Il tuo Volto Domani nel febbraio 2014 perchè invitata a realizzare un intervento artistico in Giambellino per il progetto Dencity. Nei due mesi trascorsi a Milano, grazie ad una residenza artistica offerta da FARE, ho conosciuto alcuni degli abitanti del quartiere, raccolto i loro oggetti, costruito e interrato alcune capsule.

Conclusa questa collaborazione, ho deciso di continuare e ampliare il progetto con la curatrice Francesca Apolito con la quale sto avviando, in maniera indipendente, una seconda fase del progetto. Per farlo abbiamo bisogno di spostarci da Bologna a Milano e lavorare nel quartiere Giambellino per coinvolgere quanti più abitanti possibili. 


Ogni contributo è fondamentale! 


Il tuo aiuto ci permette di tornare a Milano, raccogliere altri oggetti, costruire nuove capsule e lavorare all'installazione audio.


 A cosa serve il tuo supporto:

  •  viaggi Bologna - Milano
  •  alloggio a Milano
  •  trasporti interni alla città 
  •  materiali per la costruzione delle capsule
  • affitto materiali per documentazione e registrazione storie                         (videocamera e registratore)
  •  costruzione installazione audio
  •  evento finale di presentazione del progetto 

 

SOSTIENI IL PROGETTO, AIUTACI A DIFFONDERLO!

Grazie! 

Visita la pagina web:valentinamedda.com/iltuovoltodomani

Seguici su Facebook:iltuovoltodomani

 


_____________________________________________________

I am Valentina Medda, visual artist who lives and works in Bologna and NY .

I'm working on a project Il tuo Volto Domani, a territorial archive of memories of the inhabitants of Giambellino, characteristic neighborhood of Milan, whose future urban planning has long been questioned.

The memories, collected in the form of personal items linked to one’s home, to the city or to one’s migratory experience, are kept within time capsules made by the artist, localized within a map and buried in the areas most threatened by future gentrification. Each capsule has a code corresponding to the story of the object. The object and the story will be reunited only in case a urban transformation occurs and the capsule is unearthed.The voices and the map will create the final installation and will be then donated to the district.

The project aims at highlighting the impact of urban policy and economic interests at the expense of the community that inhabits the district, involving residents in an act of appropriation of their place, awakening a sense of belonging and a personal desire to tell their stories and mark their passage

Il Tuo Volto Domani started in February 2014 because I was invited to realize a urban intervention in Giambellino within the project Dencity. During the two months I spent in Milan, thanks to an artist residency offered by FARE, I met some of the neighborhood's inhabitants, I collected their objects, built the capsules and buried them.

This collaboration is over but I've now decided to continue the project independently together with curator Francesca Apolito. 

In order to do this we need to go back to Milan and work in the neighborhood to involve as many people as possible in our project. 

 

Each contribution is crucial!

 

Your help enables us to go back to Milan, collect other objects, build more capsules and work on the audio installation.

 

What is your support for:

  • Travel Bologna - Milan
  • Accommodation in Milan
  • Transportation within the city
  • Materials for the construction of the capsules
  • Rent materials for documentation and recording stories (camera and recorder)
  • Construction audio installation
  • Event final presentation of the project

 

SUPPORT THE PROJECT, HELP US TO SPREAD THE VOICE!

Thank you!

Visit the website: valentinamedda.com/iltuovoltodomani

Follow us on Facebook: iltuovoltodomani

story:
Campaign Ends Today! Please contribute now to make the Diodome brighter and better!

The Diodome is an interactive light installation for Burning Man 2013. 300+ individually controlled LEDs and a beautiful cover over an 18ft geodesic dome the Diodome creates a three dimensional surface of light which participants can interact with.

In the center of the Diodome stands a platform supporting a glowing frosted hemisphere. As you touch and stroke this surface the colors around you respond, creating a space of colored light that envelopes and surrounds you and your friends. When left alone the dome will gradually change patterns and pulsate in various ways trying to draw people in from across the Playa.

Check out the Diodome Animation Editor: http://diodome.heroku.com

Currently we're looking for funding to support this project and make it a reality. 

This years project is just the first phase. We have plans for a great many variations in the future with the addition of sound, motion tracking and various other forms of interaction making this a project we can bring back to the playa in fresh and exciting ways for years to come.

What do we need the money for?

We are building custom electrical hardware to run the hundreds of LEDs that make up the dome. We're also getting an 18ft 5/8ths geodesic dome that will make the foundation of the Diodome. In order to get the effect seen in the video we need to make custom internal and external skins from translucent material. We'll also be using the money for transportation for the dome and all the equipment necessary to power it on the playa.

We're funding about 1/3rd of the cost of the project ourselves, but we need your help to cover the rest.

One of the great things about this project is the versatility. Once we have the basic system in place we'll be able to modify it to do a variety of other projects without having to outlay a lot of money again, so your contribution will be helping a lot of future art as well.

What have we done before?

In 2010 we built the Illuminatrix, a 4ft x 4ft LED display that was built in the UK and transported to the Playa. This consisted of 256 LEDs showing hundreds of animations created by us and other Burners around the world. It was a huge success and you can still see the results of it here http://cwd.co.uk/illuminatrix/

Another of our members helped create the Woodpushers Gambit in 2005. This was a giant glowing neon chess set out in the deep. http://curple.com/chess

What you can do?

Obviously you can contribute here on Indiegogo, but you can also share this page with your friends, or like us on Facebook.

You can also script animations for the Diodome using our editor diodome.herokuapp.com.

If all goes well come find the Diodome in the Deep Playa at this year's Burning Man. We look forward to seeing you.

story:
Short Summary

On the Spring equinox ( March 21st) of 2014, Liba W Stambollion and Gabriela Garza Padilla will launch a month-long exhibit of fifty four artists starting with a week of events. An eclectic range of International art from around the globe ranging from the Visionary Martina Hoffman to the Fantastic Zeljko Djurovic to the Surrealist Patrick McGrath Muñiz to the Indigenous Luis Eleazar Tamani Amasifuen will form one coherent exhibit of Spirit and Reflection.

Films, music, live painting, poetry and a Mayan Fire Ceremony for Peace, for balance and for Love will take place from Friday the 21st to Wednesday the 26th of March. The exact schedule will be out once we see how much money we can raise. If we raise more than we are asking for it will go towards other acts and showing the exhibit in other cities. (yes, we have offers!) 

“Ex-Convento de Santo Domingo”
San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Chiapas, México not too far from the ancient Mayan site of Palenque.

Participating artists in alphabetical order:

Adam Scott Miller

Alex Sastoque

Aloria Weaver  & David Heskin

Andrew Gonzalez

Brigid Marlin

Bruce Rimell

Caroline Cottereau

Carrie Ann Baade

Cody A. Seekins

Delphyne V

Dennis Pokotar

Dominique Desorges

Don  Farrell

Elisa Keir  & Crico Baker

Elisabeth Slettnes

Emma Watkinson

Erik Heyninck

Gabriela Garza Padilla

Gaia Orion

Graszka Paulska

Gromyko Semper

Héctor Pineda

Iain Whittaker

Jade Leyva

Juan Carlos Taminchi

Kim Evans

Krisztina Lazar

Liba Waring Stambollion

Luis Eleazar Tamani Amasifuen 

Marcus McAllister

Mark Henson

Martin Stensas

Martina Hoffmann

Michael Divine

Michel Bassot

Miguel Tio

Nobuki Omori

Otto Rapp

Onayanti

Pascal Ferry

Patrick McGrath Muñiz

Pep Jaumandreu Fernandez

Peter Gric

Regine Kafeder

Renee Tay and Tayloe Wimmer

Roku Sasaki

Sabina Nore

Sarah Zambiasi

Stuart Griggs

Susana Bravo

Timea Tallian

Vesna Krasnec

Wessi

Zeljko Djurovic

What We Need 

All work for these non commercial shows and events is volunteer. We are fundraising to cover basic expenses.

Artwork needs to be handled by costly carriers like FedEX or UPS rather than the postal service. This becomes too pricy for most artists to pay the roundtrip transport of their pieces for noncommercial shows.  We would like to fundraise for the return of the work which will be around 13.000 euros.

We would also like to cover the airfare of organizers and hotel rooms for all performers and artists participating in the event.  Gabriela Garza Padilla will have to do three round trip voyages to set up, launch and break down the show. She is single with three children and will need not only her basic airplane and hotel costs covered but also an au-pair for all three trips.

We have been offered some new AMAZING places to exhibit this show. Also Tom Frouge, head of the World Music Festival GLOBALQUERQUE - http://www.globalquerque.org/ can set us up with some wonderful World musicians if we can pay logistics. I have not covered all these new needs in the budget and from your pledges we still need to remove shipping costs and the Indiegogo commission and charges. We  have set a  goal to cover the most basic costs so that we have a better chance of obtaining our financial goal and paying 4% comission instead of 9%.  But Indiegogo campaigns can raise MORE than what is asked for SO PLEASE PLEDGE EVEN IF WE HAVE REACHED OUR PLEDGE AMOUNT.  

Return of artwork:

13100 €

Airplane tickets for organizers (including 3 round trip tickets for Gabriela)

2950 €

Hotel rooms and  for organizers and performers (including set up and breakdown) and setup and breakdown costs

8340 €

Ceremony offerings and miscellaneous expenses 

110 €

TOTTOTAL:  24500 euros


What You Get

The artists in the group are donating their work in exchange for your help to get this project off the ground. We have books and CD’s, original prints and paintings and much more to give you in exchange for your participation. For the pricier pledges and Divining the Dream, the work is being sold at market price with International shipping included. Not only will you invest in this project through purchasing original artwork but you will also end up with an investment of your own.

We have such a cornucopia of donations from the artist community that we had to group pledge gifts by price. Many are one of a kind and once sold they are no longer available.

BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THE GALLERY OF PHOTOS 

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/dreams-and-divinities-goes-to-mexico/x/5663569?c=gallery

If you have a preference for a pledge please contact libaws@gmail.com to see if it is still available.

The Impact

In a world where War, Pollution and Social Injustice have a stronghold, we would like to restore Balance, Peace and Love through community and the arts. 

There is a strong movement of masterly artists expressing pertinent issues concerning consciousness, ecology and social justice. They are often isolated and overlooked. Dreams & Divinities brings together an International community of extraordinary artists in order to make a big colorful ripple of beauty, healing and joy.

We are offering the public free of cost or by donation, this incredible exhibit of ‘Conscious’ art and events. From the industrial world to the Indigenous world, we form one tribe of many colors united through Love and the Arts. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has cash on hand to help out, but please SHARE the campaign and let's make this happen! 

Many thanks for reading all the way through. Hope to see you in Mexico, Spring Equinox 2014.
