2950 €




Hotel rooms and  for organizers and performers (including set up and
  breakdown) and setup and breakdown costs


8340 €




Ceremony offerings and miscellaneous expenses 


110 €




TOTTOTAL:  24500 euros







What You GetThe artists in the group are donating their work in exchange for your help to get this project off the ground. We have books and CD’s, original prints and paintings and much more to give you in exchange for your participation. For the pricier pledges and Divining the Dream, the work is being sold at market price with International shipping included. Not only will you invest in this project through purchasing original artwork but you will also end up with an investment of your own.We have
such a cornucopia of donations from the artist community that we had to group
pledge gifts by price. Many are one of a kind and once sold they are no longer
available. BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THE GALLERY OF PHOTOS http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/dreams-and-divinities-goes-to-mexico/x/5663569?c=gallery
If you have
a preference for a pledge please contact libaws@gmail.com to see if it is still
available.
The ImpactIn a world where
War, Pollution and Social Injustice have a stronghold, we would like to restore
Balance, Peace and Love through community and the arts. There is a strong movement of masterly artists expressing pertinent issues concerning consciousness, ecology and social justice. They are often isolated and overlooked. Dreams & Divinities brings together an International community of extraordinary artists in order to make a big colorful ripple of beauty, healing and joy.
We are
offering the public free of cost or by donation, this incredible exhibit of ‘Conscious’
art and events. From the industrial world to the Indigenous world, we form one
tribe of many colors united through Love and the Arts. Other Ways You Can HelpWe know that not everyone has cash on hand to help out, but please SHARE the campaign and let's make this happen! Many thanks for reading all the way through. Hope to see you in Mexico, Spring Equinox 2014.
campaign_city: San Cristobal de la Casas, Mexico

story:
A Bit of Background

I am Daniel Smith, a Photography BFA candidate at UGA, and I am the Visual Producer/Director of The Music of the Spheres.

For previous and ongoing projects, I have received funding from the UGA Honors Program, a CURO Summer Fellowship Grant, a travel stipend to the the 2011 UGA Costa Rica Research Symposium, and a travel stipend to the 2012 National Conference of Undergraduate Researchers. I have exhibited work in a variety of juried shows in Athens and Atlanta, and in the next twelve months, I will have my recent work, Inferno, exhibited in a solo show at Lamar Dodd School of Art in Athens, a joint exhibition at Mary Elizabeth Dee Shaw Gallery in Ogden, as part of Atlanta Celebrates Photography, and in an upcoming exhibition in Cincinnati.  


A Bit of Foreground

The Music of the Spheres is a large scale video/music composition partially funded by a grant from Ideas for Creative Exploration, representing the culmination of two years of undergraduate art research, and it is the ongoing focus of my thesis. The now in-production artwork will manifest as an allegorical map of mankind, composed of numerous composited video elements, and harmonized with original music by MMUS candidate, Cody Brookshire, and DMA candidate, Matthew Phillips. The work unifies the ideas and skillsets of students from the Lamar Dodd School of Art and the Hugh Hodgson School of Music in the creation of a transformative, digital experience for a variety of audiences. The visual component, for which I petition your help, will be a massive, moving image of an impossible world populated by numerous figural forms.

 

ICE + $600

I ask your help to supplement the limited yet much appreciated ICE seed grant that our team has received. Your support is a vital source of fluid funds which will give us the extra boost to afford a collapsable green screen, climbing rope, numerous props, costuming, and a couple of cheap pizzas to lure on set one or two desperately needed production assistants. 

These expenses represent those of important, upcoming and ongoing video shoots. They are of the variable variety for which it is difficult to use ICE funds and which often end up coming out of my pocket. From the shallow stitches of this pocket, I ask your help.

 

Other Ways to Help

If you have interest in art, you may not have money, but you certainly have friends who have art interests. Whether or not you contribute, please show these art aficionados this page.

story:
Hermit Springs Needs Your Help! 

Hermit Springs is funky stone cabin within minutes of downtown Palm Springs, CA. I'm planning on using it as a residency for artists, writers, film makers, and outdoor enthusiasts who desire a secluded retreat within a couple of hours from home.

I'm 95% of the way to the finish line, please help me to fully turn my dream into a reality! There are three projects left to do.  

  • Metal Roof
  • Privacy Fence
  • Landscaping

In exchange for your help, I'll offer a variety of valuable perks including discount accomodation, guided hikes, and more.   

About me:

  • Hiking guide
  • Actor & part-time stunt man.
  • Search & Rescue team member
  • 2nd degree black belt in Shotokan Karate
  • I also know how to laugh and have a great time 

Donating to this cause enhances the accessability of Mt. San Jacinto and the surrounding area. With your help, this house can again be a rest-stop for travellers as it was back in the days of the Pony Express and the Well's Fargo Stagecoach. Visit in person and see what I mean! 

 What We Need & What You Get:

My goal is $2000, but I'm happy going over also! 

  • I need about $6000 to rebuild the roof in metal and cap the eaves
  • I need about $3000 for a metal fence and gates
  • I need about $1000 for some landscaping and irrigation. 

In exchange for helping me, I plan on opening up my doors to hikers, backpackers, writers, artists, acoustic musicians, and photographers. Basically, creative folk that want a pleasant escape without the overhead of owning your own cabin. Think of it as a joining a club when you help me in completing this project. This will bring us together. 

If I don't reach my goal, I will be happy to credit the ammount donated to the whichever figure is closest. For example: if I only recieve $800 - I'll use that money to install some much needed landscaping. If I recieve near $5000, I'll put on a new roof and continue to the best of my abilities.      

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Know some roofers, fencers, or landscapers? Maybe we can work something out
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

HERMIT SPRINGS

Close to Palm Springs, Closer to Nature... 

Writers, outdoorsmen (& women), artists,  - you'll love it here.

Only 9.4 miles from Palm Springs, yet, quieter, darker, and cooler. The air is fresh, the views are unparalleled, the cabin is quaint and comfortable - a home for the traveling outdoorsman - or artist that want's some much needed inspitation. 

"The view from San Jacinto is the most sublime spectacle to be found anywhere on this earth!"
                          -John Muir, (Founder of the Sierra Club)

DESCRIPTION

Hermit Springs is a stone cabin located right outside of the vacation city of Palm Springs, California. It lays within the 272,000 acre Santa Rosa and San Jacinto Mountains National Monument where you will enjoy beautiful unobstructed views of the 10,835’ north face of Mt. San Jacinto and have unparalleled door front access to the world famous Pacific Crest Trail (PCT) which stretches over 2,600 miles from Mexico to Canada.

In addition to staying in a unique environment that is perfect for hikers and photographers, other optional outdoor activities here include alpine climbing, bouldering, dune exploration, paragliding and more.

Hermit Springs is located at 1,200' elevation - making it a consistent 10 to 15 degrees cooler than the rest of Palm Springs year round.

This little stone 'cottage' has recently been refurbished - it now features reclaimed and custom milled mesquite hardwood floors, hand-plastered walls, an open beam wood ceiling, two wood-burning fireplaces, a designer stainless steel kitchen with a massive farm sink, a professional stainless steel range, and a full-sized modern stainless steel refrigerator. For eating: an acacia and steel pub table is perfect for sharing a drink while discussing adventures, playing games, or journaling your thoughts for the day.

You'll also enjoy a massive custom built 4'X6' tumbled travertine bathtub with dual 8" brass rain shower heads. Three, six-gallon carboy glass bottles set in the west wall light up the shower in the late afternoon, yet provide total privacy while enjoying a refreshing dip.

The bathroom features an antique baroque mirror, a hand-hammered Indian vessel sink and a vintage cabinet from the 1800‘s with a solid granite top. Two fir shaker-style pocket doors provide privacy and easy access from both the bedroom and the living room. Extra toiletries can be found therein.

An extra long bed with antique solid oak head and footboards accommodates two comfortably and two more guests can stay in the living room on an air mattress. Extra blankets and sheets are in the walk-in closet where you can also store your luggage and provide extra space for jackets, backpacks, or other bulky items.

Outside is a six-seater iron furniture set placed in natural desert landscape. In the yard are barrel cactus, aloe, agave, palo verde, desert willow, nolina, cholla, prickly pear, yerba santa, creosote, cottonwood, etc. Many have amazing blooms in the spring, but others bloom in the summer. There is also a classic Weber kettle BBQ charcoal grill for outdoor grilling during the cool of the day.

WHAT MAKES MY HERMIT SPRINGS SO SPECIAL?

Hermit Springs is special because of the unique history and landscape surrounding this property. Timothy Leary and John Barrymore Jr. were both occupants at one time and the mountain views are spectacular. Huell Howser of “California’s Gold” even visited this little cabin at one point for a special on PBS. In addition, there are not many homes with this sort of view that also happen to be on the Pacific Crest Trail.

HIGHLIGHTS

  • Near the 2600+ mile Pacific Crest Trail -- walk to Canada from here! 
  • Close to Palm Springs, Cabazon Premium Outlets, and Casino Morongo
  • Large custom shower with roman bathtub
  • Wood fire heating in the winter
  • Professional quyality range & stove
  • Located in the San Jacinto National Monument 
  • Close to Palm Springs nightlife, but in awesome nature 
  • Private getaway, yet close to L.A. and San Diego

story:
I am a self taught embroidery artist, currently living in Kansas City, Missouri. I find the majority of inspiration for designs from my day job as a Medical Social Worker. I became involved with RAW: Natural Born Artists in 2012, after being discovered on Etsy. On November 15, 2012, I was named RAW: Visual Artist of the Year, Kansas City. 

I am now eligible to compete on a national level at the RAW Awards 2012 show in Los Angeles, CA. This opportunity is an incredible honor and will help to advance my business.  Winners will be pre-determined and announced on December 10th. Whether or I win or not, I'm going to LA to represent Kansas City, the art of embroidery, and to begin networking for my project. I'm working on opportunities to show my work while in LA.

My intent is to begin using my embroidery skills to teach health literacy through tactile exposure and to develop sensory integration tools for children with Autism and developmental disabilities. The exposure through the RAW Awards will propel me to my goal! I am also eligible for the following: 

  • Consultation with Shana Nys Dambrot, renowned art critic, writer & editor
  • Consultation with Claudia Deutsch, owner of Artspace Warehouse
  • Consultation with Kimya Nuwabi, Winner of Bravo's Work of Art
  • Exhibit in Downtown LA Artwalk
  • Placement in Artspace Warehouse
  • $500 certificate to Blick Art Supplies
  • Opportunity to include art/prints in IndiExhibit celebrity award show gift bags (3 events)
  • 1000 printed IndieCards from Bands on a Budget
  • Write-up feature on Artslant.com
  • Write-up feature on Staged Incident
  • RAW's Golden Ticket: Unlimited free showcases in any RAW location (50+ cities) during the 2013 season
  • RAW:Visual Artist of the year Winner's Seal & Accolade
  • RAW On-Camera interview
  • Honored at RAWards 2012 Ceremony as RAW:Visual Artist of the Year
  • Featured on RAWartists.org   

Your contribution will allow me to cover travel expenses, in order to be able to make the journey from the midwest to LA! I feel that this is my greatest pesonal achievement to date and your support through this incredible journey will mean the world to me. 

I currently need $1500.00 to travel. I am resposible for the costs of my travel, accomodations, shipping of art and display, campaign fees, and related expenses for the trip. 

You can view my work here: Etsy Shop

Learn more about me through my website: Hey Paul Studios

Other Ways You Can Help

All contribution amounts are helpful and very much appreciated. If a financial donation is not possible, I ask that you share my profile with others who may be interested in donating. Spreding the word is a wonderful way that you can help!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm André van der Hoeven, a physics teacher from the Netherlands. About 2,5 years ago I started making highschool teaching materials for my students about astronomy. This resulted in a book about astronomy for 16-18 year old students and a lesson series in which I introduce them into the beauties of our universe. The book, which is in Dutch, can be found here:

book

Several students have been triggered by these lessons already to start studying physics or related topics. Also a student won a price last year with the European Space Agency for his research on variable stars which he performed together with me.

When I started making the book I needed good images of objects in space and I started looking on the internet for them. Soon I got interested in making images myself and started using my first telescope and a CCD camera that I bought in that time.

This hobby developed very quickly and resulted in dozens of images of objects that were published in several magazines and even on the NASA astronomy picture of the day website. An overview of my imaging results can be found here.  I also shared images with several educational resources and work on developing more teaching materials to motivate students to get into the scientific research. One of my future plans is to publish a book with astrophotography of the most beautiful objects in space.

Image of the Heart Nebula made in October/November 2012 using my equipment.

Recently I have been contacted with the organisers of the NASA 'A human adventure' exhibition that will be opened on June 13th in the Jaarbeurs in Utrecht. This exhibition will have an estimated 250.000 visitors in six months time.
 
Talking with them they gave me the opportunity to exhibit my works nearby the exhibition and have people enjoy my imagery.
 
I worked out a plan in which I will put up about 15 canvases of images with sizes ranging from 1x1 meter to even 2x1 meter.
 
Some examples are shown here:
 
 
 
 
 

Why do I ask for your help?

Setting up an exhibition like this asks quite a lot of investments. Canvases in these size cost quite some money and therefor I need a starting capital to do this. The total costs of the canvases is an estimated 2500 euro. Furthermore I need some money to cover the perks and fees connected with crowdfunding, filling up the other 750 euros.

So you might think what do I have to offer in return? If you want to help me setting up this exhibition I'm offering a unique opportunity to obtain astro-art for you at home.

Depending on the invested funds I'm offering high-quality prints and canvases of images that you can choose from my website. For the top investors I will offer the opportunity to image an object of your choice (in mutual discussion of course, because not everything is possible) and get a print of that.

The Impact

Your investment will make it possible for >200000 people to enjoy my imagery of objects in the universe and will make it possible for myself to share this with them. Furthermore I can use the coverage to find resources to improve the teaching materials that will be freely available to all teachers and students in the Netherlands. If funding is succesful a future possibility could even be a translation of the book in English, but that needs quite some more time.

My students are enthousiastic about the astronomy lessons and it gives them a good indication of what science has to offer for a future career. This exhibition could provide means to reach even much more people than only my own students.

If I will not reach the goal the money will be put on hold until enough resources have been gathered to start the exhibition. The prints and canvases will be still made using the current images on the site and possible future imagery.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute for this project I would still be happy if you could share this project with your friends/family/acquaintances.
 
Thanks a lot for your help!
 
André van der Hoeven

story:
"My dog always seemed to be staring at something so I wrote a book about him and his imaginary friend." - Humans of New York, November 6, 2013

MY DOG MONTY IS REAL - SO IS THE BOOK:

IT'S JUST HIS FRIEND QP WHO IS IMAGINARY

Hello this is Ignacio Quiles here – you may have seen me on Brandon Stanton's Humans of New York with my dogs Monty and Saki. Pamela Moore and I really are working on a book about Monty and his imaginary friend QP. The outline is done and most of the text is too. We are working on the illustrations now.

This journey began five years ago on a snowy New Year’s Eve. I was laid up with a cold, but we had seen Monty’s picture on the internet and I had fallen in love with him. Pamela had the day off and rushed over to Brooklyn to fill out the paperwork at a shelter called BARC (Brooklyn Animal Resource Coalition). I thought he’d already be gone or they’d be closed because of the holiday but to my great delight she returned home with Monty in tow just a few hours later.

MONTY IS THE BEST - BUT HE HAS A FARAWAY LOOK IN HIS EYES

He really is the best dog. He has a few issues – fear of cars, fear of skateboards, irritation when petted by strangers – but we don’t blame him. When he was found running stray in the Highbridge section of the Bronx he was in pretty bad shape. We were told that he might have been living on the streets for six months. But it didn’t take him long to love us and get over most of his issues.

However he has always had a far away look in his eyes. And I swear he sometimes looks into the distance with a funny smile on his face transfixed by some unknown entity. Pamela and I each caught him doing this so many times that one day I figured it out – “He has an imaginary friend!” I exclaimed.

QP IS BORN AND THE BOOK FOLLOWS SUIT

Fast-forward a year and Pamela and I decided to launch a vintage emporium at a local flea market. At first we were going to call it QP (a variation of our names Quiles – me Pamela- her) New York, but at the last minute I said let’s make it QP and Monty. So Pamela got to work on the logo a drawing of a modern kewpie doll with our boy Monty. She put together a thumbnail and hired an artist to draw an illustration.

It was so adorable that children used to make a pilgrimage to our flea market booth just to visit the sandwich board sign we had on display featuring QP and Monty’s image. There were twins who came regularly to dance with them and a very sweet young boy who insisted on kissing Monty’s image every time he came by. We knew right away that we had to write Monty’s story and get Ariel to help us illustrate it. We both had full time jobs so it has taken us a couple of years, but this past summer I wrote the outline.

Pamela filled out the text and began storyboarding.


We are ready to put pen to paper and finish the illustrations. 

HOW WILL WE SPEND THE MONEY?

We just need your help to raise the funds to pay for the illustrations and then to print the book. 

We know you will love Monty’s story of how QP was his friend and gave him hope as he wandered the streets of NY looking for a forever home. He danced for her and she kept him company on cold lonely nights. But most importantly she gave him hope and love and brought him to us

With your help we’ll bring their book to life. And hopefully encourage more people to adopt great dogs like Monty along the way.


WHAT WILL WE DO WITH ANY EXTRA MONEY?

If the book takes off we plan on donating 20% of the net proceeds to BARC. If you love dogs please check them out at www.barcshelter.org That's where we found Monty - they deserve your support even if you don't get the book.

Thank you so much for your interest!!

Ignacio and Pamela - and of course Monty too!

story:
Short Summary

What we want to do:

We want to convert our studio space into a pop-up gallery running from Friday evening until Sunday featuring groups of local artists doing eveything from sculpture, to painting, drawing, mixed media, installations, performance, video and handcrafted items all in downtown Napanee!!!

All on the same weekends as the nearby farmers market thereby co-supporting each other.

On the official opening on Friday we will serve locally produced goods for a full gallery experience. 

Who I am

Krysta-lee - Creative Director and Co-Founder of Napanee design Studio

WWW.NAPANEEDESIGNSTUDIO.COM

Creator of www.harvestwalk.blogspot.com and www.napaneeunderground.blogspot.com

I worked 2 years at a photography gallery on Queen St W in Toronto. Lens Factory. I independently hosted my own art shows there. (ie: Dimitri Karakostos of Blood of the Young) I have also worked/performed with Istvan Kantor (Govenor Generals Award in Visual and Media Arts)

Event Experience: Organized my first concert at 14. I Co-created charity coffee houses where I helped find talent, organized venue and equipment, and marketing. All procceeds to charity. Also a whole array of community development and education types of workshops. I was also a fashion show co-ordinator for Graduation En Vogue in Montreal. The final event had over 500 attendees. 

My background is political science and community development.

Napanee Design Studio is a Think-Outside-The-Box creative and collaborative business venture that seeks to market and explore the beauty and depth of rural living and the entreprenuerial spirit. 

Why it's important to us:

We are seeking to have a pop-up style art gallery in downtown Napanee which is rural-south eastern Ontario. This project is important to me because being a child of socio-economic disadvantage in a rural area I really didnt even know that one could actually be an "artist" I thought that was like wanting to be some fictitious profession like the tooth fairy. I think it is important to have opportunity and exposure to the arts and I find it lacking here. I would like the project to be very particpatory and give a place for many people to display their work and be inspired to use the creative parts of their brains and to dream. To not work in isolation. 

Its also important to me because I see and meet so many talented people and yet there is no place in the public sphere for them to display or create a dialogue. That needs to start.

We will also have the pop-up gallery events co-ordinated on the same dates as the Talents of the Town/Farmers Market. ideally we will have an official opening night on the Friday and serve locally sourced goods. Then have full hours on Saturday and Sunday.

How you will help :)

The creative economy is the future economy. You will be helping expose so many young people to new ideas and inspire connections and help the creation of a creative community right in the heart of Napanee. 

You will help create a positive cultural outlet. 

You will also help to create a stronger rural fabric of identity; People need to tell their stories and experience somewhere.

This space will not only be used as a gallery we want to work on teaching about seasonal food and eating and healthy cooking recipes aimed at young families. We hope for it to be a cultural centre for all kinds of mediums. 

What We Need & What You Get

To break it down in more detail:

  • White Paint - we have a gorgeous massive space - lets paint it white!

  • Hanging Hardware
  • Photography Printing supplies - larger prints for photography
  • Frames
  • Lighting
  • Marketing (online, postcards, posters, local markets)
  • Projector rental for video + Sound equipment if necessary
  • Souvenir Zines of Art
  • Opening Night Supplies (locally produced goods)

Other Ways You Can Help

Help with more than just money!!!! 

  • Get the word out! Share on facebook! on Twitter! or Email.

  • Are you a local food producer? Donate us some ingredients for us to whip up into tasty treats and promote your business!
  • Sponsor us with alcohol! Wine, Beer, Cider! For opening night.
  • CONTRIBUTE ART!!!!
  • Propose other ideas to us!!! Lets work together to build community creatively!

story:
Short Summary

We want to bring fun, activity and creativity to the hospital bound child!

We have built children’s games. We have made children’s toys. We have shared the making of these things with children at camps and schools. We are Critical Mass Interactive, Inc., an Austin based transmedia company, founded in 2003. We have built games for kids from SpongeBob SquarePants to Freaky Pets. We have also contributed a fully animated PSA for the State of Texas Department of Agriculture My Pyramid Cafe nutrition campaign.

Now we want to support healing through the arts.

The Art of Healing Project will bring activities and projects to the children by way of visiting artists, animators, musicians, actors, sculptors, painters and writers who will come to the hospital with hands-on, inclusive sessions on a rotating schedule.

We have visited the wonderful Dell’s Children's Hospital in Austin, and they have agreed to allow us to bring The Art of Healing to the children! What we are doing is bringing art to a group of 20 to 30 young patients for each event. We are preparing our first event for March and we need your help.

The first event will bring designing and drawing for games by way of individual iPads, with drawing apps, and presentations from the best character artists in Austin.

We need your help in the initial pilot project support needs, after which we will have a demonstrated organization and product to go after corporate sponsors to expand on this success.

Our long term goal is to bring the arts to children in hospitals across the country, to help lift their spirits, their energy, their creativity and, most importantly, their healing.

What We Need & What You Get

The Art of Healing is going to start with an iPad2 for each patient, with drawing, painting, music and game apps already installed. A drawing stylus will be provided, as well.

The Art of Healing will also require a base budget to support the team’s efforts organizing and building the project beyond the first event.

The initial fund being raised to jumpstart the project is $50,000.00, based upon the following cost estimates:

iPad2, 16 Gig, WIFI only tablet, cover, $400

Pengo Stylus, $35

Pengo replacement nibs (6), $35

Drawing and other apps, $30.00

Costs per child, $500

Costs per initial groups (60 children)                              $30,000.00

Admin and support                                                            $15,000.00

Initial Marketing Costs                                                      $5,000.00

Total Estimated Budget for the Pilot Project              $50,000.00

As supporters of The Art of Healing, you will be privy to content generated by the group (in the form of wallpapers, calendars and cards). We will use this content to raise funds for additional programs at Dell's Children's Hospital through online and instore sales.

Also, you will be honored on the Project Website, as Supporters and Champions of The Art of Healing.

The Impact

We have been supporting camps and groups of students over the years, showing them how games are made, how to draw, sculpt, animate, etc. We have also been building game products for kids over the past 15 years, from Spongebob Squarepants to Freaky Pets.

We have also had family members and friends in treatment at hospitals and rehab centers, and we know that a happy, creative mind aids in healing.

This is our opportunity to make a difference in the health and lives of the children at Dell’s Children’s Hospital.

We would like to provide an enlightening, entertaining experience focused on the Arts, from drawing to music to performance, bringing in the great variety of Austin-based talent from the Game, Film, Theater, Dance and Music Communities, to inspire the minds and hearts of the children when they need this positive energy the most for their healing.

We are working closely with the great Staff at Dell’s Children’s Hospital to tailor the events to the well-being of the patients, and building an extended support network to ensure the quality and variety of the Arts content provided to them.

The ultimate goal of the pilot project is to set down the template of this process so that we can iterate it to other children’s health facilities across the country, and to offer the program up for sponsorship and expansion so every child in recovery will have the opportunity to access the Arts, expand their minds and imaginations, and gain strength for their healing.

We come from various backgrounds to this task and are forming the new entity, The Art of Healing LLC, once this pilot project is funded. Please help us make this a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are setting standard levels of contribution on the perks, but will accept any monetary support you can give! $1, $5, $10…any amount will help! And we will be listing supporters at every level! Thank you for the support!

You can also assist in getting the word out to your friends and social networks by using the Indiegogo Share Tools!

We will be updating the campaign on a weekly basis, but contact us anytime and we will do our best to answer your questions.

Thank you for helping us bring The Art of Healing to the children!

Take Care!

story: We're raising this money to commission a portrait featuring our history teacher, Mr. Ortmann's face on the painting "Napoleon I on his Imperial Throne" by Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres in commemoration of his prosperous teaching career and his upcoming retirement. The money from this campaign is going towards the painting itself, shipping and handling, a frame, and finally towards the overall presentation of the painting. The painting will be done by Portrait Painting, whose can be found at: http://www.portrait-painting.com/

story:
About Theartofnet  (www.theartofnet.com)

Project The Art of Net is a online art project that allows millions of people to create the most original piece of art in the world!
Anyone can become a co-author of this unique masterpiece.

We will create a picture together that will travel around the world and which will enter the history of globally known pieces of art. You have a unique opportunity to participate in the creation of a future legend, because this is the historically first picture that will be created online.

I send you your money back!

Upon the whole picture being filled, I will send your money back! (Only for contribution 100USD or more)

A world record attempt

When the picture is finished, it is possible that it will set a new World record as a picture with the largest number of authors.

Express yourself

You can express your ideas, opinions and feelings or you can leave a message for the whole world, make public your QR code, your logo, tag, your link, your idea... There are a lot of possibilities, so don’t spare your originality. That is what makes you different from others.

Examples of use

You can popularize it, place here the photos of your family, their pets, favorite things or simply to leave messages for your friends or family in particular or for the rest of the world as well. At the same time you can share your piece of art on Facebook, Twitter etc.


What you get ?

  • Become an artist of a global piece of work.
  • Discounted price for area on picture.
  • Upon the whole picture being filled, I will send your money back! (Only for contribution 100USD or more)
  • First 100 people who contribute 100 USD and more will be placed in the VIP list, to be found right below the picture!
  • Posters.
  • Participiation on special lists.
  • Chance to be mentioned and highlighted in theartofnet website blog.
  • Chance to your company's logo be visible on the bottom panel all the time.

and also...

Help for charity and Wikipedia

We believe in collaboration and we want to live in a world, where knowledge is freely accessible to everyone. Upon the picture's completion, 100 000 USD will be sent to help fund Wikipedia. 
Also we will donate 100 000 USD to www.lpr.sk (League Against Cancer)

Become popular

The money gained on this page will be used for a greater popularization of this future piece of art! You can consider this picture as a way of making yourself (or others) more popular, with just uploading here a Picture of something that characterizes you or is important for you personally.

Increase the visibility of your webpage

You can add the link to your webpage and popularize it. You can name your link with link description. Its good for SEO. When you buy another pixels you can use another link.

Become a part of the history

This webpage will be available as long as it will be possible (in ideal case forever ), so you can be an example for the future generation, leave them some message or simply explain your way of living.

Exhibit your piece of art in galleries

You can find your contribution physically in galleries where the final picture will be displayed together with the wall of creators.

story:
Who we are

there are nine of us doing a degree in animation/illustration currently in our second year. 

What it's for

We're putting on an exhibition to showcase our work in a professional environment.

It's to teach us things like organisation and also to receive feedback from other creative people

 and it's worth 50% of our grade.

Why we need help

We need some help raising money to go towards renting out a gallery space for about 2 to 3 weeks

What your money goes towards

It would go towards us renting out the gallery space

The opening night. food/drink

frames for the work.

End goal

story:
INTRODUCTION

My name is Fabrizio Constanza and I am an artist and a designer.   I have been creating functional art for nearly two decades and have seen, through my work, the positive impact art has on people.

My Sculpture “The Support of the Cube” was selected to be exhibited at the 2015 ArtPrize® in Grand Rapids, Michigan.  ArtPrize® is a radically open, independently organized international art competition and a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.  ArtPrize® attracts over 400,000 visitors with over 1,600 artists participating from 42 states and 48 countries. With your support, I will have the opportunity to reach and inspire thousands of art aficionados that visit the three week exhibit.

As a designer, I create collectable objects for private clients.  It is both an amazing experience and a privilege.  In the last two years, I have received six international design awards, four from Milan, Italy and two from California, U.S.A.. These awards have positioned me as the most awarded designer in Central America.  My company, Fabrizio Constanza Design, focuses on creating investment art objects. I spend a significant percentage of resources in guaranteeing my products maintain and gain market value. 

As an artist, I seek to inspired people. In 2014 I participated in both New York Design Week and Paris Design Week, with the sole purpose of exposing my work to the general public.  Viewers’ reactions were fantastic and inspired me to create my first public sculpture, “The Support of the Cube”.  I believe it is important to share this piece with art collectors and the general public alike, so I decided to participate in an international art competition that focused on making the competing pieces available to all who wish to experience the intrigue and beauty of art.

THE ART

“The Support of the Cube” piece is a conceptual work that explores the relationship between human emotions and human progress. The piece intends to inspire people to approach the present global challenges with flexible solutions, which I passionately perceive as the next step in human development.

The sculpture combines five major elements: one 4’x4’x4’ Cube manufactured entirely of ultra polished sheet metal, and four organic shaped metal legs. The cube traps and combines the reflection of spectators and their surroundings, making them a part of the cube. The fluid and twisted legs are a conceptual representation of human emotions and creativity - the very core of our inventiveness.  I encourage viewers to reflect on: 

•  Admiring a cube rather than being trapped within in it

•  How emotions support human creations

•  Why, if our emotions are so fluid, is our progress so rigid?

•  Will humanity some day in our future be able to look back at this time and be    amazed by how far we were able to get with such rigid systems and/or be    struck by the naiveté of our culture?

While the sculpture meaning is profound, I encourage people to also simply enjoy the composition. The object was designed to feel dynamic, well balanced and a joy to observe.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Participating in ArtPrize® requires a process where artists connect with curators.  I am honoured my sculpture was selected to exhibit at the Grand Rapids City Hall. The project’s current expenses are $18,000. This includes: materials, manufacturing, insurance, printing of material, shipping to/from Grand Rapids, Michigan, travel to Denver, Colorado to supervise production, and travel expenses to/in Grand Rapids Michigan during the three weeks of the event.

The project exceeds my initial production budget of $8,000 - this is where the collaboration of a sponsor becomes critical.   Sponsorship will enable me to exhibit “The Support of the Cube” at ArtPrize® and share its complex beauty with thousands of sophisticated and novice art admirers alike.

THE IMPACT

The primary objective of the “The Support of the Cube” project is to encourage decision makers to think and act outside the box. I have run my design business based on three essential principles that support this philosophy: first, to ensure my products exceed client expectations; second, that my collaborators have the opportunity to provide a more beautiful future to the next generation, and third, to provide my own family with a better environment and brighter future.  I am able to encourage a better community and culture of doing business by combining all three of these principles in all that I do.

Examples of these principles in action:

·  In 2007, I founded a custom furniture and interior decorating studio in Guatemala and subcontracted with three Guatemalan artisans. Today, each one runs a small business and a crew of three to five skilled artisans.  I sold the company in 2012 and am proud that it is still one of the most impactful custom furniture studios featuring Guatemalan craftsmanship in Central America. I have experienced the rewards of making a difference and creating a positive environment for those in my country that may not have otherwise had the opportunity.

·  In 2007-08’, I developed a charity project, The Charity Chair, for Starlight Children’s Foundation - Colorado.  The organization auctioned two donated KSD-2 Lounge chairs for charitable funds.  All funds raised (after production expenses) went to the organization and the seriously ill children and families that it served.

·  In 2014, I exhibited in the ICFF (International Contemporary Furniture Fair) with the main objective of exposing people to the thought-provoking Strange Land series.  The series explores how we block our emotions as a form of a protective shield and as a result our natural feelings become “strange” to us.  Viewers of the series were sensitive and receptive to the message and I hope made a difference in the life of at least one person.

THE REWARD

I believe in “The Support of the Cube”, the message it extends to those who view it and the impact that art has on humanity.  By supporting this project, you not only ensure “The Support of the Cube” participation in 2015 ArtPrize® but you will be enabling the joy and consciousness that art can inspire.  I look forward to collaborating with you!

story:
Hello!

Opal Manor is a website where I share some of my artwork for free almost daily. People are welcome to download my art and use it for non-commercial purposes, such as papercraft, cardmaking and scrapbooking.

It has been a lovely, creative way for me to get my art out there, and a chance to design my own webpage. However, I'm now in dire need of a new server as the old one is being stalked by Death. Both the server and the PC are from the beginning of this millenium.

I also need new hardware for my arting, and if this campaign would raise more than is needed for the server, that would go to buying a PC fit for the job.

I hope you awesome people out there can help me, so that I can continue making great art, free for use!

The goals

For the new server, I'm hoping to raise 1500 USD. It's not a lot for a server, but it's enough to serve you fast content, and quiet enough to not wake the neighbours. It also saves me and my husband time fom having to do CPR on the damned thing every once in a while. Time which I could spend on creating more awesome stuff! Not to forget all the visitors Opal Manor loses every time the server is down.

If we raise more than that, we will let that money go to the new PC. That's going to cost at least 1000 USD to be useful, but as much as 2000 USD would make it an even better production PC, and would probably increase my productivity. A slow, old computer is a great hotbed for lagging brushes, problems with high resoluted projects, and an artist who wants to throw the desk out of the window. Not great.

Anything more than that would be invested in making sure Opal Manor stays free as far into the future as possible!

Rewards

Of course I don't want you guys to go empty handed if you help us out. Check out the list of rewards on this page's right hand side!

Other Ways You Can Help

You want to help but can't afford to? Maybe you think it's important, but not important enough to spend money on? You can still help! Tell your friends about this campaign, and share it on Facebook, Twitter, talk about it on your YouTube channel; just spread it!



Thank you in advance,

Annie Groth

Stay creative!

story:
Who, or what, the happy heck is "Bassam"?

The name I was born with, "Bassam", is Arabic for "smile". 

I am a former rapper turned-page poet and now spoken word artist from the Greater Toronto Area (GTA).  I've been a stage performer for over a decade, first focusing on dark music and poetry, but over the past two years have gone through a complete self-rediscovery through spoken word.

As a Jewish-Arab feminist, I write poetry on a variety of topics, including body image and bullying, gender equality, patriarchy, privilege, and the Middle Eastern politics.  I also write about family issues, technology, addiction, working in an office, and, like every poet, failed love.

I am currently working on recording and releasing my first, full-length spoken word album (which will eventually become a book) called Mouth:/Poem.Smile and I need your help with the following to make it happen:

  • Recording and editing. 
  • Photography and design. 
  • Manufacturing and promotion.

All leftover funds will be used toward the print version of Mouth:/Poem.Smile.


By A Single Smile Anything Materializes...

I feel that my poetry represents a small glimpse into my many sides as a person: from sarcastic satire and loveable laughter, to social/political justice and emotional anguish.
I hope to speak to the world through poetry while communicating openness to listening, dialogue across genders, cultures,  faiths, struggles, and more.  

Support, like smiles, come in all shapes and sizes. 

Support is not just about quantity, but quality.  Sometimes the best thing a person can contribute isn't out-of-pocket, but word-of-mouth. 

  • If you're not able to contribute financially, spread the word!  Any level of support, be it verbal or financial, helps me with my goal!
  • Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube, are all great ways to spread the message.


Because All Smiles Send A Message...

This project represents me, and would appreciate any level of support that people are able to exchange. 

I recorded a short rap EP in 2005 and self-published a poetic anthology in 2010.  Both under character pseudonym and sobriquet, but not speaking to who I am and the artistic message I want to deliver to the world. 

Through our joy, struggles, and pain, smiles will bring us together.

story:
A little about the project:

Catamount Film & Arts has been a cultural hub in Vermont's Northeast Kingdom for nearly 40 years. In that time it has become very clear to us that providing our community with access to means of creative expression is essential to its well-being. Catamount Arts Center houses two theaters showing independent, foreign, and classic films, an art gallery showcasing local and regional artists, a community performance space, and multiple classrooms in which painting, drawing, theater and music classes take place.

We are also committed to providing arts experiences to folks who may not be able to come to our Arts Center. In 2013 we embarked on a partnership with Northeast Kingdom Community Action to integrate the arts into Head Start preschools. Our aim was and is to provide these children with a well-rounded education and an opportunity to express themselves through the arts. We provide a framework for teaching artists and classroom teachers to collaborate on arts-based lessons, and work to weave the arts into the curriculum in a way that helps children to learn different concepts including reading, motor skills and social skills. 

We were successful in achieving these goals last year in one classroom. This year, as a member of the Vermont Arts Council's Head Start Arts Partnership, we are bringing this flourishing experience to four classrooms, and plan to expand to the remaining four NEK classrooms in the next few years. That's more than 300 children! But we need your help: In order to expand this program, we need to be able to bring in more teachers and more supplies. We need to be able to offer more time: time in the classroom, time for planning lessons, time for evaluations. All of this adds up in dollars that we do not quite have.

The give and the get:

Creating and sustaining an integrated preschool arts program means, among other things, providing materials, teaching artists, and time. All these components cost something. While we have some funding from generous groups and individuals, the unfortunate reality is it isn't enough to keep the program growing. 

Beyond our deep appreciation for your generosity we'd also like to offer you a few other goodies to say 'Thank You.'

-Thank You card featuring student art
-A one-of-a-kind piece of art made and signed by Head Start students
-A CD of songs sung in class
-A t-shirt screen-printed with student art

    The impact

    The Northeast Kingdom is a unique place. It is the most rural and sparsely populated region of Vermont, with the highest rates of poverty and unemployment. Many families are struggling, and aspirations are low. Many kindergarteners enter school ill-prepared for the classroom.

    By providing the Kingdom's children with an arts-based education from an early age, the Arts Partnership also gives them multiple avenues of expression and purpose, and raises their aspirations. Numerous studies have shown the surprising and positive effects of early exposure to the arts, such as:

    -Students participating in an arts-integrated education are more likely to consistently attend class ('When Achievement Data Meet Drama and Arts Integration,' Language Arts, Issue 88).

    -Low-income students who were exposed to the arts in high school were at least three times as likely to earn a Bachelor's degree as low-income students without exposure (Arne Duncan, U.S. Secretary of the Department of Education).

    By starting early with preschoolers, we are prioritizing the arts as an important and effective element of a child's education. We are saying, 'Yes, art is a valuable tool and field of study,' and, 'Yes, we would like this appreciation and exploration to continue as they move further into their education and the world.' 

    The Head Start Arts Partnership is utilizing a highly effective model in which classroom teachers and teaching artists work together to create and deliver arts-infused curricula, and participate in ongoing professional development to ensure the arts are embedded in the Head Start experience.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We'd love it if you could help us spread the word. It's amazing what telling a friend can do. Thank you for taking the time to hear us out and sharing our story with friends and family.

story:
The Project

My name is Luke and I have always been a huge fan of the arts, particularly music. I play the saxophone and the guitar, and I love creating and playing music. Being able to share my ideas and work with others is very important to me. Another thing that is important to me is my church and fellow Christians. I participate in a youth group that meets at Convergence.  Convergence and Convergence Arts Initiative was created to explore the Intersection of Art, Faith and the Human experience.   

I have had many wonderful experiences there.   When I create and share my music, I want to be somewhere with bright colors, open space, and this is exactly what Convergence is creating for many arts organizations in the community.  I want to help Convergence continue to fulfill that mission.

So I have chosen to work with Convergence for my Eagle Scout project. Boy Scouts is all about helping others, and this is a great opportunity to do that. I will be leading fellow scouts in renovating the kitchen space and playground area.  The project will involve lots of painting, cleaning, construction, and repairing. We will be spending three weekends working at Convergence and by the time its done, we will have enhanced this welcoming, inspiring place.

Why We Need Your Help

My fellow scouts and I need your donations to pay for all sorts of supplies that are required to complete this project. We will need wood, paint, power tools, floor tiles, and many other supplies. These materials will cost over $800, and that is why I need your support. With your help, we can support Convergence as they continue to create affordable spaces for the arts and arts organizations in our community.

The Impact

Without your help, this project cannot happen. The supplies that your donations go towards will help update the playground, repair a shed, build a picnic table with benches, install a new tile floor inside, paint and repair cabinets and drawers, as well as various other jobs.

On the playground, a gardening class for children will soon begin that needs to take place in a safe and clean environment. Not only do several groups meet inside the building regularly, events such as plays often take place there. Having this new, inspiring atmosphere will help encourage people to come and participate in activities that could change their lives.

About Convergence Arts Initiative: Creating Better Together!

At Convergence people find a home to explore the deepest parts of themselves. They believe that all people are creative and that art making is a deeply spiritual practice. We are at our best when we work with the power of intentionality and alignment with a higher purpose. Wherever you are on your creative and spiritual journey, Convergence is a supportive place for you to explore, find encouragement and challenge along the way.

By providing affordable space to local artists and arts organizations Convergence Arts Initiative fosters collaboration and creativity in the Alexandria and surrounding communities.  When creative people work together they are able to make the community and our world a better place.  To learn more, visit their website  www.ourconvergence.org  and follow them on Facebook and Twitter @VergeNow


Please spread the word! Let your friends and family know, we need all of the support we can get.

If you have any questions, send me an email at LukeM9673@gmail.com.

        spending three
        weekends working at Convergence and by the time its done, we will have
        enhanced this
        welcoming, inspiring place.

Why We Need Your Help
My fellow scouts and I need your donations
        to pay for all sorts of supplies that are required to complete
        this project. We
        will need wood, paint, power tools, floor tiles, and many other
        supplies. These materials will cost over $800, and that is why I need your support. With your help, we can support
        Convergence as
        they continue to create affordable spaces for the arts and arts
        organizations
        in our community.
The Impact
Without your help,
        this project cannot happen. The supplies that your donations go
        towards will
        help update the playground, repair a shed, build a picnic table
        with benches,
        install a new tile floor inside, paint and repair cabinets and
        drawers, as well
        as various other jobs.
On the playground, a
        gardening class for children will soon begin that needs to take
        place in a safe
        and clean environment. Not only do several groups meet inside
        the building
        regularly, events such as plays often take place there. Having
        this new,
        inspiring atmosphere will help encourage people to come and
        participate in
        activities that could change their lives.
About
        Convergence
        Arts Initiative: Creating Better Together!
At
        Convergence people find a home to explore the deepest parts of
        themselves. They believe that all people are creative and that art making is a
        deeply spiritual
        practice. We are at our best when we work with the power of
        intentionality and
        alignment with a higher purpose. Wherever you are on your
        creative and
        spiritual journey, Convergence is a supportive place for you to
        explore,
        find encouragement and challenge along the way.
By providing
        affordable space
        to local artists and arts organizations Convergence Arts
        Initiative fosters
        collaboration and creativity in the Alexandria and surrounding
        communities.  When
        creative people work
        together they are able to make the community and our world a
        better place.  To learn
        more, visit their website  www.ourconvergence.org  and follow them on Facebook
        and Twitter
        @VergeNow
Please spread the word! Let
        your friends and family
        know, we need all of the support we can get.
If you have any
        questions, send me an email at
        LukeM9673@gmail.com.

story:
Who are Mayor Von Frinzius?

(EN) Mayor Von Frinzius (MVF) is an inclusive theatre company made up of 80 actors and directed by 5 directors. We meet up twice a week and rehears at Teatro Carlo Goldoni, in Livorno, where, since 2008, all our new productions have debuted at the end of May. Our shows usually last about two hours, during which every single member of the group is actively part of the play for every single minute.

(ITA) La Mayor Von Frinzius è una compagnia teatrale composta da 80 attori e diretta da 5 registi. Ci riuniamo due volte a settimana per provare nella Sala degli Specchi del Teatro Carlo Goldoni di Livorno, dove, sin dal 2008, tutte le nostre produzioni hanno debuttato alla fine di maggio. I nostri spettacoli durano solitamente due ore, durante le quali ogni attore della compagnia è parte attiva del tutto, ogni singolo minuto. 

(EN) What makes us so special? We welcome everyone from all walks of life with half our company living with physical or mental issues (e.g. Downs Syndrome, blindness, autism).

(ITA) Cosa ci rende così speciali? Metà dei nostri attori hanno qualche disabilità (come ad esempio sindrome di Down o autismo).

(EN) Together, we like to call ourselves a Theatre Company (yes! with capital letters), not a theatre laboratory. We believe in the great power of authenticity and our aim is bringing this to the stage, every single time. We have been having a lot of fun and have built strong friendships since 1997. We have helped people to express themselves, to transform their weaknesses into powerful theatrical characters, we have faced personal problems all together, we have cried together and laughed together, we have danced until our feet were numb, we have brought our emotions and fears to the stage and dismissed them together with our audience. 

Having performed for almost 20 years now, we have won national and international prizes and have conquered and warmed the hearts of different audiences across Italy. Yet, we find ourselves struggling to cover all our expenses every year, and especially since 2009's recession, it is more difficult each year for us to bring to life our beliefs and dreams.

(ITA) Ci piace definirci una Compagnia Teatrale (sì, con le maiuscole!), non un laboratorio teatrale. Crediamo fermamente nella forza dell'autenticità e il nostro obiettivo è portare questa autenticità sul palco. Ci divertiamo, piangiamo, ridiamo insieme, abbiamo creato legami fortissimi tra di noi sin dal 1997, quando la Compagnia ha iniziato la sua attività. Abbiamo aiutato persone ad esprimersi, a trasformare le loro debolezze in personaggi potentissimi sul palco, abbiamo affrontato perdite e problemi personali insieme, abbiamo ballato fino a non sentire più i nostri piedi, abbiamo portato sul palco le nostre paure e le nostre emozioni e le abbiamo esorcizzate insieme al nostro pubblico. 

Siamo attivi da 20 anni e abbiamo vinto premi nazionali e internazionali, e conquistato ed emozionato tantissimi italiani. Tuttavia, ci troviamo in grande difficoltà a coprire le nostre spese e specialmente dal 2009, ogni anno diventa per noi più difficile far diventare realtà i nostri sogni, ciò in cui crediamo.

(EN) We think our project deserves to continue bringing happiness to our actors, our actors' families, our directors, our city and our community of fans and supporters. More than anything, we deserve to be able to perform our 2017 production in as many theatres as possible. This is where you can help!

(ITA) Crediamo fermamente che il nostro sia un progetto unico che meriti di continuare ad esistere e portare grandi soddisfazioni ai nostri attori, alle loro famiglie, ai registi, alla nostra città e alla nostra comunità di fan e sostenitori. Più di ogni altra cosa, per noi sarebbe fantastico poterci esibire non solo al Teatro Goldoni, ma in moltissimi altri posti. 

È qui che puoi entrare in gioco!


How you can support us (5 easy steps)


Why we need you

(EN) For those familiar with the performing arts industry: you certainly know what we are talking about when we say “expenses”. For those not familiar with it, let us explain more in detail how we’d like to use Indiegogo funds.

€3,000 will allow us to cover:

  • The stage service expenses (sound, lighting, theatrical installation, etc.) of our 2017 premiere
  • The 2017 show's scenography
  • The production of the new show’s merchandising (i.e. t-shirts)
  • Hire professional photographers and video makers for the premiere
  • The production of the new show’s DVDs

(ITA) Con 3.000€ saremo in grado di coprire le spese di service (suoni, luci, microfoni), il costo della scenografia, la produzione delle nostre maglie e dei nostri DVD, il costo di fotografi e video-maker professionisti durante il debutto.

(EN) Anything above €3,000 will be used to reshape our digital presence, cover admin expenses, cover our collaborators’ travel expenses, to help us to participate in national and international competitions and to support our project for longer than one year! Woohooo!

(ITA) Se riusciremo a raccogliere più di 3.000€, useremo i fondi per la comunicazione online, coprire spese amministrative, coprire spese di trasferte eventuali e riusciremo a sostenerci per più di un anno.

How we’ll say “thank you”

(EN) On top of our eternal and sincere gratitude, we have prepared a list of perks for you. Rest assured that all of these have been designed and produced with all our love (even when we will be packing every single perk, making sure each one of you will receive what they pledged for).

(ITA) Oltre ad un "Grazie" grosso come una casa, abbiamo preparato una lista di premi per voi. Sia le magliette sia le cartoline di Laura Sgherri sono state disegnate e prodotte con tutto il nostro amore, e una volta terminata la campagna, ci assicureremo che vi arrivino tutti i premi che avete scelto al più presto possibile. Qua sotto troverete uno schema dei premi associati a ogni possibile donazione. Se avete domande, non esitate a contattarci.


Laura Sgherri's drawings:


The impact

(EN) We really believe that ours is a revolutionary project and we’re not the only ones who think so with national and international prizes under our belt: Tutti Pazzi X il Teatro, 2011; Teatr Arka, 2011; Beppe Occhetto prize, 2015; Il Giullare, Trani, 2016. Our annual premiere sells out every year in about three days, we entertain hundreds of people each year, we move them and share emotions with them and most importantly, we do what we love.

(ITA) Crediamo fermamente che il nostro sia un progetto rivoluzionario - e non siamo i soli. Oltre a voi, nostri fantastici sostenitori, negli anni abbiamo ricevuto tantissimi riconoscimenti nazionali e internazionali come Tutti Pazzi X il Teatro, 2011; Teatr Arka, 2011; Beppe Occhetto prize, 2015; Il Giullare, Trani, 2016. Oltre ai riconoscimenti (che fanno sempre piacere!) la serata di debutto del nostro spettacolo ogni anno fa il sold out in soli tre-quattro giorni, ogni anno emozioniamo centinaia di persone condividendo con loro paure, gioia, rabbia, follia. Ma soprattutto, facciamo ciò che amiamo. Non sono questi motivi sufficienti per sostenerci?

(EN) Despite its purely artistic aim, we have seen that our theatre method has helped a lot of our actors: from starting to talk and engage with people to realising a talent for ballet and using the stage to cope with personal difficulties.

We have been struggling to collect sufficient funds to support our activities and cover our expenses, especially since the 2009 recession. Now, in 2016 we are at risk of not being able to sustain ourselves and help the marginalised individuals that we involve in our activities. By supporting our journey, you will allow this beautiful adventure to continue and grow. 

Every single donation and share will help!

(ITA) Nonostante il nostro laboratorio e i nostri spettacoli abbiamo puramente intento artistico, negli anni abbiamo aiutato moltissimi dei nostri attori. C'è chi ha iniziato a parlare, chi a camminare, chi ha scoperto una passione (e un talento!) incredibile per la danza e chi ha "semplicemente" utilizzato il palcoscenico per superare difficoltà personali.

Ogni anno abbiamo difficoltà a raccogliere fondi a sufficienza per continuare ad esistere e funzionare. Oggi, siamo a rischio di non riuscire più a coprire tutte le nostre spese e continuare le nostre attività, che coinvolgono tantissimi soggetti marginalizzati dalla società. 

Sostenendoci con una donazione (piccola o grande che sia), ci permetterai di continuare la nostra bellissima avventura. Ogni donazione conta. 


Other ways you can help and support us

(EN) If you can’t contribute to our project, there are certainly other ways you can help!

Get the word out and make some noise about our project! You can easily share our Indiegogo campaign by using the featured share tools. Every share will mean a lot for us.

Also, like us on Facebook and spread the love!

(ITA) Se non puoi effettuare una donazione, puoi sostenerci diffondendo la nostra campagna sui social media e con il passaparola. 


Risks & Challenges

We are fully committed to making MVF the best it can be. We have been on the scene for almost 20 years, constantly growing in both our actor-base as well as popularity. This has brought challenges that we have overcome with passion, love and expertise. However, we appreciate and understand that on our way there might be obstacles; if this is the case, we will do our best to mitigate them.

Currently the main risk is not getting 100% funding on Indiegogo. In this case, we will have to activate our Plan B, leveraging our contacts to collect funds and/or participating to public fundraisers, knowing that the process will be longer and more complicated.

However, our main concern is to make sure that you get your perks on time, and will enjoy and love them as much as we do. 

Thank yous

Thanks to each and every one of you, supporter or not. If you have reached this paragraph, we certainly owe you thanks!

Thanks to Claudia Mazzeranghi, Lucia Picchianti, Aurora Fontanelli and Francesca Vivarelli: on the top of being part of our crowdfunding team, they are breaking their backs to keep MVF up and running on a daily basis.

Thank you One Eat One for letting us use your music in our video, brilliantly put together by Chiara Cunzolo.

Thanks to all our actors and their families: without you this project wouldn't be real.

Thanks to all the Teatro C. Goldoni staff: you are our greatest fans!

Thanks to Haccompagnami, the non-profit organisation that has taken us under their legal umbrella and Barbara Rossi.

Thanks to Laura Sgherri, Gian Luca Palazzolo, Silvia Gelli and Federico Bernini for the amazing photos.

Thanks to Livorno and all our supporters and fans. All our productions sell out within a week every year, and this means the world to us.

Thanks to Simone Castellacci.

story:
THE STORY 

Francesco and Eleonora are brother and sister, they live by themselves and with their goldfish after the loss of their parents. Francesco is 20 years old and wants to become a songwriter. During the all short he tries to find a producer to sell his new album, that no-one except him can listen to yet. One night, a strange character gives him the address of a producer, that same night he, his sister and their goldfish travel a long way towards this great opportunity.  

Francesco ed Eleonora sono fratello e sorella e vivono da soli con il loro pesciolino rosso dopo la scomparsa dei loro genitori. Francesco ha 20 anni e sogna di diventare un cantautore. Durante tutto il corto è alla ricerca di un produttore grazie al quale possa vendere il suo nuovo CD, che nessuno può ascoltare eccetto lui. Una notte, uno strano personaggio gli confida il contatto di un produttore, quella stessa notte, parte per un viaggio insieme alla sorella e al pesciolino verso una grande opportunità.



CAST

STEFANO RIGGI : Writer and Director


ALESSIO MODICA : Actor


SARA LEOPARDI : Actress


FRANCESCO MARUCCIA : Actor and Producer




Our cast is constantly gaining new people to make the best out of this project.

Il nostro cast è in continua crescita grazie a nuove persone e figure professionali per far si che il progetto venga al meglio.

Music

Music is very important for our story. Francesco is a young song writer, so the short itself has to prove how much he loves music. In the film there will be three songs performed by Alessio himself, and one of them is original.

La musica è molto importante ai fini della nostra storia. Francesco è un giovane cantautore, perciò il corto stesso deve provare quanto il protagonista ami la musica. Durante il film ci saranno tre brani cantati e suonati dallo stesso Alessio, uno dei quali sarà completamente originale.




We hope you are excited to see Franklin as much as we are. Thank you for reading and funding our project.


Speriamo che voi vogliate vedere Franklin quanto lo vogliamo noi. Grazie per aver letto e per aver finanziato il nostro progetto.

Share this campaign on Facebook and follow our social pages: Franklin short film.

Condividete la campagna su Facebook e seguiteci sui social al nome: Franklin short film.

Grazie.

story:
FoolsFURY Theater is an ensemble theater community of artists, activists and culture makers. For over 21 years, we've been making and producing groundbreaking theater that inspires audiences and artists to reconsider and reconnect with the world around them. 

Despite COVID, displacement, wildfires, and amid the fight for racial justice, we remain resilient and hopeful. We’re shaping a bold new vision for 2021 and beyond. 

We are transforming ourselves into an organization that prioritizes anti-oppression and equity, cultivates spaces for QTBIPOC artists, and centers human relationships above all else. And you are a part of that vision.

We are breaking the model to create a better, more equitable future. 

Let’s build it together.

We need to raise $25,000 to help fund new programs and initiatives for 2021 and ensure fiscal discipline as we grow! 

Paying and Expanding Our Staff 

While making art is a full-time endeavor, our industry often undercompensates artists and regulates them to part-time wage earners. We recognize that we frequently rely on volunteers, or the generosity of staff, to donate time and effort.  Economic justice demands that we pay our artists, staff, and collaborators a living wage for the work they do. 

Initiatives include: 

  • Increasing wages of all artists and collaborators including a
  • Building a QTBIPOC early-career artist cohort
  • Hiring a Festival Director to curate our renowned FURY Factory Festival 

 

Programs, Shows & Workshops

While we are investigating ways to make art safely together both physically and digitally, we are excited by the opportunity to reach more folks than ever before.  Expanded programs and new performances include:

  • The Library Project  a major new immersive theatrical experience in collaboration with playwright Katie Pearl, premiering 2021/22

  • Blueprint: Ensemble Liberation Lab--driving new models of training and equitable collaboration

  • The Early Career Leadership Initiative--paid fellowships and youth advisors to our board

If we are unable to meet our fundraising goals, our programming and offerings will be in jeopardy. Because of the generosity of emergency funding, we did not lay off staff during this ongoing pandemic, and actually increased our payments to collaborators to help offset the current economic upheaval. 

Without your support, we won’t be able meet this financial responsibility. All donations, purchases, class fees, and ticketing support our programming, pay our artists, and ensure operational viability. We do not want money to be an obstacle for folks to experience art. 

 

Without community there is no theater. You are a part of our success, and our future plans. (We know it’s a clicheé, but hey, it really does take a village for us to do what we do!)

Here’s what we’ve been able to do during a pandemic with the generous support of our community this year:

  • Produced and streamed BUILD From Here: The Future of Ensemble Theater, a multi-platform online conference, to over 3,000 viewers from all over the United States and across the globe. (in partnership with Howlround!)
  • Paid over 65 ensemble artists and companies to cultivate and develop new works
  • In collaboration with LMDA, developed over 17 multimedia digital dramaturgical works that we call “Microturgy.”
  • Hosted a 6-week anti-racist learning circle

 

Did we mention we did ALL this on a $100K budget?!  Help us leverage our ongoing ingenuity, tenacity and hard work with financial resources to grow!

With your support, we are breaking the model, so that we can reinvent a better, more equitable way forward for our industry. 

Your partnership enable us to continue to:

  • Produce evocative and new work with an expanded cohorts of artists
  • Build a community and network of artists, theatermakers, educators and cultural workers.
  • Maintain a supportive community of allyship for people of all abilities, races, ethnicities, ages, sexual orientations, and gender identities. 
  • Cultivate the next generation of artists at all levels

story:
The Artist: 

Abdul Mati Klarwein (1932-2002) was born in Germany and fled to Palestine at a young age. After moving to Paris in his teens, Mati studied with Fernand Leger, Salvador Dalí and Ernst Fuchs. Fuchs taught him the Mische technique- an oil paint mixed technique developed by Van Eyck to allow light to enter the surface, suffusing the work with long life.

Mati traveled throughout his whole life living in various places: India, Jamaica, New York, New Mexico, Brazil, Morocco, Cuba, nourishing his etheric self with the mysticism and symbolism of each cultural paradigm he entered. Symbols became a defining form of communication for his artwork:

¨The Word develops Intelligence, the Symbol develops the Spirit.¨

While living in New York, Mati teamed up with Jimi Hendrix, Miles Davis and Santana amongst many other musicians who used his images for their album covers. (52 in total!)

Mati was also commissioned to make over 200 portraits including J.F.Kennedy, Leonard Bernstein, Richard Gere, Geraldine Chaplin. Robert Graves, Yussef Lateef, Jean Baptiste Mondino, Carmen Rossi, and many more.
Mati authored over 600 works, including installations, movies, writings and paintings that summon a world where light is the protagonist, whether it be landscapes or oracular visions.

Eventually Mati settled in a vibrant artist's community in Mallorca and finished his days there, where he found "divine presence in every rock, leaf and grain of sand."

photo by Cristina Barchi

 

The Cards:

¨The first time I saw Mati Klarwein’s art, I was filled with awe. Rarely does an artist incorporate such technical skill with a rich knowledge of multi-layered esoterica and the exploration of alternative dimensions. I felt drawn to Mati’s work immediately.

A year or so later, his daughter Serafine and I sat on a train speeding through the Irish countryside and brainstormed about an oracle deck featuring Mati’s art. The result of that conversation is The Oracular Tachyon. In creating the deck, I read through Mati’s writings and matched phrases with images that spoke to me and resonated at the same level as Mati’s words. I drew upon my knowledge of the Tarot to create a system that echoes the Tarot (especially in the first 22 cards, or Major Arcana) but also stands alone as its own distinct divinatory modality. My intention and continued hope is that The Oracular Tachyon can help Mati’s powerful art reach a broader audience, while also offering a powerful tool for path work,
healing, psychological growth, and spiritual insight.¨ - Annie Lewkowicz

 

THE CREATOR OF THE CARDS:

Annie Lewkowicz was born and raised amidst the mountains and meadows of Montana, USA.
Throughout her life, her love for adventure has led her to live and work in many places around the world, including Canada, England, Korea, New Mexico (USA), and now Spain. Annie’s  background is in literature and publishing, and she is currently finishing a Master’s degree in Transformational Psychology. She is a poet, a potter, and a lover of all things esoteric. Annie’s interest in Tarot and oracle cards stems back to childhood, and her passion has been reignited in recent years by rigorous study and an active reading practice that blends intuition with practical psychological guidance.

 

THE PRINTERS

We will be using printers known for their high quality and employment of handicapped people. Amadip is the story of parents who came together to give strength to a common goal: that their children with intellectual disabilities be well and happy. The association was established in 1962, more than 50 years ago. In that time they have created a wide group of businesses  including printing, restaurants, gardening and more.The objective of their commercial activity is to generate opportunities for training, occupation and employment. Currently, 180 people with intellectual disabilities are part of their staff.
www.amadipesment.org

 

THE DESIGNER

JT Designs are known for their caring and original flair. Javi Tubert is a Mallorcan designer  who brings his dancing sensibility to the screen, flexible in his creativity and imaginative in his structures. You can see more of his innovative work in another joint production with ?=! : www.tranzactivism.org

 

THE PRODUCERS

?=! productions supports surreality taking shape and shaking up reality. From alchemical movies to irreverent children's books to transformative workshops, ?=! productions is an éminence grise & rose in la vie.

 

 

DECK SPECIFICATIONS

95 mm wide x 134 mm high (3,74" x 5,28")

70 full color cards (both sides)

Paper: Invercote Creato Mate, 350 gr/m2

Lettering: Composed from manuscript texts by Mati Klarwein

 

Libretto: 80 pages

Color cover, B&W inside

Paper: Offset White de 90 gr/m2

Binding: Rustica Fresada

 

Box: full color top and bottom

Paper: Invercote Creato Mate, 350 gr/m2

 

Limited edition print run of 500 decks

story: For several years I have thought about the possibilities of alternative worlds – places that do exist even though we don’t seem to see them when we’re in this world. Sort of like the worlds we inhabit when we dream. I have read books on quantum physics and metaphysics alike looking for what people smarter than me have to say about such possibilities. In the end I’m left with my own imagination. An imagination that has no trouble whatsoever believing in the existence of a whole bunch of ‘other’ worlds. I have been a traveler to one in particular, HapiLani, and have collected and created a wealth of material that I think should prove once and for all that this dreamworld at least DOES exist.
