story:
About Ambigram Press

Ambigram Press is an assembly of four superfriends: Bach, Rahmat, Normann & Sukaimi based in Singapore. We were formed around February 2013. Prior to our founding, we have always been avid screenprint enthusiasts and some of us are art students. We screenprinted t-shirts for local bands and distros as well as our own artworks on paper. Our first ever live screenprinting gig was at a non-profit event at the Substation Garden Singapore where there was an overwhelming response by people who wanted to get their t-shirts, handkerchiefs and pieces of paper printed with our anti-war designs. At that time, our methods and equipments were very basic. We had no proper t-shirt press, used water-based inks and large pails of water to soak and wash of the screens. This of course, proved quite messy and unproductive.

This inspired us to the idea of providing proper live screenprinting which could meet the demands of a crowd and yet retain superior quality. Thus, Ambigram Press was formed to perform live at events as well as offer custom t-shirt screenprinting with the help of proper equipment, inks and a renewed passion!

Visit www.ambigrampress.com

Why we need your help

We need an extra push as we have exhausted our individual contributions to the establishment and we are in need of more support for our operation. Being a new start-up, independant business, this extra help will go to the funding of these two essential items:

  • A flash cure (S$ 1300 / USD$ 1060)

This flash cure is essential to our screenprinting process especially in our ‘live event’ situations. Instead of using water-based inks like our first live screenprinting event last time, we plan to use plastisol inks which do not air dry thus preventing the ink to dry on the screen. The flash cure will ‘heat’ the plastisol print on the tee to make it semi-permanent. This is extremely useful for us as we would no longer need a water source for events to clean the screens everytime it gets clogged when the inks dry on it. As we also plan to hold workshops and demos for students, artists and screenprint enthusiasts in the future which could stretch for at most 2-3 hours per session, plastisol is the ideal ink to use for this situation and the use of plastisol means a flash cure is needed. We plan to purchase this flash cure from this local vendor. The price is also listed there.

Vastex F-1000 Flash Cure

  • An entry level dryer (S$ 2000 / USD$ 1620)

The dryer speeds up our curing process to ensure that the proper curing of the plastisol orders are done. At the same time, productivity on our orders are increased as we do not have to tend to the manual process of curing individual tee shirts. With the belt dryer, we could easily proceed and concentrate on our screen printing process, and allow the conveyor belt on the dryer to cure the inks fully. This would mean we would not have to individually check each and every single shirt if they are properly cured, thus eliminating bad printed jobs. For live events, this dryer will be very useful and efficient when faced with a large crowd. We plan to purchase this entry level D-100 dryer from this overseas vendor as there are no local distributors for this product. The price is also listed there.

Vastex D-100 Conveyor Dryer

 

Our total equipment cost inclusive of the admin fees/charges will be at a grandtotal of USD$2800. And if we do achieve exceeding our campaign target, we will channel the remaining proceeds to funding of additional shirts/inks/equipment. 

 

With the help of your contributions, you can choose the perks listed on the right hand side and at the same time, it will help us secure the essential screenprinting equipments needed to fulfill your pledge and realise our potential to educate the community on live t-shirt screenprinting!

Also, with your help and upon completing our fund target, we would purchase these essential equipments immediately and will update each and every contribution through email and social media on the progress of purchase. We will start to process the perk orders and print your t-shirts with all the new acquired equipments that you have helped fund!

We are pleased to add that ALL contributions will be listed on http://www.ambigrampress.com

 

Please be patient with us as we fulfill these pledges as we are just a small business and only rely on 4 of us to print these orders. Rough estimate on each t-shirt pledge will be around 1-2 weeks for local and 2-3 weeks for international. Please also note that the prices for perks at the right hand side column are in US currency. ($USD)

Thank you for visiting our campaign and for your kind attention!

Contact us at enquiries@ambigrampress.com

 

Also visit www.ayudos.com

story:
Artificial Creativity

Technology, like art, is a soaring exercise of the human imagination. 
Daniel Bell

Artificial Neural Networks are a kind of Artificial Intelligence (AI) that is being applied to everything from speech recognition to predicting the stock market. We want to use Artificial Neural Networks to create new and unique art that is truly 'inspired' by existing masterpieces and amazing images.

As a software engineer who has already gained years of commercial experience with different aspects of this new and fascinating technology I am excited to harness it for something beautiful. Thus far it has only been utilized in more sterile applications such as financial market predictions… be a part of turning Artificial Intelligence technology into Artificial Creativity!

The Plan

We'll create a series of Artificial Neural Networks and 'inspire' them with existing photos, paintings, textures and possibly even music and sounds. Then we'll apply them in different combinations to various images and colour palettes to create totally unique artwork.




Some of the perks (as detailed to the right) will let you select an artwork from a series, select a totally unique artwork, and some to even collaborate with us on the inspirations used to create your unique piece.

It is important to note you'll get to pick your artwork (through an online 'store') from a range with different inspirations and different colour palettes so you can receive something you really love!

We'll also create a special Neural Network so that the computer will design it's own signature to be proudly used on every artwork created. All of the perks even give you a vote so that you can help us pick the best signature!



What's involved

The art challenges the technology, and the technology inspires the art. 

John Lasseter

The human brain is a huge neural network running at incredible speed. Computers can't quite manage that so there's some technical hurdles involved with the project:

  • Developing the neural networks to examine and create the art
  • Computing resources to run the networks because it does take a lot of processing power

There's also the time required to really nurture the project and the costs involved with delivering the magnificent results, printed on stretched canvas etc.

Why do it?

The empires of the future are the empires of the mind. 
Winston Churchill

People seem to think that technology and art are almost incompatible but technology is a huge opportunity! We want to utilise the power of computers to create new, exciting and unique art that is a result of genuine artificial creativity. 

Get involved and become a patron of something really special. Depending on the perk you get a chance to own a unique and beautiful piece of artwork as well!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign then please share it with all your friends and family to give us the best chance of success. 

We really want the opportunity to create something special with your help!

People seem to think that technology and art are almost incompatible but technology is a huge opportunity! We want to utilise the power of computers to create new, exciting and unique art that is a result of genuine artificial creativity. 
Get involved and become a patron of something really special. Depending on the perk you get a chance to own a unique and beautiful piece of artwork as well!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to the campaign then please share it with all your friends and family to give us the best chance of success. 
We really want the opportunity to create something special with your help!

story:
We are the Wasatch Wordsmiths, a small group of poets voted via poetry slam to represent outer Salt Lake City, Utah, at the 2013 National Poetry Slam.  This unique group of poets, consisting of Joseph Kyle Rogan (JoKyR), Tami Porter-Jones, DeAnn Emett, Adam Love, and Gray, are joining forces and combining their unique writing styles to make the Wasatch Front and Utah proud!  We spend all year writing, performing and competing in our community. We also volunteer and perform for other organizations throughout the year to help further causes like The Road Home, The Rape Recovery Center, Slutwalk and more.

Now, we need your help to take our art to the next level. Help us get to Boston and compete against other teams across the country. Help us show why the Utah poetry and art community is so phenomenal. You can help put us on the map!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make it to nationals, we have to pay for:

  • Registration ($500)
  • Plane tickets for five people
  • Hotel room(s) in the beautiful (but expensive) city of Boston
  • Food while we’re there, so we don’t starve (we are willing to eat Ramen Noodles to make this happen)

Besides our undying loyalty and appreciation, we have set up a reward system for your donations that include chapbooks, souvenirs from Boston and even a private show within 100 miles of Salt Lake.

The Impact

This is the first time two teams from Utah will be heading to nationals. Members of the Wasatch Wordsmiths have previously represented Utah on semi-finals and finals stages at national events in the past.

While attending the National Poetry Slam, our Wordsmiths will be attending clinics and workshops to improve as writers, performers, and community organizers.  Poets who are part of the Wordsmiths have already put in a lot of time in helping out the community through teaching, workshopping, community action, and a variety of other ways, and attending the National Poetry Slam will teach us effective strategies and methods for positive growth in SLC and Utah.

Other Ways You Can Help

Attend our local poetry slams in Salt Lake City, Riverton and Ogden, as well as the U of U and Westminster.  Keep your eyes out for the various artistic events coming up, such as the Urban Arts Festival and the Utah Arts Festival. This site will be you source for updates on upcoming performances and events.  Many of us have chapbooks for sale individually, as well as an upcoming team chapbook set for release soon!
 
Share our link on your Facebook, Twitter us, Tumblr us. You can link us from this page or share this link on any social media sites: http://www.tinyurl.com/wasatchnats

story:
ZionNoiz 2017 Effigy Burn

    By funding even a small donation, we can build another beautiful Effigy Burn, and there are some amazing perks to be had while helping us fund this piece of art!

    What We Need & What You Get

    • We will be putting these funds towards the Effigy Burn at Zion Noiz Music & Arts  Festival 2017.
    • You will receive shower tokens at the festival, while T-Shirts, Tickets, and Stickers will be mailed out.

    If we do not reach our full goal, we will still be putting these funds towards the burn! Any donation matters!

    The Impact

    ZionNoiz is making a difference in our communities, through emphasizing high-quality music, art, and community initiatives. 

    • 2013 - Zion Noiz Founded
    • 2014 - First Headliners/Two Day Event
    • 2015 - First International Headliners & Move to Metis Crossing 
    • 2016 - Two Stages Opened and First Year of Effigy Burn
    • 2017 - Something Really Special...

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • If you are inspired by this event, we would love to have you join with us in making it happen as a volunteer!

story:
The Resistor 2.0! Campaign

Resistor, an arts event space in Chicago, has enjoyed a whirlwind 10 months in business since opening last fall! Artists and musicians, whether world-renowned or just starting out, have performed, shown their work, and touched the lives of so many people in the short amount of time since Resistor opened its doors on October 21, 2016. Through art classes (drawing and painting), people have been inspired to create with renewed or newly-found vigor. Through performance nights and affordable space rental, Resistor has provided a springboard in which groups and individuals have transformed its four walls with their own visions and celebrations. 

A little over a month ago, Resistor owner/founder Rani Young was told that the lease on the current space would not be up for renewal in the fall. After the devastating news sunk in, she regrouped and set out to find a new space in which to continue her commitment to supporting the Chicago creative community. A new and fantastic space was quickly (and miraculously) found, and daily efforts are being put into preparing to open up the new location on September 8, 2017!! 

With the goal of continuing the arts programming and classes that were already scheduled for dates into 2018, as well as booking new and exciting performances and events, Rani is seeking funds to do the following:

- Pay for the unexpected costs of moving and purchasing supplies for setting up the new, larger space. This includes: moving van/truck rental; paint and painting supplies; larger PA speakers, retail display cases (art supplies and music accessories—cables, etc.—with be available for purchase); lighting and modifications to existing electrical work; and hardware and lumber which will be used to build low walls/partitions, storage areas, a modular riser/stage, and shelving.

- Help to offset lost revenue from business closing for two weeks during the final move/space prep, plus some loss of business due to two months of interruptions of normal functioning while space location and build-out began and continue (through September 8).

- Pay off the debt incurred from the build-out of the first location, which included constructing an art studio, office, and kitchenette within the original open space. 

- Provide a financial pad for future months to help cover the slightly higher rent in the larger space.

 

A Personal Note from Rani

Since sharing the news of the loss of Resistor's original location, I have been overwhelmed with the support of so many friends of the business—people who have performed or visited the space or followed my journey on social media since building my first walls at the original location (first time I've ever wrangled a chop saw, hung a door, installed drywall, or wired a chandelier!). A vibrant community has grown up around Resistor since its opening day, and this community has shown its caring in many ways—offers of assistance and labor, equipment, goods, time and talent, plus so many ideas and insights. Thank you to all who have stepped forward. I can’t thank you enough—each and every one of you—for the level of support you have shown, and for your talents and warmth. For those of you who would like to provide financial support to help me over this transitional hump, I’d like to give back through discounted dollar-for-dollar credit toward future interactions with the new space. Listed with this campaign are various reward levels/perks which you can use at any time in the future (no expiration date). Thank you for taking the time to review this campaign and for your continued goodwill. May it come back to you tenfold. I look forward to seeing you all at the new space! Onward and upward!! <3

 

Learn More About Resistor and its Founder

To learn more about Resistor--its goals and purpose--please visit www.resistorchicago.com. To learn more about its founder, Rani Young, go to www.resistorchicago.com/about  and scroll down to "The Her-Story of Resistor." To view events and photos of the original space, and to read reviews, please visit the Facebook page at  www.facebook.com/resistorchicago. 

 

Other Ways to Help

Please feel free to share this campaign via your networks and social media, plus Indiegogo's sharing tools. If you would prefer to volunteer time or services, please email resistorchicago@gmail.com. Thank you all for your help!

story:
What is RaisingRaj?

RaisingRaj Campaign is about creating and supporting various health, environmental, creative, entrepreneurial and society improving fundraising benefits. RaisingRaj is a charitable event planning company that thrives off of supporting foundations and causes who thrive off of supporting our communities around the nation! Our purpose is to create and curate any type of fundraising event that will benefit a specific cause at hand or support any charitable foundation. As a young company we intend to  embark on all avenues of planning however for now our main focus is putting together Los Angeles’s most memorable fundraisers you have ever attended.

 

Raj’s Story

The purpose of this fundraiser is to support a special cause that is very dear to me. My son Josiah Raj Michael was born at 6 months (26 weeks) weighing 2 pounds 3 ounces at birth. During a regularly scheduled doctors visit, I learned that my ultrasound results confirmed my 21 in a half week old fetus’s foot was sticking out of my uterus and into my birth canal, I was immediately hospitalized. After three in a half weeks of restricted bed rest, laying in Trendelenburg position my water broke leaving my son and I exposed to a high risk of bacterial and viral infections. Due to doctors concerns of him being delivered at such an early age they did what they could to keep him from delivering.  We were subject to constant monitoring of red and white blood cell counts and testing for harmful bacterium in the remaining amniotic fluid. Josiah had managed to stay in for another 5 days, without showing any signs of distress. At 26 weeks on the dot which, doctors were pushing for, he was delivered by way of caesarean. He spent two months in the NICU before he could come home to develop in a normal environment. Undergoing strenuous breathing treatments due to his lungs being underdeveloped, a series of blood transfusions because he could not produce blood cells on his own at such a young age, and constant organ testing, was the most helpless feeling and experience that a parent could face. For most of those who know him would never imagine that this would be his beginning story through his journey of life. At 16 months Josiah is healthy and growing strong.  My family and I got to witness what most do not and got to see many families who shared similar but not as fortunate fate. The blessing of life and undergoing such a trying experience is the force behind RaisingRaj.

 

Raj’s Fundraiser

The event entitled "The Sound of Art" will be an artistic collaboration between two visual and musical artists. The headliners are Msison (photographer) who we will  display her photos in an art gallery exhibit and Intricate Sound (Musical Producer & Engineer) who will play and reveal intimate thought for the engineering of his music. Geared towards all people and attracting the attention of those who have interests in underground and mainstream music, enjoys viewing art in different forms, fashion forward, foodie, (social network generation).

 

                             

  MSISON

                 

                                   INTRICATE SOUND                               

     

   

How Raj will use your Donations

Proceeds for this fundraiser will build a stable foundation to create and curate different types of events that raise funds for many organizations and causes around the world. A portion of proceeds will also be presented to The Charity Organization March of Dimes, which promotes and raises funds for research and community programs for keeping our babies and children healthy with emphasis on supporting the proper care for babies born prematurely.

 

What Raj asks of you

Even if you cannot make it out we know you will be there in spirit. You could contribute money towards the actual event or raise money to support future efforts of RaisingRaj. You could also spread the word by telling everyone you know about “The Sound of Art Benefit” through Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, Pinterest, email, phone calls, or just stick your head out the window and yell. We appreciate anything and everything you can do, and for the time taken to enlighten yourself on the efforts of Raising Raj and “The Sound of Art Benefit”.

story:
I was recently accepted into the Joomchi Paper Class at Haystack Mountain School of Crafts.  This is a two week, intensive class in Deer Isle, Maine where I will learn this traditional Korean technique of layering and agitating Hanji paper into strong, textural surfaces and forms.  Lately I have been branching out from strictly feltmaking by taking printmaking classes and incorporating other fibers like paper into my artwork (see image above for an example).  This class seems like a perfect avenue to explore this new relationship with paper.  Besides, people describe the Joomchi process as a similar beast to feltmaking but with paper.  So it makes perfect sense, right?   

To see an example of Joomchi at it's finest, check out the instructor's website: http://jiyoungchung.com/

Haystack Mountain is a pretty idyllic place - it's right on the ocean, meals are provided, studios are open 24 hours a day.  Here's where I get earnest: I've never been able to do anything like this before.  This will be an incredible experience for me both personally and artistically.  And of course I can't do it alone so...  

Your donation will pay for the tuition and materials for the class.  I have created some incentives to get you in the donating mood.  I hope that these items will show you my thanks for helping to send me to Haystack!  Any money that is donated OVER the goal will go towards buying supplies and gas money to drive to Maine.

Thanks once, twice, and three times for just getting this far!

story:
We’re representing the photographers of the 2011 class 

at the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York City. 



It's standard practice for a class to hold a gallery show at the end of their four years to exhibit their thesis projects. Most art schools in New York provide a space for their students to do this, but FIT being a state college, this is not offered to us. 



Therefore in order to show our work we are forced to rent an outside gallery space. This is an extremely costly undertaking. The space alone costs close to $5,000, and this doesn't include some of the other expenses such as framing, printing, mounting, and lighting. 



We're an extremely talented and diverse group, with work ranging from fashion, fine art, documentary, portraiture, and food to name a few. We know that our show can be amazing, and all we're looking for is the chance to unveil our thesis projects in a professional space.


Here's where you come in, and here's what you get for your support:


$25 gets a Thank You on the show’s website. 


$100 gets you listed as a sponsor on the Thank You wall at the show.


$150 gets you everything listed above, plus a 16 x 20 print.


$200 gets you everything listed above, plus a private viewing at the gallery with the photographers. 


Please consider donating whatever you can. With your help, we can make our exhibition amazing!


Thank you!

story:
Summary

Hi!  My name is Roy, I am halfway through my MFA (Masters of Fine Arts) program at the University of Lethbridge, in Southern Alberta, Canada, and I am in the process of putting together my thesis project - to be completed by July 2015.

The project I am working on is about experimenting with sound, as a way to explore communication with others, by making relationships "visible", through sound collaborations.

The reason why I have created a fundraising campaign is simple.  There is a lack of acoustically-designed spaces setup for experimentation and recording at the University - in fact zero.  I am trying to secure the funds necessary to, not only design and build such a space, but also stock it with the necessary equipment (instruments, microphones, etc).

The goal is to have this up and running by September, and have it be offered as part of the facilities available to the undergraduate students in the Fine Arts Dept, in the same way that printmaking, sculpture, and photography are facilities offered.  The payoff is twofold: I begin work on my MFA thesis project while expanding the facilities offered to undergrads.

With your help, I will be able to purchase the necessary equipment and materials to get this project space off the ground!  At the end of the day, you will be helping me offer the opportunity for youths to experiment in a positive and constructive manner, at a time when such investment is most valuable and impactful.


The Deal

THE COSTS:

40% - to the purchase of recording equipment.  This will include:

  • microphones, mic stands, patch cords, 16 or 24 channel mixer, recording software (Abelton, or like), a computer dedicated to the recording studio.
30% - to the purchase of music equipment.  This will include:

  • 1 guitar amp, 1 bass amp and 1 drum kit (as standbys), various instruments  (wind, reed, percussion), effects pedals.  And, hopefully more as a need is felt.

30% - to transforming a space inside the University of Letbridge - which is essentially a long concrete box - into an acoustically designed space. 

  •  As I mentioned, there is a lack of usable space at the University, so not only does the experimental sound studio have to be acoustically designed, but it also has to be built in a way so that the space can be easily packed up when needed with as small a footprint as possible.  This is the design challenge.


THE PRIZE:

I have decided to sell the t-shirts I made for last year's Supercrawl (2013) in Hamilton, ON:  http://www.supercrawl.ca/

Summertime is here...At Last!  And everyone could use an extra t-shirt for this season!  Whether its a shirt to wear in the heat, or a shirt to wear while doing yard work or landscaping.  Maybe there's a garage to clean out this summer, or maybe an automobile to do some work on.  Or maybe its a shirt to wear in the studio while you make a mess of your clothes.  Whatever the job, I've got just the t-shirt for you!

As part of the project I built for Supercrawl, I also did a collaboration with Becky Katz to create these t-shirts I'm offering.  The shirts were screenprinted at Centre 3 (http://centre3.com/centre3upgradesite/).  The t-shirts are in both black and white, with an image of a pentagon and triangle screen printed on the front; the form is a reference to the shape of the structure I built for Supercrawl.  Each screenprinted image differs slightly.  T-shirts are only in Medium and Large, and people who make a donation of $45 - $55 will receive a t-shirt while they are still available!

I will also be making original photo collages available in postcard format (4"X 6") through out this funding campaign (which ends June 30th).  Each week there will be a new collage to choose from, with varying funding incentives.

The Impact

The impact is simple:  Give people more opportunities to express themselves creatively - and to interact with their reality on a creative level - and see what good comes from it!

Ways to Help

Maybe you don't want a t-shirt, but know someone who would like it as a gift.  Or, if you can't make a contribution, but feel this is a worthwhile effort to support, then feel free to copy the URL to this page and forward it to your friends.  Please help me spread the word if you support my project!  Thank you.
story_txt:
SummaryHi!  My name is Roy, I am halfway through my MFA (Masters of Fine Arts) program at the University of Lethbridge, in Southern Alberta, Canada, and I am in the process of putting together my thesis project - to be completed by July 2015.The project I am working on is about experimenting with sound, as a way to explore communication with others, by making relationships "visible", through sound collaborations.The reason why I have created a fundraising campaign is simple.  There is a lack of acoustically-designed spaces setup for experimentation and recording at the University - in fact zero.  I am trying to secure the funds necessary to, not only design and build such a space, but also stock it with the necessary equipment (instruments, microphones, etc).The goal is to have this up and running by September, and have it be offered as part of the facilities available to the undergraduate students in the Fine Arts Dept, in the same way that printmaking, sculpture, and photography are facilities offered.  The payoff is twofold: I begin work on my MFA thesis project while expanding the facilities offered to undergrads.With your help, I will be able to purchase the necessary equipment and materials to get this project space off the ground!  At the end of the day, you will be helping me offer the opportunity for youths to experiment in a positive and constructive manner, at a time when such investment is most valuable and impactful.The DealTHE COSTS:40% - to the purchase of recording equipment.  This will include:microphones, mic stands, patch cords, 16 or 24 channel mixer, recording software (Abelton, or like), a computer dedicated to the recording studio.30% - to the purchase of music equipment.  This will include:1 guitar amp, 1 bass amp and 1 drum kit (as standbys), various instruments  (wind, reed, percussion), effects pedals.  And, hopefully more as a need is felt.30% - to transforming a space inside the University of Letbridge - which is essentially a long concrete box - into an acoustically designed space.  As I mentioned, there is a lack of usable space at the University, so not only does the experimental sound studio have to be acoustically designed, but it also has to be built in a way so that the space can be easily packed up when needed with as small a footprint as possible.  This is the design challenge.
THE PRIZE:I have decided to sell the t-shirts I made for last year's Supercrawl (2013) in Hamilton, ON:  http://www.supercrawl.ca/Summertime is here...At Last!  And everyone could use an extra t-shirt for this season!  Whether its a shirt to wear in the heat, or a shirt to wear while doing yard work or landscaping.  Maybe there's a garage to clean out this summer, or maybe an automobile to do some work on.  Or maybe its a shirt to wear in the studio while you make a mess of your clothes.  Whatever the job, I've got just the t-shirt for you!As part of the project I built for Supercrawl, I also did a collaboration with Becky Katz to create these t-shirts I'm offering.  The shirts were screenprinted at Centre 3 (http://centre3.com/centre3upgradesite/).  The t-shirts are in both black and white, with an image of a pentagon and triangle screen printed on the front; the form is a reference to the shape of the structure I built for Supercrawl.  Each screenprinted image differs slightly.  T-shirts are only in Medium and Large, and people who make a donation of $45 - $55 will receive a t-shirt while they are still available!I will also be making original photo collages available in postcard format (4"X 6") through out this funding campaign (which ends June 30th).  Each week there will be a new collage to choose from, with varying funding incentives.The ImpactThe impact is simple:  Give people more opportunities to express themselves creatively - and to interact with their reality on a creative level - and see what good comes from it!Ways to HelpMaybe you don't want a t-shirt, but know someone who would like it as a gift.  Or, if you can't make a contribution, but feel this is a worthwhile effort to support, then feel free to copy the URL to this page and forward it to your friends.  Please help me spread the word if you support my project!  Thank you.

story:
dans certaines parties du monde,
des gouvernements néo-libéraux
reprennent le pouvoir,
au nom de la défense de la liberté d'expression
et du libre exercice de la foi
pourtant c'est elle, la même foi,
qui oblige de cacher ses femmes.


des viols, des massacres,
des tortures, des enlèvements,
des lynchages, des exécutions,
en nom de la foi et de la morale,
évangélique ou islamique,
en Afrique et en Amérique.


vue cachée

qui contrôle qui ?

C'est un projet graphique qui vise à susciter la réflexion sur le contrôle des individus et de leur identité. En particulier, le contrôle exercé par les institutions gouvernementales des États (pseudo-)démocratiques et par des doctrines religieuses fondamentalistes. Ce sont des types différents d'oppressions (celles de l'État et celles de la religion), mais qui se manifestent de façon similaire : par le contrôle identitaire des individus.

C'est un projet artistique qui questionne :
les  identités officielles réductrices,
les codes de conduite,
la catégorisation des personnes,
les catalogues de visages,
la surveillance et la censure.

C'est un geste collaboratif qui utilise de nouvelles formes de communication sur l'Internet (systèmes de communication en direct, réseaux sociaux, financement participatif, etc ) comme exercice d'une nouvelle forme de mobilisation. Une communauté qui se rassemble pour appuyer la réalisation des images thématiques du projet et sa circulation. Une mobilisation citoyenne contemporaine. 

Contribuer financièrement à ce projet permettra la production d'images thématiques et de pièces graphiques sur 3 supports : cartes postales, affiches et t-shirts.


Tous les itens peuvent être envoyés à des adresses civiques valides (et complètes) partout au monde. Les délais de livraision peuvent varier selon le système de poste local.

Devenir collaborateur signifie une reconnaissance de la nécessité (pour ne pas dire l'urgence) d'une réflexion sur l'espace que l'État et que les religions occupent dans le tissu social contemporain. En contrepartie au don versé, les collaborateurs du projet reçoivent des quantités variables des pièces graphiques (des cartes postales, des affiches, des t-shirts) du projet vue cachée. On peut les conserver pour soi-même ou les offrir à d'autres en cadeau, contribuant ainsi à la multiplication de l'effet de sensibilisation.

Initialement créé pour participer à l'exposition Passeport-Dislocation du Centre DareDare 2014 (www.dare-dare.org/fr), le projet vue cachée a acquis une vie autonome. À partir de nouvelles orientations dans les principes et les stratégies d'action, le projet vue cachée devient plus collaboratif qu'avant. Maintenant, il est possible de commander des cartes postales présentant votre propre photo dans le cadre de la collection vue cachée. Il suffit d'envoyer une photo en format passeport pour recevoir 4 cartes postales exclusives à votre effigie, pour seulement 30 $. 

qui cache, cache pourquoi?

motivation et impact

  • stimuler des réflexions autour du contrôle institutionnel des individus et de leur image, par l'État ou la religion.
  • encourager la participation du public à un projet artistique collaboratif à l'échelle mondiale.
  • Impliquer le public dans le processus artistique et lui offrir la possibilité de participation active dans la diffusion du discours du projet.
  • provoquer des questionnements autour des mécanismes de contrôle, qu'ils soient visibles ou dissimulés ; traditionnelles, moraux ou autres...
  • exister au tant qu'instrument pour le débat sur ​​le type de société que nous voulons individuellement et collectivement. 
  • en termes symboliques, résister aux oppressions institutionnelles (de l'État et de la religion ) comme la censure, la persécution et la détention pour des raisons politiques, les mesures xénophobes, les viols, les mutilations et la torture au nom de la foi.
  • offrir une contribution au débat sur ​​le contrôle du corps des femmes et des hommes, surtout sur la sexualité et la reproduction, les identités et les désirs… le contrôle des désirs ! ceux des jeunes, et des vieux, ceux des gais et de prêtres...
  • valoriser la diversité ethnique et culturelle.
  • déclencher le désir d'un monde plus libre : un monde aux vues libérées.

besoins financiers



Pour informations sur Alvaro Marinho, s’il vous plaît, consultez: 

alvarodesigner.ca

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________



em algumas partes do mundo, 
governos neo-liberais 
retomam o poder, 
em nome da liberdade de expressão 
e do livre exercício da fé 
no entanto, é a mesma fé, 
que obriga a esconder suas mulheres  

estupros, massacres, 
tortura, sequestros, 
linchamentos e execuções, 
em nome da fé e da moral, 
evangélica ou islâmica na África e na América.

vue cachée

É um projeto gráfico que visa estimular a reflexão sobre o controle dos indivíduos e sua identidade. Em particular, o controle exercido pelas instituições governamentais dos estados ( pseudo-) democráticos  e doutrinas religiosas fundamentalistas.

São  tipos diferentes de opressão (a do Estado e a da religião ) , mas que se manifestam de forma semelhante : o controle da identidade das pessoas.

Um projeto que questiona:
as identidades oficiais  redutoras,
os códigos de conduta,
a categorização de pessoas,
os catálogos de rostos,
a vigilância e a censura.

Uma experiência de arte colaborativa que utiliza novas formas de socialização na Internet (sistemas on-line de comunicação , redes sociais, crowdfunding , etc ) como um exercício de uma nova forma de mobilização. Uma comunidade que se reúne em torno da realização de imagens temáticas do projeto e sua circulação. Uma nova forma de engajamento cívico contemporâneo. 

Contribuir financeiramente com o projeto permite a produção de imagens temáticas sobre 3 suporte gráficos: cartões postais, cartazes e camisetas .

(ver imagens acima)

Colaborar com o projeto significa  reconhecer a necessidade (se não urgência) de uma reflexão sobre o espaço que Estado e religiões ocupam no tecido social contemporâneo. Em troca da doação feita, colaboradores do projeto recebem quantidades variadas das peças gráficas produzidas (postais, cartazes, t -shirts). Elas podem ser mantidas para si ou podem ser ofertadas como um presente para pessoas queridas, contribuindo, assim, para a multiplicação do efeito de sensibilização.

Originalmente criado para participar na exposição Passaporte Dislocation do Centro DareDare 2014 ( www.dare-dare.org/fr ) , o projeto vue cachée adquiriu uma vida independente. À partir de nova orientações nos  princípios e nas estratégias de ação, o projeto se torna mais colaborativo do que antes. Agora é possível encomendar cartões postais com sua própria foto como parte da coleção do projeto vue cachée . Basta enviar uma foto de passaporte para receber 4 cartões postais exclusivos com a sua imagem por apenas $ 30 (dolares canadenses).

motivação e impacto

• estimular reflexões sobre o controle institucional dos indivíduos e de suas imagens, pelo Estado ou pela religião.

• incentivar a participação pública em um projeto de arte colaborativo e global.

• envolver o público no processo artístico e oferecer a possibilidade de participação ativa na propagação do discurso do projeto.

• provocar questionamentos em torno dos mecanismos de controle , seja visíveis ou dissimulados ; tradicionais, morais ou outro.

• existir como um instrumento para o debate sobre o tipo de sociedade que queremos, individual e coletivamente.

• em termos simbólicos, de resistir à opressão institucional ( Estado e religião), como a censura , a perseguição e detenção por razões políticas e religiosas, medidas xenófobas , estupro, mutilação e tortura em nome da fé.

• fornecer uma contribuição para o debate sobre o controle dos corpos e os homens das mulheres, especialmente em sexualidade e a reprodução, identidades e desejos ... e sobre o controle dos desejos ! o desejo de jovens e de velhos , das gays e dos padres...

• valorizar a diversidade étnica e cultural.

• provocar o desejo de um mundo mais livre : um mundo visões liberadas.


Álvaro Marinho é praticante e teórico no campo do design. Ele também desenvolve uma prática em artes visuais. Cursando mestrado em design, após concluir uma especialização em design de eventos na UQAM, Montreal (Canadá). Em seu background, Alvaro acumula mais de 12 anos de experiência em design gráfico, vídeo, web design e fotografia. Desde 2010, ele desenvolve projetos de design em diferentes contextos, entre outros, para o Festival de circo Montreal completamente cirque (Tohu, 2012 e 2013), e mais recentemente com Art Souterrain 2014 et Dare-Dare.

alvarodesigner.ca


________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

in some parts of the world, 
neo-liberal governments  resume power 
in the name of freedom of expression 
and free exercise of faith 
however, is the same faith, 
requiring women to be hidden 

rapes, massacres, 
torture, kidnappings, 
lynchings and executions, 
in the name of faith and morals, 
evangelical or Islamic 
in Africa and America.

vue cachée

who controls who?

Is a graphic design and collaborative project that aims to stimulate reflection about the control of individuals and their identity. In particular, the control exercised by the governmental institutions of  (pseudo -) democratic Western states and fundamentalist religious doctrines. These are different types of oppression (those of the state and of religion), but that manifest similarly : the control  of people's identities.

A project raise questions on:

reductive official identities,
codes of conduct ,
categorization of people,
faces catalogs,
surveillance and censorship.

It's a collaborative art experience that uses new forms of socialization on the Internet ( online communication systems , social networks, crowdfunding , etc.) as an exercise of new forms of mobilization. A community that gathers around the realization of cue cachée thematic images. A contemporary civic engagement.

Contributing financially to the project will allow to print thematic images on 3 media formats : postcards, posters and t -shirts .

Becoming vue cachée project collaborator means the recognition of the need (if not urgency ) of a reflection on the state  and the religions presence in the contemporary social fabric. In return the donation made, project collaborator receive varying amounts of graphic pieces ( postcards, posters, t -shirts) from the project vue cachée. This prints can ben kept by oneself or be offered as a gifts to someone else, thus contributing to the multiplication effect .

Originally created to participate in the Passport Dislocation Centre exhibition DareDare 2014 ( www.dare-dare.org/fr ), the project vue cachée acquired an independent life. From new directions on its principles and its action strategies the project becomes more collaborative than before. 

Now it is possible to order postcards with your own photo ( or photo on your own) within the collection view hidden . Just send a photo passport to receive 4 exclusive postcards with your image, for only $ 30. (please, look at the perk's menu on the right-top of the page JE PARTICIPE).

motivation and impact

• stimulate reflections on institutional control of individuals and their image, by the state or religion.

• encourage public participation in a collaborative global art project.

• involve the public in the artistic process and offer the possibility of active participation in the dissemination of speech project.

• provoke questions around control mechanisms , whether visible or hidden ; traditional , moral or other ...

• exist as an instrument for the debate on the kind of society we want individually and collectively.

• In symbolic terms , to resist  institutional oppression ( state and religion ) as censorship , persecution and detention for political reasons , xenophobic measures , rape , mutilation and torture in the name of faith.

• provide a contribution to the debate on the control of women's and men's bodies, especially on sexuality and reproduction , identities and desires ... and control of desires! those of young and old, those of gays and priests ...

• enhance the ethnic and cultural diversity.

• trigger the desire for a freer world : a world liberated views .


Alvaro Marinho is practitioner and theorist in the field of design. He also has a visual arts practice. He's taking a master's degree in design following a higher formation in event's design at UQAM, Montreal (Canada). In his background, he has over 12 years experience in graphic design, video, web design and photography. Since 2010, he develops projects of various design in many occasions, among others, the Festival Montreal complement cirque (Tohu, 2012 e 2013), and more recently with Art Souterrain 2014 and Dare-Dare. 

alvarodesigner.ca

In return the donation made, project collaborator receive varying amounts of graphic pieces ( postcards, posters, t -shirts) from the project vue cachée. This prints can ben kept by oneself or be offered as a gifts to someone else, thus contributing to the multiplication effect .
Originally created to participate in the Passport Dislocation Centre exhibition DareDare 2014 ( www.dare-dare.org/fr ), the project vue cachée acquired an independent life. From new directions on its principles and its action strategies the project becomes more collaborative than before. Now it is possible to order postcards with your own photo ( or photo on your own) within the collection view hidden . Just send a photo passport to receive 4 exclusive postcards with your image, for only $ 30. (please, look at the perk's menu on the right-top of the page JE PARTICIPE).
motivation and impact
• stimulate reflections on institutional control of individuals and their image, by the state or religion.
• encourage public participation in a collaborative global art project.
• involve the public in the artistic process and offer the possibility of active participation in the dissemination of speech project.
• provoke questions around control mechanisms , whether visible or hidden ; traditional , moral or other ...
• exist as an instrument for the debate on the kind of society we want individually and collectively.
• In symbolic terms , to resist  institutional oppression ( state and religion ) as censorship , persecution and detention for political reasons , xenophobic measures , rape , mutilation and torture in the name of faith.
• provide a contribution to the debate on the control of women's and men's bodies, especially on sexuality and reproduction , identities and desires ... and control of desires! those of young and old, those of gays and priests ...
• enhance the ethnic and cultural diversity.
• trigger the desire for a freer world : a world liberated views .
Alvaro Marinho is practitioner and theorist in the field of design. He also has a visual arts practice. He's taking a master's degree in design following a higher formation in event's design at UQAM, Montreal (Canada). In his background, he has over 12 years experience in graphic design, video, web design and photography. Since 2010, he develops projects of various design in many occasions, among others, the Festival Montreal complement cirque (Tohu, 2012 e 2013), and more recently with Art Souterrain 2014 and Dare-Dare. alvarodesigner.ca

story: I have just graduated university and have a tiny studio at my mum and dads house, I have a very old kickwheel in there but no kiln to fire anything I make! I am looking into doing an art therapy course to be able to work in prisons, I have always had a dream to do so! Throughout university I loved doing my craft and put everything into it, this is my chance to carry on my practice at home! This money will help me buy a kiln to be able to get my work out there and to hopefully help me raise the money I need for my next venture; A masters degree! If you cannot help with a donation please forward this to friends and family :) thank you so much!!

story:
Yes Kelvin - McMurchie Print

A great souvenir of the Yes Kelvin campaign.  Popular local artist Adrian McMurchie (www.amcmurchie.com) has been commissioned to produce this image of our campaign base - the meeting point for so much Yes Kelvin activity over the past two years.

Basic framed prints are available in A5 or A6 sizes.  Information and prices for bigger prints can be made available on request (email yeskelvin2014@gmail.com).

Prices cover the cost of print, framing, postage if necessary (collection from the campaign base can be arranged) and web handling fees.  Any surplus funds will be donated to local foodbanks.

story:
FUNDING FOR THE TEMPLE OF ASCENSION THROUGH INDIEGOGO HAS ENDED. ALTHOUGH WE HAVEN'T COME NEAR OUR FUNDING GOAL, WE ARE BRINGING A TEMPLE TO NOWHERE, SMALL AND HUMBLE, INSPIRED BY THE ORIGINAL DESIGN. 

STILL WANT TO CONTRIBUTE TO THAT EFFORT? THEN YOU CAN DIRECTLY SEND A DONATION VIA PAYPAL TO: ARLO@AWOFILM.NL

THE TEMPLE OF ASCENSION

 

IN SHORT

The Temple of Ascension is a sacred space, that facilitates and celebrates an experience of spirituality and mourning or letting go, but also wonderment and playfulness for the participants of Nowhere, Europe's regional Burn event.

It is a Burning Man-style temple, with the unique vibe and limitations of Nowhere taken into account. Inspired in its design philosophy amongst others by the architectures of Catalhuyuk, by African kasbahs, by Mesoamerican kivas, and by ascending and descending staircases. Influenced and built with wind/air and earth as its core elements. A decentred experience that celebrates Nowhere's decentred community. 

The Temple of Ascension is a visual, a sensory, a tactile and a very participatory experience. The structure itself provides a secluded oasis, or experience in itself, on the Nowhere festival grounds. Different compartments invite to be climbed onto and into, to experience, and meditate. Differently pitched wind chimes that create unique atmospheres in each compartment. The rooftops as places of relaxation, with possibility of encounters, and integral ritual parts of the temple. Because...not only does the Temple resemble a sand castle, but its practice is "sandy" as well!

 

LETTING GO IN THE TEMPLE OF ASCENSION

Nowhere is a "non-Burn" Burn event. That means that traditional Burn-temple practice - in which participants leave pictures, messages, drawings and other things in the temple to be burned and thereby "letting go" of these things - doesn't work. We have devised a practice in which participants can write their messages or drawings in sand. A participant ascends the Temple of Ascension and then descends into a compartment. In these compartments, there are containers and mounds of sand, for the participants to use. A participant can spend time in the compartment, meditate, listen to the soothing sounds of the wind chime, and then ascend with their own container of sand. On the rooftops, there are small stone "shrines", that invite participants to create their own sand canvas, to write or draw their personal message on. That sand will slowly trickle through the ceiling of the compartment, onto the wind chime. 

At the end of the week, all the trickled-down sand will be gathered in a closing ceremony. In this ceremony, we will gift all this sand back to the earth and to the wind. 

 

WHY BUILD A "CATALHUYUK/KASBAH/KIVA" SAND CASTLE-ISH TEMPLE?

Burn events are powerful emotional and spiritual experiences for most participants. Most of them need a place to reflect on their lives and their souls. Their past, present and future. Their thoughts, hopes and dreams. To leave stuff behind. To grow as human beings. A temple facilitates that. The Temple of Ascension will facilitate that. Humbled and thrilled by last year's experience of the Temple of Dissolution, we would like to gift another temple experience to the Nowhere community. An experience that is even more immersive. More powerful. More unique. We hope and expect that with your contribution, we can make that happen! 


WE NEED YOUR HELP!

The Temple of Ascension is a big structure. The total footprint of the temple is approximately 12 metres by 12 metres. The different compartments vary in height, from 2,5 metres to 5 metres high. As you can see in the picture below, the entire structure will be built with a wooden structural core, with sand-drenched burlap walls [not shown]. To ensure safety and structural integrity of the temple, we can not cut corners, especially not for a structure that needs to withstand a week in the Monegros desert climate, with participants climbing the structure and being on the rooftops. 

So, to realize our vision comes at a price. To build the temple as proposed in the above drawings and transport it to and from Nowhere, we will need a total amount of around € 10,000.- [ten thousand euros]. None of the crew will benefit financially in any form. We buy our own tickets, we pay for our own transport, and we pay for an extra week of survival in Monegros pre-event to build the Temple of Ascension. Gifting our soul, time, and energy in creating this temple. All the money is for materials and transport.

This breaks down like this:

  • Structural wood [framework, enforcing beams in framework, plywood coverings for ceilings and safe wall coverings on top level, ceiling beams, safety railings on top of the compartments]: € 4974.85
  • Burlap wall coverings: € 836.55
  • Rounded and half rounded lumber for ladders: € 902.00
  • Material for five wind chimes, including rigging: € 825.00
  • Construction hardware [fasteners; screws, nuts, bolts, washers, etc.]: € 550.00
  • Lighting: € 550.00
  • Transport [truck cargo transport to/from Nowhere; 5 tons of material]: € 2145.00

Grand total: € 10,783.40

We have already secured a wholesaler discount of around 10 percent for all the wood, which will make the total costs around € 10,000.- But then there's Indiegogo and Paypal fees. Up to 10%. So, we are talking about € 11,000.-, of which a small amount will be covered by the regular Nowhere art grant of € 750. Still leaves that magic number of € 10,000.-

CROWDFUNDING IN TWO STAGES

We are breaking the crowdfunding for the Temple of Ascension down in two stages. We now request € 7500. This is for all the construction materials needed, with a deadline for the beginning of May. Depending on the total funds raised, we can judge how realistic it is to try and build the Temple of Ascension this way, in its intended, ultimate shape and size. Once we have reached that first deadline of the beginning of May, we will make a final design and estimate, and do separate crowdfunding for the transport, based on final size and weight calculations. 

There are ways to scale things down [at a price of the immersiveness of the experience], if we don't get all the funding needed. Of course, you can make this temple a done and dusted reality, by now already donating up to the total amount of € 10,000.- needed!

ALTERNATIVES

This is an impression of a scaled down version [approximately 90 percent of total costs], without the centre compartment:

And this is a quick impression of a further scaled down version [approximately 70-75% of total costs], with smaller and less compartments:

With even less funding, other alternatives are still possible. So, there are different possibilities to create the Temple of Ascension depending on the amount raised. This temple will go Nowhere, one way or another, in some form. But in this case: bigger is better!

WHAT WILL HAPPEN WITH ALL THE MATERIAL ONCE NOWHERE IS OVER?

Good question. In the current budget, transport is from The Netherlands to and from Spain. That is one possibility and leaves us with a whole bunch of wood and burlap in storage... Although not discussed in detail yet with the Nowhere organization, there could be a scenario possible that we gift all the building materials to the Nowhere community, so that in the coming years other art projects could benefit [and thereby reducing future fundraising efforts].


WHAT DO YOU GET IN RETURN?

The total costs of this project are high. We don't want to add extra costs to the budget in material perks. So, as last year, no goody bags, no tokens, no VIP treatments. However, we are grateful in advance for all your support and donations. As you can see, we have devised different non-material perks, for people attending the event, or for all you other beautiful souls that contribute to making the Temple of Ascension a reality. These range from a nice group hug, to receiving a personalized digital sand drawn thank you picture or video, or to even being a co-host of the temple's closing ceremony [note to Burn-principles purists: you don't "buy your way" into doing that, anyone can volunteer for those roles and share in the experience]. We hope you appreciate these non-material gifts as much as we would like to create this non-material, transitory experience for the participants of Nowhere.

The ultimate reward and perk would be the knowledge that you have helped and contributed to bringing the Temple of Ascension to Nowhere. To enjoy the structure if you're a participant. Or, if you're not attending, to know that Nowhere participants can live an essential part of the Burn experience because of you. What better reward is there, than gifting a true and meaningful experience to others?


OTHERS WAYS YOU CAN HELP

No money to help us out financially, but love the idea of having the Temple of Ascension at Nowhere? Apart from this financial help, we need volunteers as well! So if you can't contribute with a donation, maybe you'd like to help out yourself? Either by being part of the construction crew, help us build wind chimes, maybe being a Temple guardian on-site? Let us know how you'd like to contribute!

And please, help us get the word out there! Share our project with the world!

Thank you so much. 

Love. Hug. Namasté.

story:
“Like” us on Facebook: The Treehouse - Burning Man 2014

Why a Treehouse

Hi, I’m Mark Quinn and I am building a treehouse at this year’s Burning Man. As a kid, joy and play came naturally to me. But at 13, I was diagnosed with depression. Over the last few years, with hard work and help from my community, I’ve found my joy again and now I want to share it with the world. The Treehouse is my gift to the Burning Man community and to the world. It will serve as a reminder to all of us that a joyful kid is within each of us, reminding us to celebrate the joy of being alive. With your help, I can realize my dream and bring a living expression of joy to thousands of people.

Why Your Help Matters

This is a great opportunity to spread simplicity, expression and joy for thousands and it depends on the help of many people. This includes your financial support. To my core, I know we can pull this off together. I have a community behind me filled with experienced, smart, and passionate people who want to create a more joyful world for all of us. We can do this with your help.

What We Need & What You Get

The Treehouse structure is a magnificent tree you can hang out in, with a “trunk” and “canopy”. The $5000 needed to build the Treehouse will go directly to the materials, including scaffolding, wood boards for the trunk, a 10’ metal ladder, netting for the canopy, plywood planks for the platform and transportation to the playa. As a thank you for your contribution, you’ll receive perks like a custom designed treehouse t-shirt, a handmade treehouse necklace, and a personalized scrapbook of Treehouse moments!

The Impact

We live in a challenging world, but there is a tremendous amount of healing that comes  when we simply allow ourselves to play and have fun. Your contribution will make it possible for someone to connect with their inner child and experience that feeling of wonder that they may have lost along the way. You are directly contributing to creating a more joyful planet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond financial contributions, here are some other awesome ways to help:

  • “Like” us on Facebook: The Treehouse - Burning Man 2014

  • Share the Indiegogo link with your friends!

  • Do you know anyone who is looking for a camp at Burning Man this year? Send them our way!

  • Volunteer! (contact Mark at markaquinn2@gmail.com)

    • Do you have carpentry or construction skills? Come help us build the treehouse prior to Burning Man

    • Do you know of anyone who rents, sells or makes materials such scaffolding or plywood? We’d love your help!

Thank you!!

story:
Hello Everyone!

 Last summer, over 60 Eritrean youths equipped with disposable cameras were able to express themselves and show their country artistically to those who were not familiar with Eritrea. These youths are volunteer photographers of a non-profit project titled 100 Voices/Dimtsi. In result, the youth's photography has since been displayed in two exhibitions in America, showing their genuine views of their everyday life within Eritrea. In total, 100 Voices/Dimtsi's exhibitions has had over 800 attendees! The youth's works have been vastly praised and appreciated but there is one thing missing... the youth themselves have never been able to experience their own exhibition full of their photographic works. This summer, we are planning on sending framed images and additional curatorial supplies to Eritrea so that this can become a reality. We are asking for donations to help cover the costs of printing the images, purchasing frames, and shipping these items to Eritrea. Everything 100 Voices/Dimtsi has achieved has been mainly because of donors like you. We believe with our amazing community of supporters, we can definitely keep this art movement going!


What We Need & What You Get

For this fundraising effort, our goal is $800 USD. Below you will find what donations will cover:

  • Printing Images (40 x $7.50)- $300
  • Acrylic Frames (40 x $5 ) + Shipping ($50)- $250
  • Shipping Framed Images To Eritrea- $250


Donors who donate over $50 will receive a photographic print from any of the three Eritrean cities 100 Voices/Dimtsi took place in as well as a handwritten thank you note! (cities the youth photographed in are: Asmara, Keren, Massawa)

If we do not reach our funds goal, we will keep up with donation efforts to eventually get these photographs back to Eritrea for their proper exhibitions.


The Impact

  • This project is valuable to you as a contributor and to the world because it is vital that we, as citizens of this world, understand the different cultures and countries that we live amongst. Through photography, we are able to receive the most accurate connection to Eritrea through a very unique and impacting way.
  • To view our track record from day one, please visit our Instagram page here http://instagram.com/100dimtsi#

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people aren't able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! You can use "share tools" from Indiegogo or share one of our sites below!
  • http://instagram.com/100dimtsi#
  • https://www.facebook.com/pages/100-VoicesDimtsi/565084763504424
  • http://www.tumblr.com/blog/100dimtsi

THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!

-100 Voices/Dimtsi Team

Shipping Framed Images To Eritrea- $250
Donors who donate over $50 will receive a photographic print from any of the three Eritrean cities 100 Voices/Dimtsi took place in as well as a handwritten thank you note! (cities the youth photographed in are: Asmara, Keren, Massawa)If we do not reach our funds goal, we will keep up with donation efforts to eventually get these photographs back to Eritrea for their proper exhibitions.The Impact
This project is valuable to you as a contributor and to the world because it is vital that we, as citizens of this world, understand the different cultures and countries that we live amongst. Through photography, we are able to receive the most accurate connection to Eritrea through a very unique and impacting way.
To view our track record from day one, please visit our Instagram page here http://instagram.com/100dimtsi#

Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand that some people aren't able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!:
Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! You can use "share tools" from Indiegogo or share one of our sites below!

http://instagram.com/100dimtsi#

https://www.facebook.com/pages/100-VoicesDimtsi/565084763504424

http://www.tumblr.com/blog/100dimtsi

THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!-100 Voices/Dimtsi Team

story:
Welcome everyone,

My name is Lawrence Beckx and I am here to introduce you MUUGI.

Meet MUUGI

MUUGI is an exploration in 3D-printing technology in combination with my personal pursuits in art and design – now brought to you as unique sculptures for interior decoration.

 


It’s printed using a high quality laser sintering printer and comes in a white polyamide material. It has a slight wood like grain to its appearance and is unpolished which gives it quite a gritty velvety texture.

Design of MUUGI

The visual style of MUUGI extends from a representational style of art developed in my paintings.

I was always fascinated with complex patterns beautifully sculpted by mother-nature, expressing a mathematical (Fibonacci) sequence in their design which is found all throughout our micro and macro universe, including within our bodies.

MUUGI & golden ratio human body 

This connection is something I often symbolize in my art using the reoccurring visual theme of Horns, which is also presented in MUUGI's design.

Now, with the advancements in 3D-printing technology, I am able to materialize my personal style of design into actual objects in reality. This I find incredibly revolutionary!

3D printing technology really opens so many new possibilities in art and design and also new convenient ways to share art.

Just the tip of the iceberg

MUUGI has been quite a challenge and quite a journey. A great deal of time and costs were invested in design hours, in prototyping, printing, service, handling, raw materials, and computer upgrades.

With your help I can explore so much more!

There are loads more exciting materials I would love to work with, such as bronze, stainless steel, titanium, etc. Ultimately affording my own 3D-printer would significantly reduce costs and time. Experimenting would be much more rapid and practical. Helping me to discover and play with new ideas in creating more designs and possibly in larger sizes.

Ways to participate

  • Spread the word:  Hitting the Like /Tweet / e-mail button under the video helps contribute in spreading the word about MUUGI! One small click for you is a huge leap for campaign MUUGI

  • Postcards: 10 x 15 cm  /  4 x 6 in

  
 
+enlarge

  • Wallpapers:  2800 x 1800 px

   
+enlarge


  • 3D-Printed Sculptures:

Horns of MUUGI

MUUGI’s horns were extracted and modified to create a slight variation that was more affordable. They come in a variety of sizes.

  • Small: cm: 8.9 w x 4.3 d x 4.2 h   /   in: 3.5 w x 1.7 d x 1.7 h
  • Medium: cm: 14.7 w x 7.3 d x 7.0 h   /   in: 5.8 w x 2.9 d x 2.8 h
  • Large: cm: 22 w x 10.8 d x 10.5 h   /   in: 8.7 w x 4.3 d x 4.1 h

MUUGI

MUUGI comes in 1 size and includes a wall peg

  • Large: cm: 26.3 w x 12.9 d x 24.9 h   /   in: 10.4 w x 5.1 d x 9.8 h

 


Leave it to the pros

Shapeways will help me in handling 3D Prints &Distribution. They have proven to be very professional and reliable. Their factories are also located in US and the EU, which makes shipping very convenient in terms of costs, delivery time and especially custom duties.

 

music: 'The Moments of Our Mornings'  by Kai Engel

story:
NOW THAT WE HAVE REACHED OUR GOAL, LET'S QUADRUPLE IT!  This will help us facilitate further and expand this important work! 

AND MAKE SURE TO CHECK THE UPDATES SECTION REGULARLY!

Summary: 

Intersections Media Opportunities for Youth Society is a non-profit organization that offers an employability and life skills workshop and work experience opportunity to youth facing multiple barriers to employment.

Through the unique and familiar medium of art and digital filmmaking, and by participating in group-based projects, Intersections' participants gain the experience and confidence for long-term attachment to the workforce.  Over a one year season, Intersections services 48 youth, divided into 8 intakes with 6 youth per intake.  

HELP YOUTH PAINT!

Besides filmmaking, a significant part of the program is about dipping our hands into the visual art/creative process and into art history by creating art work that interprets the masters and that creates community dialogue.

Our mandate this year is for each intake to create a 5' x 12' painting that interprets a master.  Our latest 2 paintings interpreted Frida Kahlo's The Two Fridas...

and Manet's Olympia through the flavor of Basquiat:

The artwork is a collaborative effort providing local businesses and organizations with art work to enhance their offices and events.  The art is a component of Intersections' Digital Short Project.  We have already created art for a variety of organizations including YouthCO, BC Schizophrenia Society, and North Shore Restorative Justice Society.  The process provides us with the opportunity to work as a team and to learn valuable employment skills such as project management and client services. 

Most importantly, it is incredibly fun and rewarding!  But we need your help!  We have used up ALL OUR PAINT.  ALL OUR CANVAS.  We have literally scraped the bottom of the barrel.  And the barrel is empty!  

For only $500, we will be able to provide enough high quality supplies for our next 2 intakes at our program in order to create two new masterpieces and to continue to build client relationships.  Our end goal is that in Spring 2015 we gather all the art work created this season in an exhibit that showcases 8 large canvas (5' x 12' each).  

What We Need & What You Get

  • As mentioned: $500 will provide us with enough high quality supplies for two intakes. 
  • Supply list: 24 feet of canvas (60" wide), mural paint, brushes, gesso, china markers, newsprint,
  • We have opted for flexible funding and if we do not reach our entire goal, we will buy as many supplies as possible (hopefully not Dollar store quality).
  • If we exceed our goal, we will take "Intake 2" (the group that painted Olympia and that created the campaign video) out for lunch.  We will also treat them to a visit to the Vancouver Art Gallery.  We will also purchase extra supplies.
  • Perks: check out the wonderful perks at varying donation levels!  All art is created by local youth and support staff!

The Impact

Art is a powerful tool to facilitate connection and healing.  Your contribution will allow us to provide this opportunity to more youth on the Downtown Eastside.

Message from Katarina Thorsen, program coordinator at Intersections Media: 

Truly, all our human behaviour comes down to our need for connection.  We need to be loved, fed and heard.  We need connection to live a full and happy life.  We seek connection through interaction be it in person or online, through our work, our art; we need connection to our inner selves and within our family or community.  

I know that art doesn't cure but it is a powerful tool to facilitate healing and to build those connections. we seek  I am truly blessed to witness that healing power of art every day in my work and it is obvious that it art helps my students thrive.  Art gives them purpose, routine and awakens their passion.  Art meets their most fundamental needs- to be fed, to be loved and to be heard.  What can be greater than that?

Risks & Challenges

Our program survives on a variety of funding sources, but in this difficult economy, there are fewer and fewer funds available for simple art supplies.   We have kept our goal small and attainable for these reasons- to make it POSSIBLE.  If we do not reach our goal, we will figure out other ways!  We want to provide our participants with high quality material to create art that will live on.  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign on your social media sites.
    • Feel free to share any of our photos and posts and to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank you for your interest!

    Much love, 

    Intake 2 Intersections Media participants (Bug, Ryder, Alan, Harvey, Jesse, Michael), Alison Donnelly (youth coordinator) and Katarina Thorsen (program coordinator)

story:
Don't make them wait to earn their wings.

      My name is Jason Bullard. I am an artist with the passion to create a level of quality and unique concept worthy of the men and women I depict in my art. My "No Greater Love" art collection has grown very popular over the last 2 years. I have 60 images planned for this collection with only about 15 finished. Everyday I get new requests to produce the other images in this collection such as the EMT, Dispatcher, Female Soldier, K-9 etc. In order for me to produce the quality of art this collection demands, I need funding. 

Invest in helping me continue to create art that truly represents the sacrifice and heroism of our men and women in uniform. In a moment I will explain exactly why I am asking for your help, but first, I want you to know that I plan to offer PERKS that are beyond anything ever offered. Items that are extremely rare and unique. Currently my “No Greater Love” series is selling internationally. You can now find my art work in major retailer such as Lowes, Hobby Lobby, Kirklands, Bed Bath & Beyond and Sheels.  My work is also beginning to be licensed for other products such as mugs, magnets, metal signs, etc.  Up until now I have held all my  #1 Artist Proofs, #1 Limited Editions, #1 Master Copies, and even the Originals. It's now time to let them go in exchange for taking this series to a whole new level in concept, design and even print. I want to finish my series with a quality and product that will give our service men and women no doubt that their sacrifice is greatly noticed and appreciated by all of us. 

Here is where I will use your investment.

Travel- As you know it is very expensive to travel. This has been my biggest hold up on getting new images released. I need to visit different police departments, fire departments, military bases, etc. 

Sets- In some cases it's hard to get the image I need for a certain concept in the field. 

Photographers

Models

Costumes, Props

Printing

Advertising

I have never been one to discuss the amount of donations I make with my art, but I feel it necessary to at least tell you, my new partners, that we give a ton of art away. We also allow many organizations to use the images for fund raisers etc. Just hop over to my Facebook page "Bullard Publishing" and see what I mean.  Oh, click the "LIKE" button while your there! Come and be a part of helping me create some amazing images for those who deserve it most. 

Be sure to use the share tools here at Indiegogo to help me spread this campaign. If you can't help now, sharing is much appreciated. Maybe one of your friends will be in a position to help.


Thank You 

Jason Bullard (Artist)
